{"code":1,"isDone":false,"toInsertArticleList":[{"createdTime":"2021-05-01 14:42:04","updatedTime":"2021-05-01 14:42:04","title":"GOP state lawmaker facing criminal charges related to a video that appears to show him allowing right-wing protestors to enter the Oregon Capitol","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/oregon-gop-lawmaker-charged-allowed-right-wing-protestors-state-capitol-2021-4","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/608c916434af8d001859a67c?format=jpeg\" alt=\"oregon state capitol protests\" height=\"1996\" width=\"3992\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>In this Dec. 21, 2020, file photo, pro-Trump and anti-mask demonstrators hold a rally outside the Oregon State Capitol as legislators meet for an emergency session in Salem, Ore.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Andrew Selsky, File/AP</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>Video shows a GOP state lawmaker letting in protestors into the Oregon state capitol on December 21.</li>\n<li>Oregon Rep. Mike Nearman faces two charges in connection with the incident.</li>\n<li>Oregon Speaker of the House Tina Kotek called Nearman&#39;s actions a &#34;serious breach of public trust.&#34;</li>\n<li id=\"recirc\"><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">See more stories on Insider&#39;s business page</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>A GOP state lawmaker was charged Friday, after video appears to show him open the door to the Oregon State Capitol, allowing right-wing protestors to enter the building.</p><p>During a demonstration on December 21 of last year, surveillance video appears to show state Rep. Mike Nearman physically opening a door to the Capitol building without shutting it behind him, allowing protestors waiting outside the Oregon Capitol to quickly enter the building.</p><p>In the video, Oregon State Police later arrived to push protestors back outside and standing in the open door while facing off a crowd of protestors. Four people were arrested in the incident, which was later declared an unlawful assembly.</p><blockquote class=\"twitter-tweet blockquote\" data-lang=\"en\" data-cards=\"\" data-conversation=\"\">-Dan Tilkin  (@DanTilkinKOIN6) <a href=\"https://twitter.com/mims/statuses/1347643110969335808?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw\">January 8, 2021</a></blockquote><script async=\"\" src=\"//platform.twitter.com/widgets.js\" charset=\"utf-8\"></script><p> </p><p>On Wednesday, Oregon Speaker of the House Tina Kotek said during a press conference that it was Nearman who opened the door &#34;to let demonstrators into the building.&#34;</p><p>&#34;This was a serious, serious breach of public trust,&#34; Kotek told reporters Wednesday.</p><p>Democratic lawmakers accused Nearman of putting lawmakers and Capitol staffers in danger for his actions in a formal complaint filed in January. The complaint described Nearman&#39;s actions as &#34;completely unacceptable, reckless, and so severe that it will affect people&#39;s ability to feel safe working in the Capitol or even for the legislature,&#34; citing a report by <a href=\"https://www.opb.org/article/2021/04/30/oregon-rep-mike-nearman-criminal-charges-state-capitol-breach/\">Oregon Public Broadcasting</a>.</p><p>&#34;He let a group of rioters enter the Capitol, despite his knowledge that only authorized personnel are allowed in the building due to the COVID-19 pandemic,&#34; the complaint said.</p><p>Marion County District Attorney Paige Clarkson <a href=\"https://www.opb.org/pdf/Nearman%20charging%20document_1619824552956.pdf\">filed charges</a> against Nearman on Friday in connection with the December 21 incident.</p><p>He faces one count of official misconduct in the first degree for &#34;unauthorized exercise of his official duties, with intent to obtain a benefit or to harm another,&#34; and another count on criminal trespass in the second degree for aiding and abetting &#34;another to unlawfully and knowingly enter and remain in and upon the premises of the Oregon State Capitol.&#34;</p><p>Nearman did not immediately respond to Insider&#39;s request for comment on the charges filed by the Marion County district attorney.</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the 2021 00:36:12 +0000","feedId":22,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/608c915d34af8d001859a67b?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"0b8f73fc572c33295d4ee0a3b0ef97ef","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn42@2020_6/2021/05/01/06-42-21-288_a792979ff9b86f59.webp","destWidth":3548,"destHeight":2661,"sourceBytes":503076,"destBytes":503076,"author":"insider@insider.com (Lauren Frias)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/608c916434af8d001859a67c?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn29@2020_6/2021/05/01/06-42-24-194_0491a153a75445d9.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn14@2020_3/2021/05/01/06-42-25-622_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=lKllSzksPsA:jf8sH2HowNA:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn35@2020_5/2021/05/01/06-42-22-156_74b06f8ea1477ffd.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=lKllSzksPsA:jf8sH2HowNA:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn27@2020_6/2021/05/01/06-42-26-540_0164dbb936073acb.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn15@2020_2/2021/05/01/06-42-23-338_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=lKllSzksPsA:jf8sH2HowNA:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn25@2020_1/2021/05/01/06-42-23-192_9a1b6a1d04954f99.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/lKllSzksPsA":null},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1619851324300},{"createdTime":"2021-05-01 14:42:04","updatedTime":"2021-05-01 14:42:04","title":"ICE said to transfer women out of detention center that became infamous over allegations of forced sterilization","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/ices-irwin-county-detention-center-transfers-remaining-women-lawyer-says-2021-4","description":"<figure> \n <img src=\"https://i.insider.com/608c747734af8d001859a642?format=jpeg\" alt=\"AP20315785354138\" height=\"1250\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\"> \n  <figcaption>\n   FILE - In this Tuesday, Sept. 15, 2020, file photo, Dawn Wooten, left, a nurse at Irwin County Detention Center in Ocilla, Georgia, speaks at a news conference in Atlanta protesting conditions at the immigration jail. The Trump administration is deporting several women who have alleged they were abused or mistreated by a Georgia gynecologist at an immigration detention center, according to lawyers representing the women. \n   <p class=\"copyright\">AP Photo/Jeff Amy</p> \n  </figcaption> </img>\n</figure>\n<ul class=\"summary-list\"> \n <li>ICE has transferred out the last women at Irwin County Detention Center, according to a lawyer for former detainees.</li> \n <li>The agency did not respond to multiple requests to confirm the development.</li> \n <li>The privately run facility attracted international scrutiny last year over claims of forced sterilization.</li> \n <li id=\"recirc\"><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">See more stories on Insider's business page</a>.</li> \n</ul>\n<p>An immigration detention center in Georgia where dozens of people alleged they were subjected to unnecessary medical procedures without their consent is no longer detaining any women, according a lawyer for some former detainees.</p>\n<p>US Immigration and Customs Enforcement, including its field office in Atlanta, did not respond to multiple requests for comment.</p>\n<p>The Irwin County Detention Center outside Atlanta was the subject of a <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/house-investigating-ice-hysterectomies-complaint-2020-9\">congressional investigation</a> last year after a nurse at the privately-run facility, Dawn Wooten, alleged that women there were being sterilized without their consent.</p>\n<p>A review of medical records, as well as interviews with immigrants detained there, found that women underwent an unusually large number of gynecological procedures, many alleging they were performed without informed consent. Last year, the Mexican government confirmed at least one of its citizens had been the <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/mexico-citizen-received-non-consensual-surgery-while-in-ice-detention-2020-10\">victim of an unauthorized surgery</a> while detained there.</p>\n<p>\"Do I still have ovaries?\" one person asked after waking up from an operation, <a href=\"https://www.latimes.com/politics/story/2020-10-22/women-allege-medical-abuse-georgia-immigration-detention\">the Los Angeles Times reported</a>. \"Can I still have kids?\"</p>\n<p>ICE states it only has records of two women undergoing hysterectomies. But dozens of women are now taking part in <a href=\"https://time.com/5924021/women-lawsuit-irwin-detention-ice/\">a class-action lawsuit</a> against Dr. Mahendra Amin, the gynecologist who performed the surgeries, alleging medical malpractice that in some cases is alleged to have been tantamount to sexual assault. Amin is not board certified and LaSalle Corrections, the for-profit company that runs the detention center, has severed its relationship with him.</p>\n<p>\"ICE knew about this as far back as 2018 and yet they did nothing,\" Azadeh Shahshahani, Legal &amp; Advocacy Director at Project South, the group that publicized the whistleblower complaint in September 2020, told Insider. \"I think the explanation there is the dehumanization of the Black and brown immigrant women at this detention center.\"</p>\n<p>Some of those women have since been deported; the majority have been released; and about 80 to 100 men are still there, according to Shahshahani, who is co-counsel on the lawsuit.</p>\n<p>Removing the women who were still being detained in Irwin County is an acknowledgement, Shahshahani said, that the critics were right. Still, where some of these women have gone is not seen as much of an upgrade. </p>\n<p>The Stewart Detention Center, about 140 miles south of Atlanta, is run by CoreCivic, one of the largest for-profit prison companies. While the facility has over the years developed a <a href=\"https://prismreports.org/2021/02/02/ice-now-detaining-women-at-one-of-nations-most-deadly-facilities/\">reputation for medical neglect</a>, Shahshahani believes it's been picked - after not hosting women for more than a decade - because it lacks the infamy that now taints the Irwin County Detention Center.</p>\n<p>Detention Watch Network, a group that advocates shuttering immigration detention centers altogether, is calling for the women to be released.</p>\n<p>\"The Irwin detention center is emblematic of how the immigration detention system as a whole is inherently abusive, unjust and fatally flawed beyond repair,\" Setareh Ghandehari, the group's advocacy director, said in a statement. \"The Biden administration must shut down detention centers immediately and end detention contracts.\"</p>\n<p>As of 2019, ICE had contracts with 106 privately run detention facilities, according to <a href=\"https://www.oig.dhs.gov/sites/default/files/assets/2019-02/OIG-19-18-Jan19.pdf\">a report</a> by the Department of Homeland Security's Inspector General. The vast majority of detained immigrants are being held in for-profit ventures.</p>\n<p>During a speech Thursday, not far from the Irwin County Detention Center, activists interrupted President Joe Biden, demanding that he \"abolish private detention.\"</p>\n<p>\"Private detention centers should not exist,\" Biden responded, \"and we are working to close all of them.\"</p>\n<p>But that is not what is happening. A week after taking office, Biden <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/biden-private-prisons-executive-order-official-calls-trump-dangerous-2021-1\">signed an executive order</a> requiring the Department of Justice to phase out its use of for-profit prisons - but the order does not not extend to ICE.</p>\n<p>On Friday, <a href=\"https://www.miamiherald.com/news/local/immigration/article251034949.html\">the Miami Herald reported</a> the Biden administration is conducting negotiations with GEO Group, a private prison company, about renewing a contract to run an ICE detention center in Florida.</p>\n<p>\"They say the right thing, which is welcome,\" Shahshahani told Insider, \"but they need to follow that up with action.\"</p>\n<p><em>Have a news tip? Email this reporter: </em><a href=\"mailto:cdavis@insider.com\"><em>cdavis@insider.com</em></a></p>\n<div class=\"read-original\">\n Read the original article on \n <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=9PswNtU2hYE:q-9Buatyfzk:yIl2AUoC8zA\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA\" border=\"0\" /></a> \n <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=9PswNtU2hYE:q-9Buatyfzk:F7zBnMyn0Lo\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=9PswNtU2hYE:q-9Buatyfzk:F7zBnMyn0Lo\" href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=9PswNtU2hYE:q-9Buatyfzk:gIN9vFwOqvQ\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=9PswNtU2hYE:q-9Buatyfzk:gIN9vFwOqvQ\" border=\"0\" /></a> \n</div>\n<img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/9PswNtU2hYE\" height=\"1\" width=\"1\" alt=\"\" />","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Fri, 30 Apr 2021 22:09:43 +0000","feedId":22,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/608c748334af8d001859a643?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"bb0776fdc4e76fa5fbbc79dd0a65635a","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn97@2020_4/2021/05/01/06-42-20-976_406a1eceb192cf81.webp","destWidth":2500,"destHeight":1875,"sourceBytes":542490,"destBytes":542490,"author":"cdavis@insider.com (Charles Davis)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/608c747734af8d001859a642?format=jpeg":null,"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn14@2020_3/2021/05/01/06-42-25-622_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=9PswNtU2hYE:q-9Buatyfzk:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn1@2020_2/2021/05/01/06-42-26-098_a3bf6876a6644b5c.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=9PswNtU2hYE:q-9Buatyfzk:V_sGLiPBpWU":null,"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn15@2020_2/2021/05/01/06-42-23-338_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=9PswNtU2hYE:q-9Buatyfzk:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn32@2020_2/2021/05/01/06-42-22-156_b52b0f4f5deec7d5.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/9PswNtU2hYE":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn4@2020_3/2021/05/01/06-42-22-074_8816e8b34a642bfc.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1619851324301},{"createdTime":"2021-05-01 14:42:04","updatedTime":"2021-05-01 14:42:04","title":"A guide to SIM cards, the small chips that connect your phone to a cellular network","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/what-is-a-sim-card","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/608c561d35c46f0018c0bb1c?format=jpeg\" alt=\"sim card\" height=\"1249\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>SIM cards are tiny chips stored inside many cell phones.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Tongchai Cherdchew / EyeEm/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li aria-level=\"1\">A SIM card, or subscriber identity module, is a small card in your cellphone that connects you to the network.</li>\n<li aria-level=\"1\">Your SIM card contains your phone number, and lets you make phone calls, send text messages, and more.</li>\n<li aria-level=\"1\">SIM cards have evolved over the years and come in several sizes, including mini-, micro-, and nano-SIMs. </li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/tech-reference\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\"><strong>Visit Insider&#39;s Tech Reference library for more stories</strong></a><strong>.</strong></li>\n</ul><p>Most mobile phones rely on a small card called a <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/category/sim\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">SIM</a> (subscriber identity module) to make phone calls and send text messages. Without it, your phone isn&#39;t able to connect with the cellular network and can only function as an internet device (the lack of a SIM card doesn&#39;t prevent your phone from using Wi-Fi). </p><h2>What to know about SIM cards </h2><p>A SIM card is important because it stores your phone number and other important information. Generally, you can transfer one SIM card between two phones and the new phone will inherit your phone number without issue.</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/608c659cf22c6b00185db11d?format=jpeg\" alt=\"SD card SIM card being inserted into Android phone\" height=\"1249\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>A SIM card identifies you on the wireless network.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Pheelings Media/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>Most SIM cards are provided by phone companies, and contain some basic identifying information like serial numbers and identifying codes. These let the network know what your phone number is, and what phone carrier you use (T-Mobile, Verizon, etc.). </p><p>SIM cards can carry a great deal of data, like your contact list and text messages. If you change phones, as long as you keep the SIM card, these contacts and text messages will come with you to the new phone.</p><aside class=\"breakout-box headline-regular\"><h2><strong>Types of SIM cards</strong></h2><p>SIM cards need to fit in mobile phones, so as time has progressed, there has been a need for smaller cards as phones have become increasingly thin and filled with larger batteries and more sophisticated electronics.</p><p>Today there are several kinds of SIM cards:<br><br></p><ul><li><strong>Full SIM</strong>: No longer in use, the original SIM card was developed in the 1990s and measured 86x54mm. Despite the large size, virtually all of it was a plastic card - the actual contact surface was the same as later cards.</li><li><strong>Mini-SIM</strong>: Because the full-size SIM is no longer used, these days this is often thought of as the full or standard SIM. It measures 25x15mm and the contact surface is surrounded by a large segment of plastic.  </li><li><strong>Micro-SIM</strong>: A micro-SIM has the exact same contact surface but is smaller (15x12mm) because the plastic is trimmed away, leaving a card almost entirely of just the contact surface. </li><li><strong>Nano-SIM</strong>: This is the smallest SIM format in use today. It has a smaller contact surface, making it physically incompatible with older phones that expect a micro-SIM. It measures 12.3x8.8mm.</li><li><strong>eSIM</strong>: An embedded SIM, or eSIM, is a new, emerging format in which the SIM is embedded directly into the device and is therefore not removable. Although not widely used, the advantage of an eSIM is that it allows you to change phones without transferring SIM cards; the mobile operator transfers the account information remotely. </li></ul></aside><h2>How to remove a SIM card</h2><p>SIM cards vary in size, but they all work the same way - they&#39;re designed to be easily transferred between phones. Your phone probably came with a small SIM card removal tool (it looks like a small pin), but if you&#39;ve misplaced yours, you can use a small paperclip.</p><p>Find the SIM tray on the side of your phone and insert the SIM tool or paperclip in the hole; the tray should pop out easily. </p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/608c67adf22c6b00185db12c?format=jpeg\" alt=\"What is a SIM card 2\" height=\"1250\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>A SIM card in its tray with a SIM removal tool.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Dave Johnson/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>For more details on how to do this, see our articles on <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-to-remove-sim-card-from-iphone\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">how to remove the SIM card from an iPhone</a> or <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-to-remove-sim-card-from-samsung-galaxy-s10\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Samsung Galaxy phone</a>. If you have a different phone, no worries: The technique is almost exactly the same. If you have any trouble, check out our article on <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/why-does-my-iphone-say-invalid-sim\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">how to troubleshoot an invalid SIM</a>.</p><bi-shortcode id=\"related-article-module-end-of-article\" class=\"mceNonEditable\"><a data-type=\"5db99a37dee0194f40700a44\" data-title=\"How to find out your iPhone's cellular carrier without a SIM cardcard\" data-url=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-to-find-out-iphone-carrier-without-sim\" data-vertical=\"sai\" data-image=\"https://i.insider.com/5db9b72edee019082426e4e7\">How to find out your iPhone&#39;s cellular carrier without a SIM card</a><a data-type=\"5db72f4bdee0192221219fd3\" data-title=\"'Why does my iPhone say invalid SIM?': 6 ways to troubleshoot your iPhone and SIM card if they aren't connectingt connecting\" data-url=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/why-does-my-iphone-say-invalid-sim\" data-vertical=\"sai\" data-image=\"https://i.insider.com/5db840b2dee0193dac740773\">&#39;Why does my iPhone say invalid SIM?&#39;: 6 ways to troubleshoot your iPhone and SIM card if they aren&#39;t connecting</a><a data-type=\"600a00ed555a0408c6265a9d\" data-title=\"How to enable and use Wi-Fi calling on your Android or iPhone to make calls without cellular service\" data-url=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-to-use-wifi-calling\" data-vertical=\"sai\" data-image=\"https://i.insider.com/600afe33933f110019311168\">How to enable and use Wi-Fi calling on your Android or iPhone to make calls without cellular service</a><a data-type=\"5ecd62683ad86133445d5ae5\" data-title=\"What is Wi-Fi calling? Everything you need to know about making calls using Wi-Fi instead of a cellular connection\" data-url=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/what-is-wifi-calling\" data-vertical=\"sai\" data-image=\"https://i.insider.com/60538693f75f09001814ea78\">What is Wi-Fi calling? Everything you need to know about making calls using Wi-Fi instead of a cellular connection</a></bi-shortcode><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/what-is-a-sim-card'>Business Insider</a></div><div class=\"feedflare\">\n<a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=VYnpiwJuURI:2YjNJiioI9k:yIl2AUoC8zA\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=VYnpiwJuURI:2YjNJiioI9k:F7zBnMyn0Lo\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=VYnpiwJuURI:2YjNJiioI9k:F7zBnMyn0Lo\" src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=VYnpiwJuURI:2YjNJiioI9k:V_sGLiPBpWU\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=VYnpiwJuURI:2YjNJiioI9k:qj6IDK7rITs\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a
