Project/Shutterstock</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>The first course in the edX <a href=\"https://www.awin1.com/cread.php?awinmid=6798&#38;awinaffid=257137&#38;ued=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.edx.org%2Fmicromasters%2Fucsandiegox-algorithms-and-data-structures\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Algorithms and Data Structures</a> MicroMaster program, this class shows students how to design algorithms using basic techniques and solve different computational problems through hands-on practice.</p><bi-shortcode id=\"commerce-link\" class=\"mceNonEditable\" data-cardtype=\"button\" data-pid=\"608c337a4ba84300117181f3\" data-purchase-option=\"\">Algorithmic Design and Techniques (button)</bi-shortcode>\n\tThe Science of Parenting\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6055e6a2cad7d300183f82e9?format=jpeg\" alt=\"A baby and parent play with a drum.\" height=\"800\" width=\"1066\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>A baby and parent play with a drum.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a intended to debunk myths and opinions about best parenting practices, using science to help parents make informed decisions on factors like diet, sleep, discipline, learning, screen time, and even 14:42:04","updatedTime":"2021-05-01 14:42:04","title":"Biden administration expected to ban most travel from India to US to limit COVID-19 spread","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/biden-to-ban-most-travel-from-india-to-us-reuters-2021-4","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/606c5884a7d803001963eead?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Biden\" height=\"1000\" width=\"2000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>President Joe Biden\n<p class=\"copyright\">AP Photo/Evan Vucci, File</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>Biden is expected to announce new travel restrictions from India to the US starting May 4. </li>\n<li>The administration will bar most non-US citizens from entering the country, Reuters reports.</li>\n<li>India has reported more than 300,000 new COVID-19 cases daily for nine days in a row.</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">See more stories on Insider&#39;s business page</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>WASHINGTON (Reuters) - U.S. President Joe Biden is expected to impose new travel restrictions on India starting Tuesday in light of the COVID-19 epidemic, barring most non-U.S. citizens from entering the United States, a White House official told Reuters.</p><p>The new restrictions are on the advice of the U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention and are imposed &#34;in light of extraordinarily high COVID-19 case loads and multiple variants circulating in India,&#34; the official said. A formal announcement is expected on Friday and the policy will take effect on Tuesday, May 4 at 12:01 a.m. ET.</p><p>Biden in January issued a similar ban on most non-U.S. citizens entering the country who have recently been in South Africa. He also reimposed an entry ban on nearly all non-U.S. travelers who have been in Brazil, the United Kingdom, Ireland and 26 countries in Europe that allow travel across open borders.</p><p>The policy means most non-U.S. citizens who have been in one of those countries - and now India - within the last 14 days are not eligible to travel to the United States. China and Iran are also both covered by the policy.</p><p>Second only to the United States in total infections, India has reported more than 300,000 new cases daily for nine days in a row, hitting another global record of 386,452 on Friday.</p><p>Total deaths have surpassed 200,000 and cases are nearing 19 million - nearly 8 million since February alone - as virulent new strains have combined with &#34;super-spreader&#34; events such as political rallies and religious festivals.</p><p>Medical experts say real numbers may be five to 10 times higher than the official tally.</p><p>Other countries have imposed similar travel restrictions on India, including the United Kingdom, Germany, Italy and Singapore, while Canada, Hong Kong and New Zealand have suspended all commercial travel with India.</p><p>Permanent U.S. residents and family members and some other non-U.S. citizens are permitted to return to the United States under the order.</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the 14:42:04","updatedTime":"2021-05-01 14:42:04","title":"Lush store shelves are bare as beauty company says its experiencing major supply chain woes","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/lush-retail-bath-bomb-supply-chain-shopping-shortage-2021-4","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/608b03dd34af8d0018599fc5?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Lush shortage\" height=\"739\" width=\"828\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Shelves at a Lush store in Glendale, CA, in April\n<p class=\"copyright\">Alicia Huidor/Instagram</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>Lush customers on social media have been complaining about a lack of inventory.</li>\n<li>On social media, Lush said it is experiencing a materials shortage but expected a resolution soon.</li>\n<li>Lush did not respond to a request for comment on the specifics of the shortage. </li>\n<li id=\"recirc\"><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">See more stories on Insider&#39;s business page</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>Lush has made waves on social media in the past month for empty shelves and low online inventory. The chain says its supply chain was interrupted and a raw materials shortage affected its ability to make its bath bombs, face masks, and other cult-favorite beauty products.</p><p>Lush did not respond to requests for comment from Insider. However, the brand&#39;s North American arm is <a href=\"https://twitter.com/lushcosmetics/\">active on Twitter</a>, responding to requests and complaints from customers. </p><p>The brand started mentioning the supply shortage on Twitter towards the end of March. The first response directly mentioning the shortage was on <a href=\"https://twitter.com/lushcosmetics/status/1374075587191578636%5C\">March 22</a>, and the conversations between the brand&#39;s social media and disgruntled customers ramped up as the shortages began to affect stores as well as the brand&#39;s e-commerce platform. </p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/608b03dd34af8d0018599fc4?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Lush shortage\" height=\"819\" width=\"828\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Shelves at a Lush store in Glendale, CA, in April\n<p class=\"copyright\">Alicia Huidor/Instagram</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>And on Thursday, April 29, the brand <a href=\"https://twitter.com/lushcosmetics/status/1387759971585167368\">told a customer</a> on Twitter that the shortage happened due to an issue with the supply chain of essential oils, but that they expected a restock shortly.</p><p> </p><blockquote class=\"twitter-tweet blockquote\" data-lang=\"en\" data-cards=\"\" data-conversation=\"\">-Sandy  (@SandySensation) <a href=\"https://twitter.com/mims/statuses/1387019884740153345?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw\">April 27, 2021</a></blockquote><script async=\"\" src=\"//platform.twitter.com/widgets.js\" charset=\"utf-8\"></script><p> </p><p>Alicia Huidor, a frequent Lush customer, visited a Lush storefront in the Glendale Galleria in California recently and posted her disappointment about the empty shelves on Twitter and Instagram. She told Insider in a message that: &#34;It was so sad to see one of my favorite stores like this.&#34;</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/608b03dc35c46f0018c0b520?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Lush shortage\" height=\"1134\" width=\"828\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The exterior of a Lush store in Glendale, CA, in April\n<p class=\"copyright\">Alicia Huidor/Instagram</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>As one of Lush&#39;s head manufacturers, Dan Dresser, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/lush-factory-photo-tour-inside-the-willy-wonka-factory-of-soap-2016-9#the-factory-essentially-has-a-tiny-grocery-store-which-gets-stocked-with-produce-on-fridays-its-usually-depleted-by-the-following-wednesday-and-restocked-by-friday-13\">told Insider in 2016</a>, &#34;LUSH keeps its inventory extremely small to avoid over-ripening or rotting, and turnaround can be as short as 24 hours from the factory to one of the 250 North American retail stores.&#34; </p><p>This production method typically requires that items be restocked weekly. The limited raw material inventory means that an interruption in supply can be very noticeable. </p><p>The brand has not confirmed the exact nature of the interruption to its supply chain and did not respond to multiple requests for comment from Insider. It is possible that the shortages are in part due to ripple effects from the Suez Canal blockage last month. The Ever Given <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/suez-canal-reopened-supply-chain-issues-shipping-delays-experts-2021-3\">blocked shipping routes</a> from March 23 to 29, with major ripple effects for global trade and shortages of everything from coffee to furniture. </p><p>One Lush customer <a href=\"https://twitter.com/PUSSYRlOT/status/1383548280068448257\">Tweeted</a> that an associate in a Lush store cited the canal blockage as the reason for the delays, but at the store in Philadelphia, an associate cited the pandemic as the reason for the shortage. </p><p><em>If you are a Lush employee with a story to share, reach out at awilliams@businessinsider.com.</em></p><p> </p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a 14:42:04","updatedTime":"2021-05-01 14:42:04","title":"The 7 best camping stoves for backpacking trips or car camping","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-camping-stove","description":"<bi-shortcode id=\"table-of-contents-sticky\" class=\"mceNonEditable\" data-type=\"h2\">Table of Contents: Masthead Sticky</bi-shortcode><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li><strong>Camp stoves let backpackers and car campers alike brew fresh coffee and prepare their daily meals.</strong></li>\n<li><strong>The best should be highly portable and easy to light with a lighter or match, or have their own ignitor.</strong></li>\n<li><strong>Our top pick, <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00005OU9D/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&tag=biipgf_092517_best-camping-stoves-20&camp=1789&creative=9325&linkCode=as2&creativeASIN=B00005OU9D&linkId=89730c618eff78b5a1d04e654df56c388eff78b5a1d04e654df56c38\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Coleman&#39;s Classic 2-Burner</a>, is a reliable, propane-burning camp stove that epitomizes camping.</strong></li>\n</ul><p>A warm <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-sleeping-bags\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">sleeping bag</a> and <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-headlamp\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">dependable headlamp</a> are certainly vital for smart and comfortable camping, but when you&#39;re sleeping on the ground and haven&#39;t showered in days, there really is nothing like a <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-camping-coffee-makers\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">hot cup of coffee</a> on a brisk morning (with the exception, perhaps, of <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-camping-cookware\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">a hot meal</a> at the end of a long day).</p><p>Neither of these is possible, however, without access to a reliable camp stove.</p><p>With the right camp stove, not only can you expect <a href=\"https://www.insider.com/coffee-making-while-camping\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">fresh-brewed java</a> in the morning or a warm meal at night but you can rely on it for a range of uses; maybe you want to grill some fresh fish minutes after you&#39;ve pulled it from the stream, or you want to whip up a mug of hot cocoa (or a hot toddy) to sip by the campfire. If you&#39;re <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-backpacking-stoves\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">in the backcountry</a>, a stove can save you as boiling stream water is one of the best ways to ensure it&#39;s safe to drink.</p><p>Having spent over two decades car camping, backpacking, and everything in between, I&#39;ve grown to rely heavily on my camp stove. No matter how far off-grid I might find myself, a camp stove helps keep me nourished and ready to take on whatever the day has in store - be it 20 miles of hiking to my next campsite, or a day spent relaxing around a campfire. </p><p>My reliance on making sure I have a <a href=\"https://www.insider.com/car-camp-kitchen\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">proper camp kitchen setup</a> means I&#39;ve tested my fair share of camp stoves through the years - and some remain a fixture in my camp kit today. Below, I&#39;ve rounded up seven of my favorites from brands like MSR, BioLite, and Coleman, all with their own advantages across a variety of camp styles and use cases. </p><p>At the end of this guide, I&#39;ve also included some tips on <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-camping-stove#how-to-shop-for-a-camp-stove-8\" rel=\"noopener\">how to shop for a camp stove</a>, as well as <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-camping-stove#how-we-test-camp-stoves-9\" rel=\"noopener\">the testing methodology</a> I used in deciding which made the cut. </p><h3><strong>Here are the best camp stoves:</strong></h3><ul class=\"summary-list\"><li><strong>Best camp stove overall: <a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">BioLite CampStove 2</a></strong></li><li><strong>Best backpacking camp stove: <a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored\">MSR PocketRocket Deluxe</a></strong></li><li><strong>Best stove for fast boiling: <a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored\">Jetboil Flash</a></strong></li><li><strong>Best stove for travel: <a href=\"http://www.avantlink.com/click.php?tt=cl&merchant_id=e295c418-295a-447c-b265-734e25f82503&website_id=9597bdee-ce2a-4552-aa13-419b5f275c06&url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.rei.com%2Fproduct%2F830341%2Fmsr-whisperlite-international-backpacking-stove&ctc=biipgf_092517_best-camping-stovest-camping-stoves\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored\">Mr. Steak 1-Burner Infrared Portable Grill</a></strong></li></ul><aside class=\"quick-tip headline-regular\"><strong>Updated on 4/30/2021 by Rick Stella: </strong>Added the Coleman Classic 2-Burner as our pick for the best overall camp stove and checked the pricing on all models.</aside>\n<div id=\"slideshow\">\n\tThe best camp stove overall\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/608c3d5f35c46f0018c0ba6b?format=jpeg\" alt=\"91WICqfRWWL._AC_SL1500_\" height=\"1124\" width=\"1500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Amazon</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3>Easy to use, reliable, and efficient, <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00005OU9D/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_092517_best-camping-stoves-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B00005OU9D&#38;linkId=89730c618eff78b5a1d04e654df56c38\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Coleman's 2-Burner Propane Camp Stove</a> is a classic camp stove that's as synonymous with car camping as any other model in this guide.&#160;</h3><p><strong>Pros:&#160;</strong>Easy to operate, uses propane canisters which can be purchased at gas stations and grocery stores, durable, two-burner design adds versatility</p><p><strong>Cons:&#160;</strong>For car camping only (you won't be packing this thing along on a backpacking trip)</p><p>This classic two-burner propane camp stove from Coleman is <em>the</em> quintessential camp stove &#8212; I'd ask you to think of something more iconic but it'd be a waste of time because you can't. And one of the main reasons it's as recognizable as it is is because it's just plain dependable. For car campers, it doesn't get much better.&#160;</p><p>As the name suggests, the stove features two separate burners, each with its own adjustable dial for temperature control. A single propane tank fuels both burners and the stove itself comes with two wind panels that can be situated to create a contained cooking area (that, of course, blocks wind).&#160;</p><p>When not in use, the stove closes suitcase-style for easy transport, and it stores easily in a closet, garage, or in a camp tote. It's durable, too, comprised of sturdy aluminum components that can stand up to the beating normal outdoor gear takes.&#160;</p><p>If you're looking for an easy to use, versatile camp stove, there really aren't any better than this two-burner option from Coleman. Being able to cook on two separate burners is a luxury while car camping and the fact I often see this at prices under $70 makes it a highly valuable choice, even for casual car campers.&#160; &#160;</p>\n\tThe best budget camp stove\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/59c556d019d2f5a8188b49dd?format=jpeg\" alt=\"coleman\" height=\"1235\" width=\"1646\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Coleman</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3>The <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B0009PUR5E/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_092517_best-camping-stoves-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B0009PUR5E&#38;linkId=11d93cf83666782b633a6d62df14864c\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow sponsored\">Coleman Bottle Top Propane Stove</a> acts like a standard stovetop burner, and it's powerful, rugged, and well-priced.</h3><p><strong>Pros: </strong>Low price point, long burn time, easy flame output adjustment</p><p><strong>Cons: </strong>Very heavy and bulky</p><p>With camp stoves, it's easy to look at the price and think that's a steal &#8212; but you have to also factor in camp stove fuel, which some gas stations and outdoor retailers like to gouge you on. But the best field stove in the world is just a paperweight without fuel, so buy it you will, regardless of the price.</p><p>With the <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B0009PUR5E/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_092517_best-camping-stoves-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B0009PUR5E&#38;linkId=11d93cf83666782b633a6d62df14864c\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow sponsored\">Coleman Bottle Top Propane Stove</a>, those canisters of propane fuel are surprisingly low-priced &#8212; you can often get a two-pack of the <a href=\"https://go.skimresources.com?id=35871X943606&#38;xs=1&#38;url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.walmart.com%2Fip%2FColeman-Propane-Fuel-16oz-2-pack%2F20971271\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">16-ounce fuel cylinder</a> for less than 10 bucks. One such tank will burn for two hours at full blast and as long as eight or nine hours on a low setting. So if you want to make campsite risotto, go for it. Oh, and the stove itself is affordable, too.</p><p>Flame control is remarkably easy with this stove, just twist that large plastic knob all the way open for a roaring 10,000-BTU output or dial it back for hours of simmering. And thanks to the deep bowl shape and generous wind baffles, this stove will maintain a consistent burn in all but the most powerful gusts of wind. The burner is large and stable enough to accommodate an 8-inch pan or pot, so you really can almost treat it like a standard stovetop.</p><p>I used one of these stoves for several years and still keep one on hand in case the stove in my house ever has a problem or for some sort of apocalyptic nightmare during which I still wanted to cook pasta. But you'll probably never see me bringing this stove along for another hike or climb.</p><p>Why? Weight and size. This stove weighs more than two pounds, with the canister adding another three pounds or more when filled. That's heavier than some tents and sleeping pads combined. So while I highly recommend this stove for car campers or emergency preparedness, it's a poor choice for climbers or trekkers. <em>&#8212; Steven John</em></p>\n\tThe best charcoal-burning camp stove\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6074ac913e3fe7001882a363?format=jpeg\" alt=\"HeroGrill1\" height=\"3024\" width=\"4032\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Rick Stella/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3><a href=\"https://www.fireandflavor.com/products/hero-grill-system\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">The Hero Grill System</a> is an easy-to-use charcoal-burning grill that heats up in under 10 minutes, comes with a non-stick ceramic cooking surface, and allows for up to an hour of grilling.&#160;</h3><p><strong>Pros:&#160;</strong>Charcoal pods have instant light coating that makes them easy to ignite, comes with its own carrying case, bamboo cutting board, and bamboo spatula, coals stay hot for up to an hour</p><p><strong>Cons:&#160;</strong>Requires more cleanup than a normal camp stove, single-use charcoal pods are $40 for a two-pack</p><p>Almost all camp stoves use some sort of gas like propane or butane for heat, but the Hero Grill System leans on one of the most traditional forms of fuel: charcoal. And if you're a fan of using charcoal to grill at home, this is the stove you want for car camping.</p><p>The Hero Grill System relies on two main parts for operation, the grill itself which is a non-stick ceramic grill with foldable legs to prop it up, and a box of charcoal pods that slides underneath. The pods can be lit using a match or lighter and take just 10 or so minutes to completely heat up. I found that lighting just two of the corners worked well in igniting the entire box (instead of needing to light all four).&#160;</p><p>It does need to be placed on any non-combustible surface, though I used one of the picnic tables that are often placed at a campsite and it worked just fine. However, this means you shouldn't just place it on grass &#8212; I recommend packing along a small table or something similar that you can place on the ground to set the stove on top of.&#160;</p><p>Being as used to normal camp stoves as I am, I was quite impressed with the Hero Grill. It's not often you're able to make charcoal barbecued food while camping (unless you bring actual charcoal, which can be a mess), so it was a nice change of pace. I liked how easy it was to light the grill and how well it cooked everything from burgers and hot dogs to grilled vegetables.</p><p>Although cleanup is a little more involved than a normal propane stove, it still was relatively easy to just douse the charcoal before throwing the box away. I will say that a downside would be to have to replace the charcoal pod box after every use, and replacements cost $40 for a two-pack. You <em>do&#160;</em>have to replace propane and charcoal for a normal grill, but spending $20 for one hour of grilling can get expensive.</p>\n\tThe best wood-burning camp stove\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5b7ae52d0ce5f596208b4700?format=jpeg\" alt=\"biolite camp stove\" height=\"933\" width=\"1244\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">BioLite</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3>The <a href=\"https://www.avantlink.com/click.php?tt=cl&#38;mi=10248&#38;pw=184534&#38;ctc=biipgf_092517_best-camping-stoves&#38;url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.rei.com%2Fproduct%2F115523%2Fbiolite-wood-burning-campstove-2-with-flexlight\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">BioLite CampStove 2</a>&#160;cooks your meal and charges your phone at the same time thanks to a built-in, thermoelectric generator fueled by heat.</h3><p><strong>Pros: </strong>Charges small devices, built-in fans regulate heat, works with myriad accessories</p><p><strong>Cons: </strong>Getting initial fire burning can be frustrating</p><p>When you're out there in the wilderness, you shouldn't be staring at your phone; you should be looking at the stars, the mountains, or the valleys and such. That said, keeping a charged phone is important for safety &#8212; and the occasional photo.</p><p>Keeping a rechargeable flashlight fully powered is always a good idea, and those GoPro camera batteries always seem to need recharging, don't they?</p><p>Maintaining battery life in all your devices while camping means carrying battery packs, using a solar charger, or firing up something you're already likely traveling with: Your stove.</p><p>The <a href=\"https://www.avantlink.com/click.php?tt=cl&#38;mi=10248&#38;pw=184534&#38;ctc=biipgf_092517_best-camping-stoves&#38;url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.rei.com%2Fproduct%2F115523%2Fbiolite-wood-burning-campstove-2-with-flexlight\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">BioLite CampStove 2</a>&#160;is a wood-burning stove that has a built-in generator capable of producing 3 watts of electricity while the fire is hot. That's enough power to charge small devices, illuminate a Biolite lamp, or to charge the unit's internal battery for later use when the fire isn't burning.</p><p>Besides providing power, it's also a damn good stove. With a decent fire built up, the <a href=\"https://www.avantlink.com/click.php?tt=cl&#38;mi=10248&#38;pw=184534&#38;ctc=biipgf_092517_best-camping-stoves&#38;url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.rei.com%2Fproduct%2F115523%2Fbiolite-wood-burning-campstove-2-with-flexlight\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">BioLite CampStove 2</a>&#160;brings a liter of water to boil in less than five minutes and produces plentiful heat for cooking. In fact, there are compact fans inside the burn chamber that you can set at four different speeds to increase or decrease the intensity of the heat.</p>\n\tThe best backpacking camp stove\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fe4c5ffedf8920018093af8?format=jpeg\" alt=\"msr pocketrocket deluxe 1\" height=\"852\" width=\"1136\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Scott Rinckenberger/MSR</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3>The <a href=\"http://www.avantlink.com/click.php?tt=cl&#38;merchant_id=e295c418-295a-447c-b265-734e25f82503&#38;website_id=9597bdee-ce2a-4552-aa13-419b5f275c06&#38;url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.rei.com%2Fproduct%2F148209%2Fmsr-pocketrocket-deluxe-stove&#38;ctc=biipgf_092517_best-camping-stoves\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">MSR PocketRocket Deluxe</a> is a compact and lightweight stove that fits inside a coffee mug but has a convenient auto igniter and simmering capability.</h3><p><strong>Pros: </strong>Lightweight and compact, self-igniting, simmers well</p><p><strong>Cons: </strong>Not the best in high-wind without a screen</p><p>You shouldn't need to carry an extra piece of gear to make a spark, yet, many camping stoves still rely on matches or a lighter for a flame. One of the best features of the <a href=\"http://www.avantlink.com/click.php?tt=cl&#38;merchant_id=e295c418-295a-447c-b265-734e25f82503&#38;website_id=9597bdee-ce2a-4552-aa13-419b5f275c06&#38;url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.rei.com%2Fproduct%2F148209%2Fmsr-pocketrocket-deluxe-stove&#38;ctc=biipgf_092517_best-camping-stoves\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">MSR PocketRocket Deluxe</a> is that it has a built-in automatic piezo igniter that's cased in steel for reliability.</p><p>Despite its small size and weight (two other key pros), the <a href=\"http://www.avantlink.com/click.php?tt=cl&#38;merchant_id=e295c418-295a-447c-b265-734e25f82503&#38;website_id=9597bdee-ce2a-4552-aa13-419b5f275c06&#38;url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.rei.com%2Fproduct%2F148209%2Fmsr-pocketrocket-deluxe-stove&#38;ctc=biipgf_092517_best-camping-stoves\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">PocketRocket Deluxe</a> is no slouch. It can boil a liter of water in less than four minutes. The burner is adjustable, so you can lower the heat for a simmer &#8212; something that's hard to achieve with a one-setting burner. There's also a built-in pressure regulator to ensure you get reliable and fast cooking until the gas canister is depleted.</p><p>As long as you place the stove (with gas canister attached) on a level surface, it supports anything from a frying pan to a small cup. Like all lightweight backpacking stoves, the <a href=\"http://www.avantlink.com/click.php?tt=cl&#38;merchant_id=e295c418-295a-447c-b265-734e25f82503&#38;website_id=9597bdee-ce2a-4552-aa13-419b5f275c06&#38;url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.rei.com%2Fproduct%2F148209%2Fmsr-pocketrocket-deluxe-stove&#38;ctc=biipgf_092517_best-camping-stoves\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">PocketRocket Deluxe</a> will only run on self-sealing isobutane fuel canisters.</p><p>If you're flying to a destination, just pack the <a href=\"http://www.avantlink.com/click.php?tt=cl&#38;merchant_id=e295c418-295a-447c-b265-734e25f82503&#38;website_id=9597bdee-ce2a-4552-aa13-419b5f275c06&#38;url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.rei.com%2Fproduct%2F148209%2Fmsr-pocketrocket-deluxe-stove&#38;ctc=biipgf_092517_best-camping-stoves\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">PocketRocket</a> and stop by a local outdoors retailer after you've arrived to pick one up (you can also get advice on where to camp, hike, and climb, if you aren't familiar with an area).</p><p>I've used this stove extensively, as well as other PocketRocket variants. I like the simplicity of the design, and with the deluxe version, I now have the convenience of a push-start igniter; the igniter adds an extra 10 grams when compared to the standard PocketRocket, but it's totally worth it.</p><p>What I also like is MSR's warranty: Even after years of abuse, MSR stands by its products and offers extremely economical repair or replacement options.</p><p>Whether I'm camping in my car or on a complicated thru-hiking trip, the <a href=\"http://www.avantlink.com/click.php?tt=cl&#38;merchant_id=e295c418-295a-447c-b265-734e25f82503&#38;website_id=9597bdee-ce2a-4552-aa13-419b5f275c06&#38;url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.rei.com%2Fproduct%2F148209%2Fmsr-pocketrocket-deluxe-stove&#38;ctc=biipgf_092517_best-camping-stoves\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">PocketRocket Deluxe's</a> excellent durability and the convenience of the built-in igniter make it one item I now bring along.</p>\n\tThe best fast-boiling camp stove\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5d6ed71f2e22af1f4f248485?format=jpeg\" alt=\"jetboil flash camping stove\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Jetboil</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3>The <a href=\"http://www.avantlink.com/click.php?tt=cl&#38;merchant_id=e295c418-295a-447c-b265-734e25f82503&#38;website_id=9597bdee-ce2a-4552-aa13-419b5f275c06&#38;url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.rei.com%2Fproduct%2F127968%2Fjetboil-flash-cooking-system&#38;ctc=biipgf_092517_best-camping-stoves\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Jetboil Flash</a> gets a lot of water really hot, really fast. If you primarily rely on your stove to make hot drinks and rehydrate meals, this is the stove for you.</h3><p><strong>Pros:&#160;</strong>Boils water quickly, contains all the parts inside the pot, push-button ignition</p><p><strong>Cons: </strong>Can be hard to clean, can't be used with other pots or pans easily</p><p>When I get back from a long day on the trail, I want the most food in the shortest amount of time. This means pouring hot water onto couscous or a dehydrated meal. If it's the mornings, then it's coffee posthaste.</p><p>For these moments, I rely on the <a href=\"http://www.avantlink.com/click.php?tt=cl&#38;merchant_id=e295c418-295a-447c-b265-734e25f82503&#38;website_id=9597bdee-ce2a-4552-aa13-419b5f275c06&#38;url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.rei.com%2Fproduct%2F127968%2Fjetboil-flash-cooking-system&#38;ctc=biipgf_092517_best-camping-stoves\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Jetboil Flash</a>. Using a cleverly designed pot that's attached to a large burner &#8212; it looks (and sounds) like a jet engine &#8212; the Flash can boil 16 ounces of water in less than two minutes. It is so fast that the first time I used it, it began boiling over while I was still prepping my meal.</p><p>This is a product designed with backpackers in mind. The whole thing packs down into the provided pot and even has space for a small fuel canister. Not only does this mean it takes up very little space but it also makes it hard to lose or forget a part of the stove.</p><p>If you want to sear, saut&#233;, and simmer, the <a href=\"http://www.avantlink.com/click.php?tt=cl&#38;merchant_id=e295c418-295a-447c-b265-734e25f82503&#38;website_id=9597bdee-ce2a-4552-aa13-419b5f275c06&#38;url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.rei.com%2Fproduct%2F127968%2Fjetboil-flash-cooking-system&#38;ctc=biipgf_092517_best-camping-stoves\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Jetboil Flash</a> isn't for you. Although there are accessories that will let you use a frying pan, this is really a stove for heating your water fast, which is all most backpackers need.</p>\n\tThe best camp stove for travel\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5d6eda782e22af0eaf258cd8?format=jpeg\" alt=\"msr whisperlite international stove\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Amazon</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3><a href=\"http://www.avantlink.com/click.php?tt=cl&#38;merchant_id=e295c418-295a-447c-b265-734e25f82503&#38;website_id=9597bdee-ce2a-4552-aa13-419b5f275c06&#38;url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.rei.com%2Fproduct%2F830341%2Fmsr-whisperlite-international-backpacking-stove&#38;ctc=biipgf_092517_best-camping-stoves\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">The Whisperlite International</a> from MSR can go anywhere and burn almost anything. If you're traveling to remote locations, this is the reliable and rebuildable stove to take with you.</h3><p><strong>Pros:&#160;</strong>Compatible with various types of fuel, excellent longevity</p><p><strong>Cons: </strong>Not the lightest stove</p><p>Isobutane is great for cooking fast with a steady flame and comes packaged in convenient canisters. Unfortunately, you can't fly with it, which could be an issue if you're going to some remote area where there isn't a camping store nearby. In this type of situation, the <a href=\"http://www.avantlink.com/click.php?tt=cl&#38;merchant_id=e295c418-295a-447c-b265-734e25f82503&#38;website_id=9597bdee-ce2a-4552-aa13-419b5f275c06&#38;url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.rei.com%2Fproduct%2F830341%2Fmsr-whisperlite-international-backpacking-stove&#38;ctc=biipgf_092517_best-camping-stoves\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">MSR Whisperlite International</a> is a better alternative. Not only can the stove burn white gas, kerosene, or unleaded gas, it's also incredibly robust.</p><p>This reliability combines with MSR's clever shaker jet design, which prevents the fuel jet from getting clogged by using a needle inside the jet &#8212; cleaning it out when the stove is shaken. All of this makes the Whisperlite International the go-to choice for big expeditions.</p><p>With some practice, you'll be able to quickly light the Whisperlite International (you do need to bring a lighter). Advanced users can regulate the flame enough to simmer water if required. I'll admit that most of my uses have been limited to heating water and making oatmeal and coffee, but more adventurous cooks will be happy with the Whisperlite, especially when the alternative is going stove-less or using a wood or alcohol stove with pitiful heat output. <em>&#8212; James Stout</em></p>\n\tThe best high-powered camp stove\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5b7ec6411982d83b008b5546?format=jpeg\" alt=\"mr steak cmap stove\" height=\"978\" width=\"1304\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Mr. Steak</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3>The <a href=\"http://www.anrdoezrs.net/links/6415797/type/dlg/sid/biipgf_092517_best-camping-stoves/https://www.basspro.com/shop/en/mr-steak-1-burner-infrared-portable-grill\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Mr. Steak 1-Burner Infrared Portable Grill</a> cranks out 14,000 BTUs and can heat up to an astounding 1,000 degrees Fahrenheit.</h3><p><strong>Pros: </strong>Amazing heat output, large cook surface, electric ignition system</p><p><strong>Cons:</strong> Expensive, not suitable for hauling on foot</p><p>If you're pushing for the mountain summit of Denali or the Eiger, then it's probably best to leave the <a href=\"http://www.anrdoezrs.net/links/6415797/type/dlg/sid/biipgf_092517_best-camping-stoves/https://www.basspro.com/shop/en/mr-steak-1-burner-infrared-portable-grill\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Mr. Steak 1-Burner Infrared Portable Grill</a> back at base camp.</p><p>At around 30 pounds and measuring 25 by 16 by 16 inches, this is most definitely a car camping grill. But with that size comes 165 square inches of cooking space, below which an immensely powerful ceramic infrared burner can heat up to as much as 1,000 degrees. Not that you will need that much heat most of the time, but hey, it's there for you.</p><p>The Mr. Steak 1-Burner Infrared Portable Grill works with a standard one-pound propane cylinder (the squat green ones, like the ones the <a href=\"http://amzn.to/2jXo6yG\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Coleman stove</a> uses) and has an electronic ignition system.</p><p>When you're not using the grill, you can fold its legs up for easier storage or transport, and when you are using it, you'll appreciate the cool-to-the-touch silicone cover on the handle and a latch that can hold the cover open while you're flipping burgers. <em>&#8212; Steven John</em></p>\n\tHow to shop for a camp stove\n\t\n\t<p>Although all camp stoves largely have the same overall goal (i.e. heating food, boiling water, etc.), they're not all necessarily created equal. Some function better for rapidly boiling water while others are light enough for <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-backpacking-stoves\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">backpacking trips</a> or pack a more powerful cooking punch.</p><p>Any decent stove produces plenty of heat and resists the elements, but beyond that, there are all sorts of differences between various brands and models that make a given unit ideal for one user but a poor choice for others. In discussing the six camp stoves on this list, we'll cover not only each option's inherent qualities but will also talk through why each model is well suited to specific activities, as well as why a given stove may be a poor choice for other scenarios.</p>\n\tHow we test camp stoves\n\t\n\t<p>Each of the camp stoves featured in this guide went through a series of tests to see how well it compared across these six categories: <strong>Boil time, ease of setup and use, wind resistance, heating power (total BTUs), fuel type, </strong>and <strong>value</strong><strong>. </strong>Here are the main features to consider when shopping for camp stoves (and the criteria we judged when doing our own testing over many nights spent camping, backpacking, or just taking to our <a href=\"https://www.insider.com/backyard-camping\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">own backyard</a>):&#160;</p><p><strong>Boil time:&#160;</strong>How quickly a stove can bring water to a boil is one of the most important features for anyone who wants to quickly prepare food that only requires hot water, campers who want the ability to reliably purify gathered water, or those who need their coffee brewed mere moments after they wake up in the morning.</p><p><strong>Ease of setup and use:&#160;</strong>Being able to easily set up your stove when you need it is vital. Most stoves are intuitive once you get the hang of them but it's still nice to have one without steep learning curve.&#160;</p><p><strong>Wind resistance: </strong>Depending on where you plan to do the bulk of your camping, a stove that's able to not only light but stay lit while it's windy is highly useful. While most stoves won't have a specific wind-resistant rating, many should list how well they'll work in blustery conditions.</p><p><strong>Heating power (and total BTUs):&#160;</strong>Lighting the stove is one thing but how powerful it ends up being while lit is something else entirely. After all, you don't want to be sitting around for upwards of an hour waiting for a simple can of soup to heat up. The higher the BTUs (British thermal units), the more powerful the stove will be. Look for a stove between 10,000 and 30,000 BTUs.&#160;</p><p><strong>Fuel type:&#160;</strong>There are generally two kinds of camp stove fuel: Gas fuel like propane and butane or liquid fuel. Propane and butane canisters tend to be easier to use in terms of lighting the stove and don't require priming before being lit. Liquid fuel stoves require a bit more work (such as priming) but perform better in colder weather. They're also liable to be more dangerous to use. If possible, we recommend using propane or butane canisters as they're far easier to manage.</p><p><strong>Value: </strong>The importance of a camp stove's price point is completely up to you. If you have the budget to buy a more full-featured stove, by all means, go for it. If you're looking for a budget option, there are plenty of those, too, and many have negligible differences to more expensive options.&#160;</p>\n</div><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original -338_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=LHl1_MCJLYY:OvhqxfV1m8U:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn26@2020_5/2021/05/01/06-42-24-926_c77cc5dd03370129.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/LHl1_MCJLYY":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn93@2020_6/2021/05/01/06-42-26-164_6f43c16df52779bc.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1619851324346},{"createdTime":"2021-05-01 anxiety.</strong></li>\n</ul><p>Purchasing the gear a new puppy needs for sleeping, walking, eating, and training adds up quickly. And, let&#39;s face it, it&#39;s almost inevitable that you&#39;ll forget to buy something essential. A puppy starter kit can solve both problems by bundling the things you need most into one convenient package. target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Midwest's Puppy Starter Kit</a> is packed with essentials. The kit's items come in three sizes tailored to small-, medium-, and large-breed puppies and each is backed by a one-year manufacturer's warranty.</p>\n\tBest luxury puppy starter kit\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/608c110334af8d001859a207?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Wild One Puppy Starter Kit\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Choose from a collar or harness sized perfectly for your puppy\n<p class=\"copyright\">Wild One</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3>The chic <a href=\"https://go.skimresources.com?id=35871X943606&#38;xs=1&#38;url=https%3A%2F%2Fwildone.com%2Fproducts%2Fnew-dog-starter-kit\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Wild One Starter Kit</a> includes walking gear, a memory-foam bed, toys, and treats to get new puppies off on the right paw.</h3><p><strong>What we like: </strong>Includes collar or harness, memory-foam bed, sustainably sourced treats, one-year warranty</p><p><a href=\"https://go.skimresources.com?id=35871X943606&#38;xs=1&#38;url=https%3A%2F%2Fwildone.com%2Fproducts%2Fnew-dog-starter-kit\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Wild One</a> has packaged their stylish gear into a starter kit of luxurious basics. Among the 12 items is a memory-foam bed with a layered machine-washable cover and water-resistant lining, two stainless steel bowls with nonslip silicone bases, and three toys &#8212; a bouncing twist toss, sturdy tug triangle, and treat-concealing chew. For walking your pup, Wild One's starter kit comes with either a collar or harness and a leash with a poop bag carrier. Three packages of sustainably sourced treats &#8212; chicken tenders, sweet potato, and fish puffs &#8212; are also included. You can select the size of the collar or harness and the bed, but the gear comes in only one color, the company's signature tan. Wild One backs all of their products with a one-year warranty.</p>\n\tBest puppy starter kit for chewing\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/608c499934af8d001859a536?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Puppy starter kit_Nylabone puppy teething toys\" height=\"1249\" width=\"1666\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>A teething set with tasty flavored toys to entice your puppy\n<p class=\"copyright\">Amazon</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3>The <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/Nylabone-Puppy-Bundle-Starter-Teething/dp/B071ZB755Q?&#38;linkCode=ll1&#38;tag=biipgf_043021_best-puppy-starter-kits-20&#38;linkId=0ae5f61b91b05f555627551208cac6fa&#38;language=en_US&#38;ref_=as_li_ss_tl\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Nylabone Puppy Teething Starter Kit</a> includes rubber, nylon, and edible toys for each stage of a dog's dental development.</h3><p><strong>What we like: </strong>Chew toys for every puppy dental stage, includes a rubber pacifier and edible bacon-flavored chew&#160;</p><p><a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/Nylabone-Puppy-Bundle-Starter-Teething/dp/B071ZB755Q?&#38;linkCode=ll1&#38;tag=biipgf_043021_best-puppy-starter-kits-20&#38;linkId=0ae5f61b91b05f555627551208cac6fa&#38;language=en_US&#38;ref_=as_li_ss_tl\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Nylabone's Puppy Teething Starter Kit</a> comes with six chew toys for different stages of a puppy's development. For the youngest pups that haven't yet lost their baby teeth, there is a softer chicken-flavor bone. For puppies that are teething, there's a natural rubber pacifier and a dental dino covered in raised nubs to massage the gums and provide pain relief. And puppies whose permanent teeth have grown in can choose from durable nylon rings, a chicken-flavored chew toy, and a long-lasting, bacon-flavored edible treat bone.</p>\n\tBest puppy starter kit for training\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/608c4a0735c46f0018c0babe?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Puppy starter kit_Cilkus dog training set\" height=\"1249\" width=\"1666\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Comes with a pouch for holding treats, poop bags, and more\n<p class=\"copyright\">Amazon</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3>The <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/Cilkus-Piece-Dog-Training-Housetraining/dp/B08FSL1SLS?&#38;linkCode=ll1&#38;tag=biipgf_043021_best-puppy-starter-kits-20&#38;linkId=c4560e3f72313a2bc25061499af2c603&#38;language=en_US&#38;ref_=as_li_ss_tl\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Cilkus 7-Piece Dog Training Set</a> includes the essential gear for teaching a puppy new skills using science-based positive-reinforcement methods.</h3><p><strong>What we like: </strong>Includes two clickers, training treat bag, potty training jingle bells&#160;</p><p>Your puppy begins learning the moment they come home. The <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/Cilkus-Piece-Dog-Training-Housetraining/dp/B08FSL1SLS?&#38;linkCode=ll1&#38;tag=biipgf_043021_best-puppy-starter-kits-20&#38;linkId=c4560e3f72313a2bc25061499af2c603&#38;language=en_US&#38;ref_=as_li_ss_tl\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Cilkus 7-Piece Dog Training Set</a> will help you to shape the skills they pick up using <a href=\"https://www.insider.com/what-you-need-to-train-a-dog\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">dog trainer-approved</a>, science-based techniques. This kit comes with two colorful two-in-one clicker-whistles and a treat bag. The bag, which has a poop bag dispenser, drawstring closure, and extra side pocket, can be worn around the waist with an adjustable belt or hung with a clamp from a pocket. Also included in the kit are housebreaking jingle bells that help teach a puppy how to ask to go out, a collapsible 5-inch-diameter silicone bowl that doubles as a frisbee, and a surprise toy. A manual and corresponding ebook offer tips on how to effectively use the bells.</p>\n\tBest puppy starter kit for anxiety relief\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/608c151d35c46f0018c0b77c?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Best puppy starter kits in 2021\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Includes a plush puppy with a heart that beats reassuringly\n<p class=\"copyright\">Amazon</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3>The <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/Snuggle-Puppy-New-Starter-Neutral/dp/B07BBWZ8GQ?&#38;linkCode=ll1&#38;tag=biipgf_043021_best-puppy-starter-kits-20&#38;linkId=387307bc9def738573accfd42686137b&#38;language=en_US&#38;ref_=as_li_ss_tl\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Smart Pet Love New Puppy Starter Kit</a> gives a puppy a warm buddy with a beating heart, a teething ring, and a fleece blanket to help ease anxiety.</h3><p><strong>What we like: </strong>Includes plush puppy with a pocket for a pulsing heart and heat pack, two toys, and machine-washable fleece blanket</p><p>Young puppies experiencing anxiety may find some relief by snuggling up against a warm body with a heartbeat. That soothing comfort is packaged into <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/Snuggle-Puppy-New-Starter-Neutral/dp/B07BBWZ8GQ?&#38;linkCode=ll1&#38;tag=biipgf_043021_best-puppy-starter-kits-20&#38;linkId=387307bc9def738573accfd42686137b&#38;language=en_US&#38;ref_=as_li_ss_tl\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Smart Pet Love's New Puppy Starter Kit</a>. The set includes a soft plush puppy with a pocket for inserting a battery-operated beating heart and one of three disposable heat packs. The heart can be set to beat continuously for 8 or 24 hours and runs on 3 included AAA batteries. The puppy is machine washable and made from certified safe materials. Smart Pet Love's kit also comes with a heart-shaped freezable teether, small toy for tossing and tugging, and machine-washable 48-by-30-inch fleece blanket.</p>\n</div><div 2021 20:31:10 +0000","feedId":22,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/608c151d35c46f0018c0b77c?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"d4fd7267755993ccccb0da46dc320102","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn22@2020_6/2021/05/01/06-42-05-585_a6c489eaff3d8da4.webp","destWidth":1200,"destHeight":900,"sourceBytes":45408,"destBytes":45408,"author":"shoshiparks@gmail.com (Shoshi Parks)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/608c484935c46f0018c0bab8?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn56@2020_2/2021/05/01/06-42-25-946_e213bf126136770e.webp","https://i.insider.com/608c110334af8d001859a207?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn85@2020_4/2021/05/01/06-42-25-466_52b05e8910cd5d03.webp","https://i.insider.com/608c499934af8d001859a536?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn97@2020_6/2021/05/01/06-42-25-478_5e8a1016278f53ec.webp","https://i.insider.com/608c4a0735c46f0018c0babe?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn67@2020_6/2021/05/01/06-42-26-311_16981610c75d7f34.webp","https://i.insider.com/608c151d35c46f0018c0b77c?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn22@2020_6/2021/05/01/06-42-05-585_a6c489eaff3d8da4.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn14@2020_3/2021/05/01/06-42-25-622_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=fdM0FXbz96Y:l49PaBMxGs0:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn60@2020_5/2021/05/01/06-42-22-920_f957d213703c1e0a.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=fdM0FXbz96Y:l49PaBMxGs0:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn93@2020_6/2021/05/01/06-42-24-302_92690d8680123a08.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn15@2020_2/2021/05/01/06-42-23-338_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=fdM0FXbz96Y:l49PaBMxGs0:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn36@2020_5/2021/05/01/06-42-25-926_d23ef075ebc0c93d.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/fdM0FXbz96Y":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn65@2020_4/2021/05/01/06-42-23-064_df50ad4baebba1c3.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1619851324332},{"createdTime":"2021-05-01 14:42:04","updatedTime":"2021-05-01 14:42:04","title":"NASA is giving its Ingenuity helicopter a surprise second mission on Mars","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/nasa-ingenuity-mars-helicopter-to-start-scouting-2021-4","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/608c2a8f34af8d001859a37f?format=jpeg\" alt=\"ingenuity perseverance thumb\" height=\"1500\" width=\"2000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>NASA&#39;s Ingenuity Mars helicopter (left) and its Perseverance rover (right).\n<p class=\"copyright\">NASA/JPL-Caltech</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>NASA is giving its <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/nasa-ingenuity-helicopter-failed-lift-off-ambitious-fourth-flight-2021-4\">Ingenuity Mars helicopter</a> a second mission: to scout out new terrain.</li>\n<li>While the Perseverance rover searches for signs of alien life, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/nasa-ingenuity-helicopter-mars-flight-photos-videos-2021-4\">Ingenuity</a> will fly to a new airfield.</li>\n<li>NASA will use data from this secondary mission to inform future interplanetary helicopters.</li>\n<li id=\"recirc\"><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">See more stories on Insider&#39;s business page</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>NASA&#39;s pioneering Mars helicopter has exceeded expectations so significantly that the agency is giving it a second life.</p><p>Ingenuity flew over the red planet&#39;s surface for the first time earlier this month, then <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/nasa-ingenuity-helicopter-third-mars-flight-2021-4\">completed two more flights</a> after that, each more ambitious than the last. The original plan was to fly the helicopter up to five times then <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/nasa-team-push-mars-ingenuity-helicopter-until-crashes-2021-4\">abandon it</a>, but now NASA is switching gears. It has directed Ingenuity to begin testing operations that the agency might want to conduct with future space helicopters.</p><p>That includes scouting and mapping, observing interesting features of Mars from the air, and exploring rough terrain that rovers can&#39;t access.</p><p>&#34;The ability to fly the helicopter out into terrain that the rover cannot possibly traverse and bring back scientific data - this is extremely important for future missions that could combine a rover with a reconnaissance helicopter,&#34; Perseverance scientist Ken Farley said in a briefing on Friday.</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/608c2fdc35c46f0018c0b973?format=jpeg\" alt=\"ingenuity mars helicopter\" height=\"493\" width=\"658\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The Perseverance rover captured Ingenuity flying on April 21, 2021.\n<p class=\"copyright\">NASA/JPL-Caltech</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>The Perseverance rover won&#39;t watch the helicopter conduct the additional flights, though it will stay nearby while it begins the main part of its mission: searching for signs of ancient microbial life. </p><p>Ingenuity, meanwhile, has already embarked on its new project. It was programmed to fly on Friday morning, lifting itself 16 feet in the air and tilting so that its rotors would carry it about 436 feet to the south, over uncharted terrain. NASA engineers expect to get data from that flight attempt throughout the afternoon. This aerial adventure was originally scheduled for Thursday, but a non-damaging software glitch <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/nasa-ingenuity-helicopter-failed-lift-off-ambitious-fourth-flight-2021-4\">prevented the helicopter from lifting off</a>. NASA engineers expect that outcome in 15% of flight attempts.</p><p>If Friday&#39;s flight worked, Ingenuity should have snapped photos along the way, then flown back to its original spot to land. With those flight photos, the NASA team plans to construct a 3D map of the nearby terrain and pick out a new landing spot for Ingenuity. They also expect to record the first audio of Ingenuity in flight.</p><p>On its fifth flight, which should happen in about a week, Ingenuity is expected to zip to that new airfield and touch down. From its new perch, it&#39;s set to conduct at least two more flights in May.</p><p>The helicopter may even investigate &#34;areas of interest to the rover,&#34; according to Lori Glaze, director of NASA&#39;s Planetary Science Division.</p><h2>NASA is pushing Ingenuity to the limit</h2><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6070d5f7a451820019b3a683?format=jpeg\" alt=\"mars ingenuity helicopter rotor blades spin\" height=\"1500\" width=\"2000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The Perseverance rover captured the Ingenuity helicopter before (left) and after (right) spinning its rotor blades.\n<p class=\"copyright\">NASA/JPL-Caltech/ASU</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>For now, NASA is only extending Ingenuity&#39;s mission for 30 days. But it could keep flying even longer - as long as it&#39;s still alive and doesn&#39;t interfere with Perseverance&#39;s science work.</p><p>&#34;We&#39;re in a kind of see-how-it-goes phase,&#34; Glaze said on Friday.</p><p>Ingenuity has stayed healthy so far, but it was only designed for a 30-day mission.</p><p>&#34;In doing these operational scenarios, we will naturally be pushing the limits of Ingenuity,&#34; MiMi Aung, project manager for Ingenuity, said in the briefing. &#34;We hope we will be flying over unsurveyed terrains and, over time, continuing to transfer to airfields that are not well characterized. So there is a higher probability of bad landing.&#34;</p><p>Aung has previously said that a bad landing would end Ingenuity&#39;s flights.</p><h2>Perseverance will start investigating rocks from an ancient lake</h2><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/606f4a6f4d3e410018b70112?format=jpeg\" alt=\"NASA Perseverance \" height=\"2160\" width=\"2880\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Perseverance captured a &#34;selfie&#34; with Ingenuity before driving away.\n<p class=\"copyright\">NASA/JPL-Caltech/MSSS/Seán Doran</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>Both Ingenuity and the Perseverance rover are in Mars&#39; <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/nasa-mars-rover-landing-jezero-crater-search-for-alien-life-2021-2\">Jezero Crater</a>, a 28-mile-wide impact basin that was filled with water about 3.5 billion years ago. Scientists think that lake may once have been home to microbial life. So Perseverance is about to start looking for fossils of those alien microbes, which could be trapped in sediment that drifted to the bottom of the lake.</p><p>The rover wasn&#39;t originally going to scour the area right where it landed - instead it was set to drive west, to the cliffs of the ancient river delta that fed Lake Jezero. But the robot recently photographed some promising rocks that convinced NASA scientists to further investigate the region.</p><p>&#34;These rocks are likely to be mudstones, very fine grained, once mud on the bottom of the lake,&#34; Farley said. &#34;These are very important for our investigation, because this is the kind of environment that we expect to be the most habitable by organisms that might have existed on Mars billions of years ago.&#34;</p><p>That change of plans is part of what makes Ingenuity&#39;s extended mission possible. The helicopter can&#39;t fly without Perseverance nearby, since it must communicate with NASA through the rover.</p><p>&#34;Based on the rocks that we have seen in the area, we really wish to spend a considerable amount of time where we are,&#34; Farley said. &#34;It&#39;s sort of a fortuitous alignment.&#34;</p><p>Perseverance aims to take its first samples of those rocks in July. Over its years-long mission, the rover is set to collect dozens of samples and cache them for a future spacecraft to retrieve and bring back to Earth. Those would be the first samples humanity has ever brought home from Mars.</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/nasa-ingenuity-mars-helicopter-to-start-scouting-2021-4'>Business Insider</a></div><div class=\"feedflare\">\n<a 14:42:04","updatedTime":"2021-05-01 14:42:04","title":"NASA's Mars helicopter has beamed back an otherworldly collection of photos and video from its first 4 flights","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/nasa-ingenuity-helicopter-mars-flight-photos-videos-2021-4","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/608ad0ec34af8d0018599e6f?format=jpeg\" alt=\"mars helicopter ingenuity nasa\" height=\"1344\" width=\"1793\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>An artist&#39;s concept of NASA&#39;s Ingenuity Mars Helicopter flying through the Martian skies.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.jpl.nasa.gov/spaceimages/details.php?id=PIA23961\" target=\"_blank\">NASA/JPL-Caltech</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/nasa-ingenuity-helicopter-flies-on-mars-2021-4\" data-analytics-module=\"summary_bullets\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"0\" data-uri=\"fd394b7e6cfa4c6eafc0c12aec199a05\">NASA&#39;s Ingenuity helicopter</a> has completed <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/nasa-mars-ingenuity-helicopter-broke-records-fourth-flight-2021-4\">four flights</a> over the Martian surface.</li>\n<li>Ingenuity made history last week when it completed the first controlled, powered flight on another planet. Each of the three subsequent flights pushed the helicopter higher, farther, and faster.</li>\n<li>The helicopter has exceeded expectations, so NASA has given it a new mission: to <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/nasa-ingenuity-mars-helicopter-to-start-scouting-2021-4\">scout and map uncharted terrain from the air</a>.</li>\n<li>Ingenuity has been snapping pictures of the Martian surface during all its flights, and NASA&#39;s Mars Perseverance rover has been capturing photos and videos of Ingenuity&#39;s <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/nasa-ingenuity-helicopter-third-mars-flight-2021-4\">aerial adventures</a> from a nearby overlook.</li>\n<li>Below are a selection of the best images and clips so far.</li>\n<li id=\"recirc\"><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">See more stories on Insider&#39;s business page</a>.</li>\n</ul>\n<div id=\"slideshow\">\n\tIngenuity has soared over the Martian surface four times in the last 12 days. The 4-pound, tissue-box-size helicopter successfully completed its fourth flight on Friday.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/608af90b34af8d0018599f7b?format=jpeg\" alt=\"ingenuity fourth flight\" height=\"1187\" width=\"1600\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>NASA&#39;s Mars Perseverance rover captured this image of Ingenuity on April 29, 2021.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://mars.nasa.gov/mars2020/multimedia/raw-images/ZL0_0068_0672980800_937ECM_N0032208ZCAM05054_110085J\" target=\"_blank\">NASA/JPL-Caltech/ASU</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>NASA hasn't released details of the flight yet, but the plan called for Ingenuity to climb 16 feet in the air and reach a maximum speed of 3.5 meters per second (7.8 mph).</p><p>The flight was originally scheduled for Thursday, but Ingenuity didn't get off the ground. A non-damaging <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/nasa-to-update-ingenuity-mars-helicopter-software-2021-4\" data-analytics-module=\"summary_bullets\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"0\" data-uri=\"0ae4dbc4912373b57410f803b3850d56\">software issue</a> may have prevented the helicopter's flight computer from transitioning to flight mode.</p><p>&#160;</p>\n\tIf Ingenuity's fourth flight went as planned, it should have flown for 117 seconds. Ingenuity was programmed to travel south for around 436 feet, snapping photos of the Martian surface along the way, then turn around and land in its original spot.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/606b2c35856cd700198a325d?format=jpeg\" alt=\"ingenuity helicopter mars\" height=\"968\" width=\"1296\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>NASA&#39;s Ingenuity helicopter, photographed on Mars by the Perseverance rover.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.jpl.nasa.gov/news/nasas-mars-helicopter-survives-first-cold-martian-night-on-its-own\" target=\"_blank\">NASA/JPL-Caltech</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>NASA scientists originally planned for the rotorcraft to attempt five flights in total, but Ingenuity has exceeded expectations so significantly that the agency is extending the helicopter's mission for 30 more days.</p><p>Using photos from Ingenuity's Friday flight, the NASA team plans to construct a 3D map of nearby terrain and pick a new landing spot for the helicopter.</p>\n\tOn its fifth flight, which should happen in about a week, Ingenuity is expected to zip to that new airfield and touch down. From its new perch, it's set to conduct at least two more flights in May.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f219eca7924a12c8c4441ef?format=jpeg\" alt=\"mars ingenuity helicopter nasa\" height=\"1463\" width=\"2600\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>This artist&#39;s concept shows the Ingenuity helicopter on the Martian surface.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://mars.nasa.gov/resources/24821/artists-concept-mars-helicopter/\" target=\"_blank\">NASA/JPL-Caltech</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>The goals of those sixth and seventh flights include scouting and mapping, observing interesting features of Mars from the air, and exploring rough terrain that a rover can't access.</p>\n\tIngenuity's epic journey began eight months ago.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6064ac0ddaf0f10018f99422?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Ingenuity four legs\" height=\"1648\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Ingenuity underneath the Perseverance rover.\n<p class=\"copyright\">NASA/JPL-Caltech</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>The helicopter, built by NASA's Jet Propulsion Laboratory, left Earth on July 30 in the underbelly of the agency's Perseverance Mars rover.</p><p>The two vehicles traveled 293 million miles together, landing in Mars' Jezero Crater in February. Perseverance set Ingenuity free in early April, dropping the helicopter onto the Martian surface so it could soak up sunlight to charge its battery and stretch out its rotors.</p>\n\tIngenuity started to test its carbon-fiber rotor blades on April 8.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/608ad3b435c46f0018c0b3e2?format=jpeg\" alt=\"ingenuity mars helicopter blade spin perseverance rover\" height=\"720\" width=\"1280\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Ingenuity doing a slow spin test of its blades on April 8, 2021.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://mars.nasa.gov/resources/25796/ingenuity-begins-to-spin-its-blades/\" target=\"_blank\">NASA/JPL-Caltech/ASU</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>To get the helicopter off the ground in Mars' thin atmosphere, its rotors have to spin at a blistering 2,500 revolutions a minute. That's five times as fast as the blades of a helicopter on Earth.</p>\n\tThe issue that prevented Ingenuity's fourth flight on Thursday might be related to a problem first found when the helicopter attempted a full-speed test of its blades on April 9, before its initial flight.\n\t\n\t<div class=\"insider-raw-embed\"><iframe src='https://mars.nasa.gov/embed/25810/' width='100%' height='400'  scrolling='no' frameborder='0'></iframe></div><p>That test failed because Ingenuity's flight computer was unable to transition from \"preflight\" to \"flight\" mode. NASA engineers resolved the issue with a software rewrite, but they determined that the fix would successfully transition the helicopter into flight mode only 85% of the time.</p><p>The data that Ingenuity beamed back Thursday indicated that it may have hit one of the 15% of instances in which the software patch doesn't work.</p>\n\tAfter the software fix, Ingenuity made history on April 19 when it took flight for the first time. It hovered 10 feet above the Martian surface for about 30 seconds.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/608ad48735c46f0018c0b3ec?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Ingenuity helicopter mars first flight Taking Off and Landing\" height=\"720\" width=\"1280\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Mastcam-Z, a camera on the Perseverance rover, captured Ingenuity taking off and landing for its first flight, on April 19, 2021.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://mars.nasa.gov/resources/25838/mastcam-z-video-of-ingenuity-taking-off-and-landing/\" target=\"_blank\">NASA/JPL-Caltech/ASU/MSSS</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>Never before had a spacecraft conducted a controlled, powered flight on another planet (though the Soviet Union's <a href=\"https://www.jpl.nasa.gov/news/nasa-receives-first-signals-from-soviet-vega-space-probes\">Vega missions</a> did successfully fly balloons on Venus in the 1980s).</p><p>While 10 feet may not sound like much, hovering there is the equivalent of flying three times as high as the peak of Mount Everest, since Mars' atmosphere has a density just 1% of that on Earth.</p><p>Ingenuity's purpose on Mars was simply to show that rotorcraft technology could work in that kind of harsh environment. And it succeeded.</p>\n\tTwo cameras on the bottom of Ingenuity recorded a still, black-and-white image of the Martian surface during that first flight - complete with the helicopter's shadow.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/607d633944f4540019207601?format=jpeg\" alt=\"ingenuity helicopter first photo shadow flight mars\" height=\"1001\" width=\"1333\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Ingenuity snapped this photo of its shadow on the ground below as it flew on Mars for the first time, on April 19, 2021.\n<p class=\"copyright\">NASA</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>The helicopter's original chosen airfield in the Jezero crater measures 33 by 33 feet, or 10 by 10 meters.</p>\n\tA camera on the Perseverance rover captured the flight in exquisite color.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/607d7a2b44f4540019207624?format=jpeg\" alt=\"ingenuity mars helicopter first flight photos perseverance edited skitch 4x3\" height=\"1500\" width=\"2000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The Perseverance rover captured Ingenuity&#39;s first flight on Mars, on April 19, 2021.\n<p class=\"copyright\">NASA/JPL-Caltech</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>Perseverance moved to a nearby overlook to photograph and film the event.</p>\n\tFootage from a camera on Perseverance's mast revealed dust plumes from Ingenuity upon takeoff and landing.\n\t\n\t<blockquote class=\"twitter-tweet blockquote\" data-lang=\"en\" data-cards=\"\" data-conversation=\"\">&#8212;NASA JPL  (@NASAJPL) <a href=\"https://twitter.com/mims/statuses/1384680147048046595?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw\">April 21, 2021</a></blockquote><script async src=\"//platform.twitter.com/widgets.js\" charset=\"utf-8\"></script><p>These enhanced videos, NASA said, could help scientists better understand the Martian wind and how dust travels through Mars' thin atmosphere.</p>\n\tOn April 22, Ingenuity flew even higher - 16 feet - and moved sideways for the first time.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/608197c2354dde0018c06a30?format=jpeg\" alt=\"ingenuity second flight mars helicopter\" height=\"720\" width=\"960\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The Perseverance rover captured Ingenuity in mid-air during its second flight, on April 22, 2021.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.jpl.nasa.gov/news/nasas-ingenuity-mars-helicopter-logs-second-successful-flight\" target=\"_blank\">NASA/JPL-Caltech/ASU/MSSS</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>It hovered for 52 seconds and reached an airspeed of 0.5 meters a second, or 1.1 mph.</p>\n\tDuring that second flight, Ingenuity snapped its first color image of the Martian surface.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/608675f13f0560001881bf33?format=jpeg\" alt=\"PIA24593 First_RTE_In Flight_IMAGE\" height=\"3120\" width=\"4208\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Ingenuity&#39;s first aerial color image of Mars.\n<p class=\"copyright\">NASA/JPL-Caltech</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>At the time it took this image &#8212; which shows tracks from the Perseverance rover on the ground below &#8212; Ingenuity was 17 feet in the air.</p>\n\tIngenuity executed its third flight on Sunday, reaching an airspeed of about 4.5 mph.\n\t\n\t<iframe width=\"560\" height=\"315\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/kNx9hcrUpww?start=11\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen></iframe><p>The helicopter traveled 50 meters (164 feet) north &#8212; more than half the length of a football field &#8212; before returning to its starting place. The flight lasted about 80 seconds.</p>\n\tIngenuity's third flight \"was nothing short of amazing,\" David Lavery, the project's program executive, said. \"With this flight, we are demonstrating critical capabilities that will enable the addition of an aerial dimension to future Mars missions.\"\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/608ae9b734af8d0018599f2a?format=jpeg\" alt=\"ingenuity third flight from rover\" height=\"960\" width=\"1280\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>NASA&#39;s Ingenuity Mars Helicopter can be seen hovering during its third flight, on April 25, 2021.\n<p class=\"copyright\">NASA/JPL-Caltech</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>Space helicopters like Ingenuity could someday do reconnaissance for astronauts.</p><p>These space drones could fly \"over ravines, down canyons, up mountains,\" Josh Ravich, the mechanical lead for the Ingenuity team at NASA's Jet Propulsion Laboratory, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/nasa-ingenuity-helicopter-flies-on-mars-2021-4\">previously told Insider</a>. \"Even rocky terrain is fairly inaccessible to the rovers but much more easily accessed by a rotorcraft.\"</p>\n\tThe helicopter even managed to spy on Perseverance from the air during its third flight.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/608992ee3f0560001881c8ef?format=jpeg\" alt=\"ingenuity helicopter rover perseverance nasa\" height=\"1123\" width=\"1515\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>NASA&#39;s Perseverance rover is visible in the upper left corner of this image that the Ingenuity helicopter took during its third flight on Mars, on April 25, 2021.\n<p class=\"copyright\">NASA/JPL-Caltech</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>Ingenuity was flying at an altitude of 16 feet, and about 280 feet from the rover, when it snapped the picture.</p>\n\tAfter Ingenuity takes off for a fifth time next week, the Perseverance rover will stop watching the helicopter's exploits.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/608c659f34af8d001859a5e6?format=jpeg\" alt=\"NASA Perseverance \" height=\"2160\" width=\"2880\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>NASA&#39;s Perseverance rover next to the Ingenuity helicopter.\n<p class=\"copyright\">NASA/JPL-Caltech/MSSS/Seán Doran</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>The rover will start the main part of its Mars mission: searching for signs of ancient microbial life. Perseverance won't venture too far from Ingenuity over the next month, though, so that NASA can continue to communicate with its helicopter.&#160;</p><p>&#160;</p><p><em>This story has been updated with new information.&#160;</em></p><p><em>Aria Bendix contributed reporting.</em></p>\n</div><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a
