Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>US stocks ended lower on Friday to close out April. </li>\n<li>Twitter and Amazon shares were under pressure during the session following quarterly earnings reports. </li>\n<li>Eurozone and Chinese economic data came in softer than expected. </li>\n<li id=\"recirc\"><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">See more stories on Insider&#39;s business page</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>US stocks slumped Friday, hurt by disappointing economic data from the eurozone and China, the world&#39;s second-largest economy, that may crimp prospects for global recovery from the COVID-19 pandemic. </p><p>The Dow Jones Industrial Average retreated from its record closing high made in the previous session while Wall Street&#39;s two other major indexes suffered. </p><p>Here&#39;s where US indexes stood at 4:00 p.m. on Friday:</p><ul><li aria-level=\"1\"><a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/index/s&p_500?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingest?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingestedium=ingest\">S&#38;P 500</a>: 33,879.00, down 0.53%</li><li aria-level=\"1\"><a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/index/dow_jones?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingest?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingestm=ingest\">Dow Jones Industrial Average</a>: 33,879.00, down 0.53% (181.36 points)</li><li aria-level=\"1\"><a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/index/nasdaq_composite?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingest?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingestm=ingest\">Nasdaq Composite</a>: 13,962.68, down 0.85%</li></ul><p>Investors pulled down equities after data showed the <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/news/stocks/eurozone-economy-q1-gdp-double-dip-recession-germany-france-2021-4-1030369467\">eurozone economy shrank in the first quarter </a>of 2021 as the bloc struggled with the slow rollout of coronavirus vaccinations and with containing the COVID-19 pandemic. The snapshot came after figures showed China&#39;s key manufacturing sector slowed by more than expected in April.</p><p>Stocks failed to gain traction after the Commerce Department said personal incomes for Americans <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/personal-income-march-spending-stimulus-economy-covid-checks-americans-biden-2021-4\">surged by a record 21.1% in March.</a> Last month, Congress passed a <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/stimulus-biden-signs-trillion-covid-relief-package-checks-direct-payments-2021-3\">$1.9 trillion stimulus package</a> that unlocked $1,400 checks to most Americans. </p><p>The Dow average was hurt by a drop in <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/stocks/amzn-stock\">Amazon</a> shares even as the online retailer blew past Wall Street&#39;s targets for its first-quarter earnings report. Shares of <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/stocks/twtr-stock?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingestgest\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Twitter</a> tumbled after the social media giant&#39;s first-quarter earnings report <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/news/stocks/twitter-stock-price-reaction-1q-earnings-report-twtr-jack-dorsey-2021-4-1030370626\">disappointed Wall Street investors</a>. </p><p>Around the markets, <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/currencies/xrp-usd?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingest?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingest?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingestedium=ingest\">XRP</a>, the digital asset used in Ripple Labs&#39; payment network, soared after Ripple&#39;s largest outside shareholder said the <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/currencies/news/xrp-price-surges-ripple-shareholder-cryptocurrency-company-public-sbi-token-2021-4-1030370620\">cryptocurrency company wanted to go public</a> after wrapping up a legal dispute with the SEC. </p><p><a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/commodities/gold-price?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingest?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingestm=ingest\">Gold</a> slipped to $1,769.81 per ounce. Long-dated US treasury yields edged down, with the 10-year yield at 1.631%. </p><p>Oil prices dropped.<a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/commodities/oil-price?type=wti?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingest?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingestm=ingest\"> West Texas Intermediate crude</a> fell 2.5% to $63.37 per barrel.<a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/commodities/oil-price?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingest?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingest?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingest?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingest?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingest?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingest?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingest?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingestce=markets&#38;utm_medium=ingest\"> Brent crude</a>, oil&#39;s international benchmark, lost 2% to $66.24 per barrel.</p><p><a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/currencies/btc-usd\">Bitcoin</a> jumped to $57,016.</p><div Insider</a></div><div class=\"feedflare\">\n<a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=ycTgvHda5_w:ep06gU1a8X4:yIl2AUoC8zA\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=ycTgvHda5_w:ep06gU1a8X4:F7zBnMyn0Lo\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=ycTgvHda5_w:ep06gU1a8X4:V_sGLiPBpWU\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=ycTgvHda5_w:ep06gU1a8X4:V_sGLiPBpWU\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=ycTgvHda5_w:ep06gU1a8X4:gIN9vFwOqvQ\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=ycTgvHda5_w:ep06gU1a8X4:gIN9vFwOqvQ\" border=\"0\"></img></a>\n</div><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/ycTgvHda5_w\" height=\"1\" width=\"1\" alt=\"\"/>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Fri, 30 Apr 2021 20:07:44 +0000","feedId":22,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/602ff9b68eda990012027b07?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"080bbd23d98d6cee90910e0a65d08d0b","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn56@2020_3/2021/05/01/06-42-20-974_330bc8ebb9c40f0e.webp","destWidth":4281,"destHeight":3211,"sourceBytes":309268,"destBytes":309268,"author":"insider@insider.com (Carla Mozée)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5f0c896e2618b913f2037e94?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn46@2020_2/2021/05/01/06-42-25-294_7f683aab4dafefdc.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn14@2020_3/2021/05/01/06-42-25-622_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=ycTgvHda5_w:ep06gU1a8X4:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn44@2020_3/2021/05/01/06-42-23-671_5bde011ced3e550e.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=ycTgvHda5_w:ep06gU1a8X4:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn38@2020_5/2021/05/01/06-42-25-834_d31239e9cc390e06.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn15@2020_2/2021/05/01/06-42-23-338_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=ycTgvHda5_w:ep06gU1a8X4:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn24@2020_4/2021/05/01/06-42-25-450_9661a7e67c518ebf.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/ycTgvHda5_w":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn98@2020_5/2021/05/01/06-42-24-124_284b2192eb576cad.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1619851324308},{"createdTime":"2021-05-01 14:42:04","updatedTime":"2021-05-01 14:42:04","title":"Biden is banning most travel from India to the US, but once said such restrictions would not stop COVID-19","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/biden-bans-most-travel-india-once-said-bans-dont-work-2021-4","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/608c5df535c46f0018c0bb46?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Biden\" height=\"1000\" width=\"2000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>US President Joe Biden speaks to the press after disembarking from Airforce One after arriving in Wilmington, Delaware on March 26, 2021.\n<p class=\"copyright\">OLIVIER DOULIERY/AFP via Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>The Biden administration is banning most travel from India amid its escalating COVID-19 outbreak. </li>\n<li>Biden has gone back and forth on the issue of travel bans. </li>\n<li>Last year, Biden said that banning all travel from any part of the world would not stop COVID-19.</li>\n<li id=\"recirc\"><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">See more stories on Insider&#39;s business page</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>The Biden administration on Friday announced it&#39;s <a href=\"https://t.co/pS6E3IrIA2?amp=1\">barring most travel from India</a> starting next week in response to the escalating COVID-19 crisis in the country. The move goes against past statements made by President Joe Biden on travel bans, including once stating that such restrictions would &#34;not stop the coronavirus.&#34;</p><p>Conservative critics of the president have <a href=\"https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2020/oct/23/donald-trump/trump-repeats-flawed-claim-biden-opposed-trumps-co/\">misleadingly said</a> that Biden called President Donald Trump&#39;s travel restrictions on China xenophobic, painting the new prohibitions on travel from India as hypocritical. Biden never explicitly said this, but he has gone back and forth on the issue of travel bans or restrictions. </p><p>On the same day Trump announced travel restrictions on China last January, Biden during a campaign speech in Iowa said, &#34;This is no time for Donald Trump&#39;s record of hysterical xenophobia and fear mongering to lead the way instead of science.&#34;</p><p>The Biden campaign <a href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/2020/03/26/trumps-faux-facts-fox-news/\">told the Washington Post</a> that he was referencing Trump&#39;s call for travel bans during the Ebola crisis as well as his travel restrictions on predominantly Muslim countries, and pointed to similar remarks Biden made in a USA Today op-ed four days before the China ban was announced. &#34;I remember how Trump sought to stoke fear and stigma during the 2014 Ebola epidemic,&#34; <a href=\"https://www.usatoday.com/story/opinion/2020/01/27/coronavirus-donald-trump-made-us-less-prepared-joe-biden-column/4581710002/\">Biden said</a> in the op-ed, denouncing Trump for pushing for &#34;reactionary travel bans that would only have made things worse.&#34;  </p><p>Biden was also critical of Trump&#39;s restrictions on travel with regard to Europe. </p><p>In <a href=\"https://twitter.com/JoeBiden/status/1238254697695326209?s=20\">a tweet</a> last March after Trump suspended travel both to and from a number of European countries, Biden said, &#34;A wall will not stop the coronavirus. Banning all travel from Europe - or any other part of the world - will not stop it. This disease could impact every nation and any person on the planet - and we need a plan to combat it.&#34; </p><p>Around that time, Biden also unveiled a plan to combat the COVID-19 pandemic. Speaking to reporters on the plan, <a href=\"https://www.rev.com/blog/transcripts/joe-biden-speech-transcript-on-coronavirus-march-12-2020\">Biden said,</a> &#34;Banning all travel from Europe or any other part of the world may slow it, but as we&#39;ve seen, it will not stop it. And travel restrictions based on favoritism and politics rather than a risk will be counterproductive.&#34;</p><p>But Biden in early April then came out and expressed support for Trump&#39;s travel restrictions on China. &#34;Joe Biden supports travel bans that are guided by medical experts, advocated by public health officials, and backed by a full strategy,&#34; Kate Bedingfield, Biden&#39;s deputy campaign manager at the time, <a href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2020/04/03/politics/joe-biden-trump-china-coronavirus/index.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">told CNN</a>. &#34;Science supported this ban, therefore he did too.&#34;</p><p>Some public health experts have <a href=\"https://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2020/03/12/815146007/public-health-experts-question-trumps-ban-on-most-travelers-from-europe\">questioned the efficacy of travel bans</a> in preventing the spread of COVID-19, though many have also advocated for <a href=\"https://www.cbsnews.com/news/covid-surge-india-travel-restrictions/\">varying levels of travel restrictions</a> regarding certain countries where the outbreaks are especially bad - including India. </p><p>Lawrence Gostin, director of the O&#39;Neill Institute for National and Global Health Law at Georgetown University Law Center, in <a href=\"https://twitter.com/LawrenceGostin/status/1388210151589564416?s=20\">a tweet</a> on Friday said, &#34;[The] US has started a humanitarian mission to assist India. A flat travel ban impedes our vital humanitarian goals. That&#39;s why proof of vaccination or a negative test makes sense, but not a ban. It doesn&#39;t stop the flow of medical supplies, but does help keep variants from our shores.&#34;</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/biden-bans-most-travel-india-once-said-bans-dont-work-2021-4'>Business Insider</a></div><div class=\"feedflare\">\n<a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=MIuVgeyXO3k:TQ8rBf7-WKU:yIl2AUoC8zA\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=MIuVgeyXO3k:TQ8rBf7-WKU:F7zBnMyn0Lo\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=MIuVgeyXO3k:TQ8rBf7-WKU:F7zBnMyn0Lo\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=MIuVgeyXO3k:TQ8rBf7-WKU:V_sGLiPBpWU\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=MIuVgeyXO3k:TQ8rBf7-WKU:V_sGLiPBpWU\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=MIuVgeyXO3k:TQ8rBf7-WKU:qj6IDK7rITs\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a border=\"0\"></img></a>\n</div><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/MIuVgeyXO3k\" height=\"1\" width=\"1\" alt=\"\"/>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Fri, 30 Apr 2021 19:53:14 +0000","feedId":22,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/608c5dd235c46f0018c0bb44?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"53e4bc4f8155fe7fda44e8aed3c6891c","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn57@2020_1/2021/05/01/06-42-21-026_de1339935c94e611.webp","destWidth":1784,"destHeight":1338,"sourceBytes":51738,"destBytes":51738,"author":"insider@insider.com (John Haltiwanger)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/608c5df535c46f0018c0bb46?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn42@2020_6/2021/05/01/06-42-23-857_6de7c30eb2986f31.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn14@2020_3/2021/05/01/06-42-25-622_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=MIuVgeyXO3k:TQ8rBf7-WKU:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn72@2020_4/2021/05/01/06-42-26-314_529f61510471c030.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=MIuVgeyXO3k:TQ8rBf7-WKU:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn17@2020_5/2021/05/01/06-42-23-082_010bbc1103d4d626.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn15@2020_2/2021/05/01/06-42-23-338_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=MIuVgeyXO3k:TQ8rBf7-WKU:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn80@2020_3/2021/05/01/06-42-24-385_a992748d0ad5aa80.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/MIuVgeyXO3k":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn15@2020_2/2021/05/01/06-42-26-405_33d4137e8978a837.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1619851324324},{"createdTime":"2021-05-01 14:42:04","updatedTime":"2021-05-01 14:42:04","title":"Abercrombie & Fitch is cool again, after years as the most hated retailer in the US, because it caught up to what millennials and Gen Z want","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/abercrombie-and-fitch-is-back-how-af-became-cool-again-2021-4","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/607ed76544f4540019207a6e?format=jpeg\" alt=\"abercrombieandfitch.JPG\" height=\"1665\" width=\"2220\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Abercrombie &#38; Fitch has made a comeback.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Andrew Kelly/Reuters</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>It&#39;s official - Abercrombie &#38; Fitch is cool again. </li>\n<li>After a massive rebrand that embraces inclusion and more wholesome, brand-agnostic clothing, its stock is on the rise.</li>\n<li data-stringify-indent=\"0\">A&#38;F <strong data-stringify-type=\"bold\">was once loathed for its superficiality, but now it&#39;s embracing the authenticity</strong> millennials and Gen Z want.</li>\n<li id=\"recirc\"><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">See more stories on Insider&#39;s business page</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>Abercrombie &#38; Fitch is cool again.</p><p>The dimly lit mall stores filled with the smell of cologne and shirtless male greeters were once the trademarks of a brand that former CEO Mike Jeffries described as being geared toward high school&#39;s &#34;<a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/abercrombie-wants-thin-customers-2013-5\">cool kids</a>&#34; who weren&#39;t &#34;overweight or unattractive.&#34;</p><p>But it turns out that Jeffries&#39; style wasn&#39;t resonating, and neither was he. After years of plunging value, today the brand has a new leader, a new aesthetic, and a new set of customers: The off-duty young professional.</p><p>Ditching the privilege and the prep for a more down-to-earth look and refined basics, Abercrombie has emerged a more wholesome and on-trend brand targeted to those entering adulthood, a reflection of the increasing spending power and changing consumer desires of the under-40 shopper.</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6081dc4f4becb800190f6a3b?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Abercrombie\" height=\"2333\" width=\"3111\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The brand was once a teen status symbol.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Reuters</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><h2><strong>The rebrand of a lifetime</strong></h2><p>The stock of Abercrombie&#39;s parent company, Abercrombie &#38; Fitch Co. (ANF), began falling in the early to mid-2010s and dropped below $10 per share four years ago, its lowest point since May 2000. Meanwhile, the company <a href=\"https://www.nasdaq.com/articles/abercrombie-fitch-co.-anf-stock-hammered-but-is-wall-street-wrong-2017-07-10\">struggled to find a buyer</a>. In 2014, Jeffries stepped down. By 2016, what was once a teen status symbol became America&#39;s <a href=\"https://digiday.com/marketing/abercrombie-fitch-americas-hated-retailer/\">most hated retailer</a>. </p><p>Roughly a year after Fran Horowitz became CEO in 2017, ANF&#39;s stock started to climb. It&#39;s soared 271% over the past year alone. The underlying reason is simple: the brand became cool again. And it doesn&#39;t look like the Abercrombie of yore.</p><p>While Hollister drives the majority of <a href=\"https://www.sec.gov/ix?doc=/Archives/edgar/data/1018840/000101884021000023/anf-20210130.htm\">A&#38;F Co.&#39;s revenue</a> (which <a href=\"https://www.marketwatch.com/investing/stock/anf/financials\">totaled $3.6 billion</a> in 2020), Abercrombie is growing its contribution thanks to a brand revival.</p><p>Along with A&#38;F&#39;s shirtless models and stark <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/celebrities-modeling-for-abercrombie-and-fitch-2016-7\">black-and-white photo campaigns</a>, Jeffries&#39; &#34;cool&#34; kids comment went out of style years ago. An A&#38;F Co. spokesperson said that statement was made over 15 years ago and doesn&#39;t reflect the brand&#39;s current values. JP Morgan CPA Matt Boss noted in a recent report that the Abercrombie product has &#34;improved materially&#34; over the past two years. </p><p>The shopping experience is also different: scrolling through the Abercrombie brand&#39;s website today is a much brighter experience than strolling its low-lit mall stores. The colors and fonts are light and breezy. The clothes are casual, familiar, and brand-agnostic now that they&#39;re mostly free of the iconic moose logo. The floral dresses and ripped jeans are photographed against a white background and worn by models diverse in both size and ethnicity. This new vibe places Abercrombie on the fashion spectrum between Reformation and Mango.</p><blockquote class=\"instagram-media\" style=\"background:#FFF; border:0; border-radius:3px; box-shadow:0 0 1px 0 rgba(0,0,0,0.5),0 1px 10px 0 rgba(0,0,0,0.15); margin: 1px; max-width:540; padding:0; width:99.375%; width:-webkit-calc(100% - 2px); width:calc(100% - 2px); data.width~540;\">\n\t<div style=\"padding:8px;\">\n\t\t<div style=\"background:#F8F8F8; line-height:0; margin-top:40px; padding:62.4537037037% 0; text-align:center; width:100%;\">\n\t\t\t<div style=\"background:url(data:image/png;base64,); display:block; height:44px; margin:0 auto -44px; position:relative; top:-22px; width:44px;\"></div>\n\t\t</div>\n\t\t<p style=\"margin:8px 0 0 0; padding:0 4px;\">\n\t\t\t<a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/p/CNne571nvWa\" style=\" color:#000; font-family:Arial,sans-serif; font-size:14px; font-style:normal; font-weight:normal; line-height:17px; text-decoration:none; word-wrap:break-word;\" target=\"_blank\"></a></p> <p style=\" color:#c9c8cd; font-family:Arial,sans-serif; font-size:14px; line-height:17px; margin-bottom:0; margin-top:8px; overflow:hidden; padding:8px 0 7px; text-align:center; text-overflow:ellipsis; white-space:nowrap;\">A post shared by Abercrombie &#38; Fitch (@abercrombie)<time style=\" font-family:Arial,sans-serif; font-size:14px; line-height:17px;\" datetime=\"\"></time>\n\t\t</p></div></blockquote><script async=\"\" defer=\"\" src=\"//platform.instagram.com/en_US/embeds.js\"></script><h2><strong>Speaking to millennials and Gen Z</strong></h2><p>The rebrand seems to have been in the works since shortly after Jeffries&#39; departure. In 2016, Abercrombie&#39;s former executive chairman, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/abercrombie-and-fitch-then-and-now-2016-1#abercrombie-used-to-feature-naked-people-1\">Arthur Martinez, told Insider</a> that the brand wanted to appeal to an older demographic, subsequently toning down its once sultry ads.</p><p>&#34;They&#39;re entering a true adulthood,&#34; he said of Abercrombie&#39;s targeted shopper. &#34;They have a more refined sensibility, a great sense of themselves.&#34; </p><p>While the brand&#39;s old style may have spoken to its predominently teenage customers, Abercrombie has &#34;been trying to attract older youth and young professionals with casual wear,&#34; said Jonathan Treiber, cofounder and CEO of management solutions company RevTrax. Boss agreed, noting that the canny update of both Abercrombie and its sister brand Hollister has carved out separate niches for the digital consumer in their mid-20s and the <a href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-04-25/are-u-s-malls-dead-not-if-gen-z-keeps-shopping-the-way-they-do\">teen mall shopper</a>, respectively. </p><p>A company spokesperson confirmed these observations, stating that Abercrombie seeks to cater to &#34;global young millennials&#34; while Hollister is the &#34;quintessential brand of the global teen customer.&#34; The spokesperson described the brand as celebrating &#34;the individuality and authenticity of our associates and customers.&#34; It&#39;s no coincidence that this tracks with <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/why-luxury-is-struggling-to-connect-with-gen-z-tiktok-2020-1\">the values that next-gen consumers want</a> - everybody is a &#34;cool kid&#34; in the TikTok era. </p><p>The company was &#34;wise&#34; to evolve to a more accepting image. Treiber recalls the brand&#39;s &#34;raunchy&#34; days when scantily-clad, kissing couples adorned the stores&#39; walls, displays, and shopping bags. Today&#39;s color photos of a diverse group of smiling, beach-going, bike-riding young people fit the more modern lifestyle ideals of wellness and inclusion perpetuated by millennials and Gen Z.</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6081dbc44becb800190f6a36?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Abercrombie\" height=\"599\" width=\"799\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>An ad from the old days of Abercrombie &#38; Fitch.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Abercrombie</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>Shoppers also won&#39;t find as many shirts or hoodies emblazoned with &#34;Abercrombie&#34; anymore, which is &#34;something that resonated with younger shoppers who want less billboard-type apparel these days,&#34; Treiber said. </p><p>Younger generations also care about building a &#34;<a href=\"https://stylewise-blog.com/sustainable-ethical-capsule-wardrobe/\">capsule wardrobe</a>&#34; to be more sustainable, buying a few good items of good quality that will be seen as timeless as the endless cycle of fast fashion prevails. A spokesperson said the company is looking at making its practices more sustainable, telling Insider the brand knows there is still more work to be done. </p><p>The company says it has doubled-down on social media and influencer marketing to reach its target demographic. Its Instagram has <a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/abercrombie/?hl=en\">nearly 5 million followers</a> and has been featured on popular content creators such as <a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/mikzazon/\">Mik Zazon</a> and <a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/whitneywiley/\">Whitney Wiley</a>.</p><p>This also includes getting involved in issues millennials and Gen Z value. Last year, the brand launched The Abercrombie Equity Project, a social and racial justice initiative to &#34;empower&#34; the voices of &#34;marginalized&#34; communities. It partnered with The Steve Fund, a nonprofit that supports mental health initiatives for people of color. In support of Black History Month, Abercrombie Equity Project donated <a href=\"https://www.abercrombie.com/shop/us/about-us\">$250,000</a> to the organization. </p><blockquote class=\"instagram-media\" style=\"background:#FFF; border:0; border-radius:3px; box-shadow:0 0 1px 0 rgba(0,0,0,0.5),0 1px 10px 0 rgba(0,0,0,0.15); margin: 1px; max-width:540; padding:0; width:99.375%; width:-webkit-calc(100% - 2px); width:calc(100% - 2px); data.width~540;\">\n\t<div style=\"padding:8px;\">\n\t\t<div style=\"background:#F8F8F8; line-height:0; margin-top:40px; padding:62.4537037037% 0; text-align:center; width:100%;\">\n\t\t\t<div style=\"background:url(data:image/png;base64,); display:block; height:44px; margin:0 auto -44px; position:relative; top:-22px; width:44px;\"></div>\n\t\t</div>\n\t\t<p style=\"margin:8px 0 0 0; padding:0 4px;\">\n\t\t\t<a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/p/CM4q3ZRHPnd\" style=\" color:#000; font-family:Arial,sans-serif; font-size:14px; font-style:normal; font-weight:normal; line-height:17px; text-decoration:none; word-wrap:break-word;\" target=\"_blank\"></a></p> <p style=\" color:#c9c8cd; font-family:Arial,sans-serif; font-size:14px; line-height:17px; margin-bottom:0; margin-top:8px; overflow:hidden; padding:8px 0 7px; text-align:center; text-overflow:ellipsis; white-space:nowrap;\">A post shared by Abercrombie &#38; Fitch (@abercrombie)<time style=\" font-family:Arial,sans-serif; font-size:14px; line-height:17px;\" datetime=\"\"></time>\n\t\t</p></div></blockquote><script async=\"\" defer=\"\" src=\"//platform.instagram.com/en_US/embeds.js\"></script><p> </p><p>Despite Abercrombie&#39;s social revival, the brand has become unprofitable in the past 12 months with revenue dropping by 14%. This might, in part, be because the pandemic hit the retail industry harder than the <a href=\"https://www.emarketer.com/content/covid-19-impact-on-worldwide-retail-will-worse-than-great-recession?_ga=2.8249463.450213000.1618839208-1810322986.1556641433\">Great Recession did</a>. By June 2020, <a href=\"https://www.emarketer.com/content/covid-19-impact-on-worldwide-retail-will-worse-than-great-recession?_ga=2.252562764.450213000.1618839208-1810322986.1556641433\">Insider Intelligence predicted</a> that retail sales worldwide for the year would be down 5.7% from 2019. The A&#38;F spokesperson also noted that they made long-term investments to grow the brand.</p><p><a href=\"https://simplywall.st/stocks/us/retail/nyse-anf/abercrombie-fitch?blueprint=1593308&utm_medium=finance_user&utm_campaign=integrated-pitch&utm_source=nasdaq#futureasdaq#future\">Simply Wall St.</a> estimates ANF stock will be up 62.7% in the next one to three years based on estimates from 10 analysts. UBS upgraded ANF stock from neutral to buy earlier this month, and JP Morgan raised ANF stock price target from $32 to $37. Boss of JPMorgan noted that Abercrombie expects a low-single-digit long-term growth rate in revenue. </p><p>As Saunders wrote in 2018, &#34;In our view, the range - especially at Abercrombie - is now more sophisticated, is more on-trend, and better reflects what modern consumers want.&#34; </p><p>And those consumers seem to agree. According to Piper Jaffray&#39;s semi-annual Taking Stock with Teens survey, the number of teens who said they didn&#39;t wear Abercrombie and Fitch declined from 8% to 4% between spring 2018 and fall 2019. Last year, Abercrombie&#39;s high-rise super skinny was named top jeans on the top popular shopping app LIKEtoKNOWit. And, as this demographic becomes <a href=\"https://www.msn.com/en-us/money/companies/skinny-jeans-are-out-and-wide-leg-denim-is-in-vogue-the-world-is-in-a-new-denim-cycle-levis-ceo-says/ar-BB1frGEW\">disenchanted with skinny jeans</a>, its 90s-high-rise and &#39;mom&#39; jeans have been <a href=\"https://www.popsugar.com/fashion/best-abercrombie-jeans-tiktok-48284504\">all over TikTok</a>.</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the (Hillary Hoffower,Dominic-Madori Davis)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/607ed76544f4540019207a6e?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn76@2020_4/2021/05/01/06-42-24-341_3b2d83f046e66f34.webp","https://i.insider.com/6081dc4f4becb800190f6a3b?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn76@2020_6/2021/05/01/06-42-22-833_3732ed2f3e44eece.webp","https://i.insider.com/6081dbc44becb800190f6a36?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn44@2020_2/2021/05/01/06-42-26-667_1d5fef49117192fe.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn14@2020_3/2021/05/01/06-42-25-622_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=eTrGnQ87hyQ:7sa4ZdSAx78:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn42@2020_5/2021/05/01/06-42-25-285_337dad5130450bfe.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=eTrGnQ87hyQ:7sa4ZdSAx78:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn64@2020_4/2021/05/01/06-42-26-001_c93bf4482e8cd82e.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn15@2020_2/2021/05/01/06-42-23-338_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=eTrGnQ87hyQ:7sa4ZdSAx78:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn11@2020_6/2021/05/01/06-42-23-407_31391618682a3a41.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/eTrGnQ87hyQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn78@2020_5/2021/05/01/06-42-25-993_f1facdc05c9aee38.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1619851324320},{"createdTime":"2021-05-01 14:42:04","updatedTime":"2021-05-01 14:42:04","title":"Pool owners are bracing for a record chlorine shortage that could send prices skyrocketing. Experts say there’s an easy fix to avoid the crisis altogether.","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/pool-owner-chlorine-shortage-saltwater-2021-4","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fee2e429ff41f001883f9e9?format=jpeg\" alt=\"pool cleaning\" height=\"2657\" width=\"3543\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Chlorine can kill germs, but alcohol is more effective.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Bill Oxford/ Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>Chlorine is in high demand but low supply as pool ownership rises and material availability falls.</li>\n<li>Experts warn that the US chlorine shortage will be the worst in recent memory.</li>\n<li>But saltwater pools, experts add, are a good alternative to chlorine pools. </li>\n<li id=\"recirc\"><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">See more stories on Insider&#39;s business page</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>Pool owners may need to switch gears this summer as a major chlorine storage puts pressure on the pool industry. This summer, pool owners and builders are bracing for &#34;the worst chlorine shortage the country has ever seen,&#34; <a href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/04/30/a-major-chlorine-shortage-is-set-to-spoil-swimming-pool-fun-this-summer.html\">CNBC reported Friday.</a> </p><p>Industry publications started reporting on the shortage of chlorine tablets last year. Supply was squeezed due to a fire at a chlorine manufacturer called BioLab as well as an increase in demand for pools and pool upkeep as homeowners weathered the coronavirus pandemic lockdowns, <a href=\"https://www.poolmagazine.com/industry-news-news/chlorine-tablet-shortage-due-to-covid-19-biolab-fire/\">Pool Magazine reported in September. </a> More pool companies were switching to alternative methods of sanitizing pool water, the magazine reported, predicting the price of chlorine would continue to rise. The trade publications&#39; predictions came to pass. </p><p>The price for chlorine used in pools has nearly doubled over the past year, and it&#39;s expected to keep rising this summer as pool use increases, according to CNBC. The shortage is set to be the worst in recent US history, CNBC reported.</p><p>However, there are alternatives to chlorine pools. Saltwater pools are a popular method that many find to be gentler on their hair, skin, and eyes and don&#39;t require the in-demand chemical. </p><p>Goldman Sachs analysts also recently warned of the chlorine tablet shortage and discussed other methods to keep pools clean, <a href=\"https://finance.yahoo.com/news/chlorine-shortage-stands-to-wreak-havoc-on-summer-pool-season-goldman-sachs-165313311.html\">Yahoo Finance reported on Monday</a>. &#34;There&#39;s no shortage of ways to sanitize the pool. It just simply means at a certain point people will shift,&#34; an executive from Pool Corp said on the bank&#39;s earnings call, according to Yahoo. &#34;We&#39;ve also seen certain parts of the country accelerating the use of salt as a method of sanitization too.&#34;</p><p>Saltwater pools, according to <a href=\"https://www.healthline.com/health/salt-water-pool\">Healthline</a>, work by generating their own chlorine, but in a much smaller amount than in traditional tablets or liquid chemicals. Saltwater pools require testing for salt buildup and erosion, but are less harsh on people with allergies and asthma. </p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/pool-owner-chlorine-shortage-saltwater-2021-4'>Business Insider</a></div><div class=\"feedflare\">\n<a 2021 18:52:17 (Annabelle Williams)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5fee2e429ff41f001883f9e9?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn25@2020_2/2021/05/01/06-42-16-644_14a335dbb0f29ae2.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn14@2020_3/2021/05/01/06-42-25-622_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=lYlSoQChFjw:GSsxtTFkbTA:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn27@2020_4/2021/05/01/06-42-24-787_ac71f3efbb5fdc3d.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=lYlSoQChFjw:GSsxtTFkbTA:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn91@2020_3/2021/05/01/06-42-22-423_1f79af974ff96ca3.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn15@2020_2/2021/05/01/06-42-23-338_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=lYlSoQChFjw:GSsxtTFkbTA:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn33@2020_2/2021/05/01/06-42-24-937_e6aadf473e05b700.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/lYlSoQChFjw":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn28@2020_2/2021/05/01/06-42-22-250_5b5aa23737cdde5c.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1619851324322},{"createdTime":"2021-05-01 14:42:04","updatedTime":"2021-05-01 14:42:04","title":"Newsmax settles a defamation lawsuit from a Dominion executive at the center of election conspiracy theories and issues an apology","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/newsmax-settles-dominion-executive-eric-coomer-defamation-lawsuit-and-apologizes-2021-4","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fb24eca1c741f0019ac9e83?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Newsmax Media CEO Christopher Ruddy attends a dinner with the US president and business leaders in Bedminster, New Jersey, on August 7, 2018.\" height=\"2206\" width=\"2941\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Newsmax Media CEO Christopher Ruddy attends a dinner with Donald Trump and business leaders.\n<p class=\"copyright\">BRENDAN SMIALOWSKI/AFP via Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>Dominion executive Eric Coomer reached a settlement with Newsmax, which he sued for defamation.</li>\n<li>Newsmax pushed false theories Coomer was in an &#34;Antifa conference call&#34; to rig the election.</li>\n<li>Coomer is still suing others, and his legal efforts are separate from Dominion&#39;s own lawsuits.</li>\n<li id=\"recirc\"><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">See more stories on Insider&#39;s business page</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>An executive at Dominion Voting Systems moved to dismiss Newsmax as a defendant in a defamation lawsuit Friday after reaching a settlement with the right-wing media organization.</p><p>It&#39;s the first such settlement from a news organization in a defamation lawsuit filed over 2020 election conspiracy theories.</p><p>The lawsuit, filed by Dominion&#39;s head of product strategy and security Eric Coomer, is among several filed over false claims that election technology companies like Dominion rigged the election against former president Donald Trump and in favor of now-President Joe Biden. </p><p>Coomer sued Newsmax in December in state court in Colorado over false claims that he took part in an &#34;Antifa conference call&#34; to rig the 2020 presidential election against Donald Trump. He revised his lawsuit in February to bolster his claims against Newsmax, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/dominion-executive-eric-coomer-defamation-lawsuit-amended-2021-3\">as Insider previously reported</a>.</p><p>On Friday, Newsmax <a href=\"https://www.newsmax.com/newsfront/eric-coomer-dominion-voting-systems/2021/04/30/id/1019671/\">issued a retraction and apology on its website</a> saying it found &#34;no evidence&#34; that earlier claims about Coomer and the 2020 election were true.</p><p>&#34;There are several facts that our viewers should be aware of. Newsmax has found no evidence that Dr. Coomer interfered with Dominion voting machines or voting software in any way, nor that Dr. Coomer ever claimed to have done so,&#34; the statement reads. &#34;Nor has Newsmax found any evidence that Dr. Coomer ever participated in any conversation with members of &#39;Antifa,&#39; nor that he was directly involved with any partisan political organization.&#34;</p><p>The terms of the settlement were not disclosed in the court filings reviewed by Insider. A representative for Coomer declined to comment on the settlement terms. A representative for Newsmax declined to comment and directed Insider to <a href=\"https://www.newsmax.com/t/newsmax/article/1019671\">its apology statement</a>.</p><h2>Coomer went into hiding after receiving death threats over the conspiracies</h2><p>Coomer first became the subject of conspiracy theories after Joe Oltmann, a right-wing political operative, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/dominion-executive-eric-coomer-defamation-lawsuit-amended-2021-3\">claimed without evidence</a> that he was a member of &#34;Antifa&#34; - a loosely linked group of left-wing activists who oppose fascist movements - and worked to rig the 2020 election. <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/trump-campaign-lawsuits-election-results-2020-11\">Numerous lawsuits</a>, recounts, and investigations have turned up no widespread evidence of irregularities in the 2020 election.</p><p>Oltmann&#39;s baseless claims spread like wildfire in right-wing media circles, and Coomer went into hiding after receiving numerous death threats. Coomer sued more than a dozen right-wing media figures he claims were responsible for pushing the conspiracy theories. He alleged defamation, intentionally inflicted emotional distress, and civil conspiracy over the claims.</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/608c767034af8d001859a64c?format=jpeg\" alt=\"dominion ceo john poulos\" height=\"1666\" width=\"2223\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>President and CEO of Election Systems &#38; Software Tom Burt, President and CEO of Dominion Voting Systems John Poulos, President and CEO of Hart InterCivic Julie Mathis testify during a hearing on Capitol Hill.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Alex Wong/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>Newsmax had steadfastly claimed it did nothing wrong as recently as February, when <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/dominion-executive-eric-coomer-defamation-lawsuit-amended-2021-3\">a spokesperson told Insider that Coomer&#39;s lawsuit was politically motivated</a>. The media organization is owned and run by Christopher Ruddy, a close friend of Trump&#39;s.</p><p>In a statement, Cain and Skarnulis PLLC, the law firm representing Coomer, said he continues to receive death threats.</p><p>&#34;Six months after the election, Dr. Coomer continues to receive death threats and harassment from those who believe the false conspiracy theories,&#34; the statement reads.</p><p>All of the other people and organizations Coomer has sued - including Oltmann, Trump&#39;s campaign, Sidney Powell, Rudy Giuliani, One America News Network, and others - remain defendants in the lawsuit.</p><p>&#34;With respect to the remaining defendants, Dr. Coomer is seeking damages to his reputation and livelihood and, once certified by the court, punitive damages,&#34; the statement from Coomer&#39;s law firm reads.</p><p>Coomer&#39;s lawsuit is distinct from <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/dominion-trump-fox-news-newsmax-oan-sidney-powell-defamation-lawsuits-2021-1\">the legal efforts of Dominion itself</a>, which is represented by the defamation firm Clare Locke LLP. <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/everyone-dominion-smartmatic-suing-defamation-election-conspiracy-theories-2021-2\">Dominion has sued</a> Fox News, Powell, Giuliani, and MyPillow mogul Mike Lindell. Smartmatic, another election technology caught up in election conspiracy theories, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/everyone-dominion-smartmatic-suing-defamation-election-conspiracy-theories-2021-2\">has filed its own defamation lawsuits</a> against right-wing media figures over the falsehoods. </p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/newsmax-settles-dominion-executive-eric-coomer-defamation-lawsuit-and-apologizes-2021-4'>Business Insider</a></div><div class=\"feedflare\">\n<a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=c-kTb-Cpop4:7TuWRsI_t3w:yIl2AUoC8zA\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=c-kTb-Cpop4:7TuWRsI_t3w:F7zBnMyn0Lo\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=c-kTb-Cpop4:7TuWRsI_t3w:F7zBnMyn0Lo\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=c-kTb-Cpop4:7TuWRsI_t3w:V_sGLiPBpWU\"><img border=\"0\"></img></a>\n</div><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/c-kTb-Cpop4\" height=\"1\" width=\"1\" alt=\"\"/>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Fri, 30 Apr 2021 21:51:14 +0000","feedId":22,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/608c75c134af8d001859a648?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"9f385ff6840f0b9c54060241deeeefa4","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn74@2020_1/2021/05/01/06-42-21-228_d9d074f8d4b22124.webp","destWidth":2053,"destHeight":1540,"sourceBytes":110750,"destBytes":110750,"author":"jshamsian@insider.com (Jacob Shamsian)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5fb24eca1c741f0019ac9e83?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn40@2020_3/2021/05/01/06-42-21-341_3081273cdda2cb79.webp","https://i.insider.com/608c767034af8d001859a64c?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn82@2020_2/2021/05/01/06-42-24-015_b18c66811d184644.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn14@2020_3/2021/05/01/06-42-25-622_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=c-kTb-Cpop4:7TuWRsI_t3w:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn17@2020_4/2021/05/01/06-42-24-288_d694c802613863c1.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=c-kTb-Cpop4:7TuWRsI_t3w:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn22@2020_2/2021/05/01/06-42-23-735_b48157fe4c3412ad.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn15@2020_2/2021/05/01/06-42-23-338_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=c-kTb-Cpop4:7TuWRsI_t3w:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn64@2020_6/2021/05/01/06-42-26-328_659f39edfaa212c6.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/c-kTb-Cpop4":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn81@2020_6/2021/05/01/06-42-23-641_51a5f57da6fc0cda.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1619851324302},{"createdTime":"2021-05-01 14:42:04","updatedTime":"2021-05-01 14:42:04","title":"A guide to using RSS feeds, the files that contain real-time updates from websites","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/what-is-rss-feed","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/608c471035c46f0018c0bab2?format=jpeg\" alt=\"woman in cafe looking at phone and laptop\" height=\"1249\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>An RSS feed is essentially a list of content - articles, posts, or podcasts - consolidated in one location.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Tom Werner/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li aria-level=\"1\">An RSS feed is a file that contains a summary of updates from a website, often in the form of a list of articles with links.</li>\n<li aria-level=\"1\">RSS stands for Really Simple Syndication, and it offers an easy way to stay up to date on new content from websites you care about. </li>\n<li aria-level=\"1\">You can read an RSS feed using a program or website called an RSS reader. </li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/tech-reference\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\"><strong>Visit Insider&#39;s Tech Reference library for more stories</strong></a><strong>.</strong></li>\n</ul><p>While not as popular as it once was, RSS is still used by many people to stay informed about news, podcasts, and other information online. RSS - which stands for &#34;Really Simple Syndication&#34; - is a protocol that provides a standard method for websites to publish updates that anyone can see by displaying them in a program or website called an RSS reader. </p><h2>What is an RSS feed?</h2><p>Fundamentally, RSS is simply an XML text file. It&#39;s created by a website publisher and contains a running list of articles or other content published by the site, with the newest entry always at the top of the list. Each entry contains details like the article&#39;s title, description, and link to the content.</p><p><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/category/rss-feed\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">RSS feeds</a> are published and updated in real time, so if you subscribe to a site&#39;s RSS feed, you&#39;ll always have access to the newest published content. That can be handy for news sites and podcasts that are frequently updated. </p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/608c422e35c46f0018c0ba8e?format=jpeg\" alt=\"What_is_an_RSS_feed 1\" height=\"1246\" width=\"1939\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>An RSS file is unremarkable - it&#39;s just a text file with information about updates to the website.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Dave Johnson/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><h2>What to know about RSS readers</h2><p>Because an RSS feed is a text file that contains a stream of article descriptions and links, it isn&#39;t designed to be read or used directly by you. Instead, users rely on a program called an RSS reader. This is a simple program that reads the RSS feed and displays the list of articles in a way that makes them easy to browse.</p><p>Many RSS readers can display a single unified view that aggregates content from all the websites you have subscribed to in chronological order - sort of like the way a unified inbox shows email from multiple accounts at once - or you can browse each website individually. </p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/608c42cb35c46f0018c0ba92?format=jpeg\" alt=\"What_is_an_RSS_feed 2\" height=\"1446\" width=\"2010\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>A typical RSS reader reads an RSS feed and displays summaries of all the new articles which you can browse and read.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Dave Johnson/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>RSS readers are used to aggregate news. Users can subscribe to RSS feeds from the websites and sources of interest to them, and use an RSS reader to scan headlines and read articles from a variety of sources. This is less common today because many people tend to use social media to aggregate news, though it&#39;s less efficient because social media platforms use proprietary algorithms to determine what headlines users see. With RSS, you see everything that&#39;s published by the sources you subscribe to. </p><p>There are quite a number of RSS reader programs to choose from. Some are free, while others are paid programs that you need to purchase or subscribe to. </p><aside class=\"breakout-box headline-regular\"><h2><strong>How to use an RSS feed </strong></h2><p>To use RSS, you need to perform these steps: </p><ol><li><strong>Get an RSS reader</strong>. Some of the most popular RSS readers include <a href=\"https://jangernert.github.io/FeedReader/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Feedreader</a>, <a href=\"https://feedly.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Feedly</a>, and <a href=\"https://theoldreader.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">The Old Reader</a>. Create an account so you&#39;re ready to subscribe to some RSS feeds. </li><li><strong>Find the link to an RSS feed</strong>. You&#39;ll need to know the URL to the RSS feed for the website you want to subscribe to. Some websites place an RSS link on their homepage - look for it at the very top (in the header of the site) or at the bottom in the footer. It will look like waves, similar to a Wi-Fi icon. Click it and copy the URL. Finding RSS icons on the homepage of a website is less common than it used to be, so if you don&#39;t see it, you can perform a web search, such as &#34;Insider RSS feed.&#34; Find the page and copy the link.<br><br><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/608c441135c46f0018c0baa0?format=jpeg\" alt=\"What_is_an_RSS_feed 3\" height=\"1000\" width=\"2511\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Some websites display an RSS icon that gives you direct access to the RSS feed URL.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Dave Johnson/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure></li><li><strong>Subscribe to the RSS feed</strong>. In the RSS reader program, find the link to add a new feed and enter the URL of the feed. After you add it, you should immediately see a list of articles. You can now browse and click the article you want to read. </li><li><strong>Subscribe to more feeds</strong>. You can continue adding RSS feeds to your RSS reader until you&#39;re aggregating all the websites you want to keep track of. <br><br><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/608c45c134af8d001859a51e?format=jpeg\" alt=\"What_is_an_RSS_feed 4\" height=\"1667\" width=\"1998\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>An RSS reader is a great tool for making sure you see a broad range of news from multiple sources.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Dave Johnson/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure></li></ol><p> </p></aside><bi-shortcode id=\"related-article-module-end-of-article\" class=\"mceNonEditable\"><a data-type=\"6055217ba7e94b52167b9b69\" data-title=\"What are Twitter Newsletters? 14:42:04","updatedTime":"2021-05-01 14:42:04","title":"Former Netflix executive convicted of fraud after orchestrating more than $500,000 in bribes and kickbacks","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/ex-netflix-convicted-on-fraud-charges-in-bribery-kickback-scheme-2021-4","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/60819fee4becb800190f68c5?format=jpeg\" alt=\"netflix\" height=\"654\" width=\"873\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Photo Illustration by Chesnot/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>Ex-Netflix IT chief Michael Kail on Friday was convicted of 28 counts of fraud and money laundering.</li>\n<li>Kail created a &#34;pay-to-play&#34; scheme, taking bribes and kickbacks from tech startups hoping to do business with Netflix.</li>\n<li>Kail, who was indicted in 2018, must also forfeit a Los Gatos home he purchased with the funds.</li>\n<li id=\"recirc\"><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">See more stories on Insider&#39;s business page</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>Former Netflix vice president of IT Michael Kail was convicted by a federal jury on Friday of 28 counts of fraud and money laundering, the US Department of Justice announced in a press release.</p><p>Kail, who was indicted in 2018, used his position to create a &#34;pay-to-play&#34; scheme where he approved contracts with outside tech companies looking to do business with Netflix in exchange for taking bribes and kickbacks, according to evidence presented to the jury, the release said.</p><p>Kail accepted bribes or kickbacks from nine different companies totaling more than $500,000 as well as stock options, according to the DOJ&#39;s press release.</p><p>The jury also ordered Kail to forfeit to the government a home he purchased in Los Gatos, California, using the funds he obtained through the illegal scheme.</p><p>&#34;Bribery undermines fair competition and innovation in any business arena, and particularly Silicon Valley&#39;s highly competitive environment of cutting-edge innovation,&#34; acting US Attorney Stephanie Hinds said in a press release.</p><p>&#34;As Netflix&#39;s Vice President of IT Operations, Michael Kail wielded immense power to approve valuable Netflix contracts with small tech vendors, and he rigged that process to unlock a stream of cash and stock kickbacks to himself. Netflix and other companies expect and deserve honest services from its employees.&#34; </p><p><a href=\"https://www.vox.com/2014/11/25/11633290/netflix-sues-a-former-exec-now-yahoos-cio-for-allegedly-collecting\">Netflix sued Kail</a> after he left the company in 2014 to take a role as Yahoo&#39;s CIO, accusing him of fraud and breaching his fiduciary duties. Netflix declined to comment.</p><p>According to the DOJ, Kail faces a maximum sentence of up to 20 years in prison and a fine - either $250,000, twice the gross amount he pocketed as part of the scheme, or twice the amount of Netflix&#39;s loss, whichever is greatest - for each wire or mail fraud conviction, as well as up to 10 years in prison and a $250,000 fine for each money laundering conviction.</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/ex-netflix-convicted-on-fraud-charges-in-bribery-kickback-scheme-2021-4'>Business 14:42:04","updatedTime":"2021-05-01 14:42:04","title":"Biden's Pentagon says it's canceling all border wall projects paid for with money Trump took from the military","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/pentagon-cancels-border-wall-projects-paid-for-with-military-funds-2021-4","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5e345172e0e1442c60161f22?format=jpeg\" alt=\"border wall\" height=\"2396\" width=\"4793\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Government contractors erect a section of Pentagon-funded border wall in Yuma Arizona, September 10, 2019.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Matt York/AP</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>The Pentagon is canceling all border wall projects that used redirected military funding.</li>\n<li>Under Trump, a national emergency declaration allowed military funds to be funneled to border projects.</li>\n<li>One of Biden&#39;s first acts as president was to halt work on the border wall.</li>\n<li id=\"recirc\"><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">See more stories on Insider&#39;s business page</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>The Pentagon said Friday that it is canceling border wall projects paid for with money taken from the military and reallocating the funds to their original purposes.</p><p>After declaring a national emergency at the US-Mexico border in 2019, the Trump administration took billions of dollars originally intended for military projects and redirected the money to a border wall.</p><p>On President Joe Biden&#39;s first day in office, he issued a proclamation ending that emergency. It stated that &#34;it shall be the policy of my administration that no more American taxpayer dollars be diverted to construct a border wall.&#34;</p><p>Biden also announced a review of resources that were diverted from other projects to fund the wall.</p><p>An administration official told The Hill that starting Friday, the Pentagon &#34;will begin canceling all wall projects using the diverted funds.&#34;</p><p>The Pentagon confirmed that in an official statement.</p><p>&#34;The Department of Defense is proceeding with canceling all border barrier construction projects paid for with funds originally intended for other military missions and functions such as schools for military children, overseas military construction projects in partner nations, and the National Guard and Reserve equipment account,&#34; Deputy Pentagon Spokesman Jamal Brown said.</p><p>He added that &#34;today&#39;s action reflects this administration&#39;s continued commitment to defending our nation and supporting our service members and their families.&#34;</p><p>The Pentagon said that it is reviewing the list of projects that were deferred to pay for the border wall in order to prioritize funding. The department said that the aim is to allow &#34;critical efforts to move forward as soon as possible.&#34;</p><p>Biden campaigned on rolling back the Trump administration&#39;s strict immigration policies, and in August, he stressed that &#34;there will not be another foot of wall constructed on my administration.&#34;</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/pentagon-cancels-border-wall-projects-paid-for-with-military-funds-2021-4'>Business Insider</a></div><div class=\"feedflare\">\n<a src=\"https://i.insider.com/608cde95f22c6b00185db1c3?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Jerry Falwell Jr liberty university\" height=\"1095\" width=\"2190\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Jerry Falwell Jr., president of Liberty University, awaits the arrival of U.S. President Donald Trump to sign an executive order linking &#34;free speech&#34; efforts at public universities to federal grants in the East Room at the White House in Washington, U.S., March 21, 2019.\n<p class=\"copyright\">REUTERS/Joshua Roberts</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>Liberty University filed a lawsuit against former President Jerry Falwell Jr. two weeks ago. </li>\n<li>On Thursday, he showed up at a student event and invited them to a graduation party at his home. </li>\n<li>Liberty has also banned all staff from communicating with Falwell. </li>\n<li id=\"recirc\"><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">See more stories on Insider&#39;s business page</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>Former Liberty president Jerry Falwell Jr. showed up at a student event uninvited and announced a graduation party at his home, a few weeks after the university sued him, <a href=\"https://www.politico.com/news/2021/04/30/jerry-falwell-liberty-graduation-485112\">Politico</a> reported. </p><p>&#34;I just want to invite all the seniors to my farm on May 8. We&#39;re going to have the real Liberty graduation,&#34; Falwell told the students, standing on a small stage erected outside an off-campus student house, according to a video reviewed by POLITICO. &#34;If you&#39;re not a senior but you date one, you can come, too.&#34;</p><p>Two weeks ago, Liberty University filed <a href=\"https://www.documentcloud.org/documents/20617764-liberty-university-jerry-falwell-lawsuit\" data-analytics-module=\"body_link\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"40\" data-uri=\"087a1b7e50af5392853b2b654a342568\">a lawsuit</a> in Virginia state court against Falwell alleging <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/jerry-falwell-jr-gave-raise-covering-affair-wife-lawsuit-2021-4\">he misused university resources and tried to conceal a relationship</a> involving a former pool boy. The University also banned all staff from communicating with Falwell. </p><p>The university said in the lawsuit that Falwell&#39;s years-long effort to conceal his  &#34;illicit conduct&#34; hurt the university&#39;s reputation and breached the school code of conduct. </p><p>Politico reported that Falwell and his wife Becki showed up to a Thursday school event where around 200 students were gathered unannounced and uninvited. </p><p>A student who was there told Politico that Falwell&#39;s daughter, who is also a student at the university, told Falwell  &#34;Please don&#39;t come.&#34;</p><p>The Falwells have been engrossed in controversy including reports that he and Becki had a multi-year affair with a pool boy. </p><p>&#34;We&#39;d love to have you out there. Becki says there&#39;s no way we can plan it that fast, but we can and we will,&#34; Falwell said. He also encouraged students to share party information on social media, Politico reported. </p><p>In August 2020, Giancarlo Granda <a href=\"https://www.reuters.com/investigates/special-report/usa-falwell-relationship\" data-analytics-module=\"body_link\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"60\" data-uri=\"e6186ad9ebc1a7c549bc9e61aeaa9032\">told Reuters</a> that he had a multi-year sexual relationship with Falwell and his wife Becki. Granada said he met the couple in Miami in 2012. </p><p>Falwell said it was only his wife who participated in the affair.</p><p>In August 2020, Falwell <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/jerry-falwell-jr-photo-pants-unzipped-yacht-party-backstory-2021-4\">posted a picture of himself with his pants unzipped</a>, holding an alcoholic beverage in his hand, and with his arm around a woman at a yacht party. The photo <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/jerry-falwell-jr-taking-indefinite-leave-of-absence-liberty-university-2020-8\" data-analytics-module=\"body_link\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"20\" data-uri=\"9d939362db5fae5cda6d6338db4890d4\">outraged the US evangelical Christian community</a>.</p><p>The photo also violated Liberty&#39;s code of conduct. The university strictly requires students to dress &#34;modestly&#34; and also bars students from drinking. </p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a Al-Arshani)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/608cde95f22c6b00185db1c3?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn59@2020_1/2021/05/01/06-42-25-968_eba8c15deee16d78.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn14@2020_3/2021/05/01/06-42-25-622_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=4KwvIlyLU2o:-6CjIBrxwgA:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn88@2020_2/2021/05/01/06-42-22-304_90b0b6762984dacb.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=4KwvIlyLU2o:-6CjIBrxwgA:V_sGLiPBpWU":null,"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn15@2020_2/2021/05/01/06-42-23-338_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=4KwvIlyLU2o:-6CjIBrxwgA:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn33@2020_3/2021/05/01/06-42-23-990_25beaa4269c3daa5.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/4KwvIlyLU2o":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn31@2020_5/2021/05/01/06-42-26-535_3d1d3c1e0b146a83.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1619851324300},{"createdTime":"2021-05-01 14:42:04","updatedTime":"2021-05-01 14:42:04","title":"Billionaire Eli Broad, who reshaped Los Angeles' landscape, dead at 87","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/eli-broad-dead-at-87-obituary-2021-4","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/608cae8934af8d001859a684?format=jpeg\" alt=\"AP17286613523150\" height=\"1500\" width=\"3000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>In this Sept. 16, 2015 file photo Eli Broad poses for a photo at his museum, &#34;The Broad&#34; in downtown Los Angeles.\n<p class=\"copyright\">AP Photo/Richard Vogel, File</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>Businessman and philanthropist Eli Broad died Friday at the age of 87 after a lengthy illness.</li>\n<li>The self-made billionaire helped shape the city of Los Angeles, building museums and funding cultural institutions.</li>\n<li>Broad built two Fortune 500 companies during his lifetime, and Forbes estimated his fortune at $6.9 billion. </li>\n<li id=\"recirc\"><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">See more stories on Insider&#39;s business page</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>Eli Broad, a philanthropist and self-made billionaire who used his fortune to reshape the culture of the city of Los Angeles, died Friday at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center in Los Angeles at the age of 87. </p><p>Broad built two Fortune 500 companies during his lifetime and played a role in funding and shaping institutions like the Walt Disney Concert Hall and the Los Angeles Museum of Contemporary Art. The businessman went on to build his own museum in the heart of LA, a city he loved and helped transform into a cultural capital. </p><p>A spokeswoman for the Eli and Edythe Broad Foundation <a href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2021/04/30/us/eli-broad-dead.html\">told The New York Times</a> his death came after a lengthy illness. </p><p>The New York native chose California as his home and found massive success in the home construction and insurance industries. <a href=\"https://www.forbes.com/profile/eli-broad/?sh=50e0a8f8155d\">Forbes</a> estimated his fortune at $6.9 billion. </p><p>Broad bought his first real estate at 20, before co-founding Kaufman &#38; Broad in 1957 with a $12,500 loan from his in-laws, according to Forbes. The home builder became one of the biggest in the nation to provide affordable housing. Broad also found success when he bought Sun Life Insurance, then later sold it for $18 billion in stock in 1998.</p><p>In the 1970s, Broad was named fouding chairman of the Los Angeles Museum of Contemporary Art, and in 2008, he saved the institution from collapse with a $30-million grant. </p><p>He worked with developers to transform Los Angeles&#39; Grand Avenue into a cultural hub, alive with hotels, restaurants, a park, and his own museum.</p><p>Broad and his wife, Edythe, were avid art collectors and enthusiasts. They opened the <a href=\"https://www.thebroad.org/\">Broad Museum</a> in LA in 2015, which offers free admission to fellow art appreciators to view works from the couple&#39;s collection of more than 2,000 works.</p><p>Through two foundations, the couple supported medical research, public education, and the visual and performing arts. Their foundations have pledged and given away over $4 billion in grants, Forbes reported. </p><p>&#34;There&#39;s no curtain you can&#39;t get through in Los Angeles - no religious curtain, no curtain about where you came from,&#34; Mr. Broad told The Times in 2001. &#34;It&#39;s a meritocracy, unlike some other cities. If you have ideas here, if you have energy, you&#39;ll be accepted. I love LA.&#34;</p><p><em>This story is developing. Please check back for updates.</em></p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/eli-broad-dead-at-87-obituary-2021-4'>Business Snodgrass)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/608cae8934af8d001859a684?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn77@2020_1/2021/05/01/06-42-23-383_8f6b79b34176c504.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn14@2020_3/2021/05/01/06-42-25-622_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=mEKg1KHWk2Q:JTousZIbd1I:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn62@2020_1/2021/05/01/06-42-23-884_f76d83af77cfee0e.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=mEKg1KHWk2Q:JTousZIbd1I:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn99@2020_6/2021/05/01/06-42-25-122_f05cf04720393a6e.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn15@2020_2/2021/05/01/06-42-23-338_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=mEKg1KHWk2Q:JTousZIbd1I:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn9@2020_5/2021/05/01/06-42-24-142_e17a24579f9fe0b6.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/mEKg1KHWk2Q":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn37@2020_5/2021/05/01/06-42-23-757_dc249f317b572e3b.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1619851324300},{"createdTime":"2021-05-01 14:42:04","updatedTime":"2021-05-01 14:42:04","title":"2 senators launch bipartisan effort to ease student-loan forgiveness for service members","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/student-loan-forgiveness-military-service-members-marco-rubio-maggie-hassan-2021-4","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f4d5f487ffa48002894d3e6?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Marco Rubio\" height=\"533\" width=\"710\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Sen. Marco Rubio (R-FL).\n<p class=\"copyright\">Getty pool</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>Marco Rubio and Maggie Hassan introduced a bill to expedite loan forgiveness for service members.</li>\n<li>A GAO report found the Public Service Loan Forgiveness program rejected 94% of service members.</li>\n<li>Biden campaigned on reforming PSLF - something lawmakers have been urging for years.</li>\n<li id=\"recirc\"><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">See more stories on Insider&#39;s business page</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>Service members are currently eligible for the Public Service Loan Forgiveness program, in which they can enroll in income-based repayment plans that could lead to loan forgiveness after 10 years. But if a service member is deployed and puts payments on pause, that time doesn&#39;t count toward loan forgiveness, extending the period they have to keep paying.</p><p>Republican Sen. Marco Rubio of Florida and Democratic Sen. Maggie Hassan of New Hampshire want to change that.</p><p>Rubio and Hassan introduced the <a href=\"https://www.rubio.senate.gov/public/_cache/files/e15f5edb-c84d-4ac5-978a-aa4a01a774b6/D34FB3120B691E1087076B1F918F845B.bom21531.pdf\">Recognizing Military Service in Public Service Loan Forgiveness (PSLF) Act</a> on Friday, which allows service members who deferred their student loan payments while deployed to count that period of time toward their PSLF progress. Currently, putting loans into deferment or forbearance while deployed don&#39;t count as qualifying payments, and this new legislation would expedite the process for service members to get earned student loan forgiveness.</p><p>&#34;Service members take enormous risks to protect our freedoms, and it is unacceptable that members of the military can return home after active duty and not be any closer to receiving loan forgiveness,&#34; Hassan said in a <a href=\"https://www.rubio.senate.gov/public/index.cfm/press-releases?ID=AC567CBA-D0DB-4E4A-996E-E5547B166B0E\">statement</a>. &#34;This bipartisan bill is a commonsense fix to help some of our country&#39;s most deserving public servants get out from under the burden of their student debt more quickly.</p><p>According to a bill summary, this legislation would count military student loan deferment and forbearance as qualifying payments toward PSLF, including for:</p><ul><li>Active-duty service members deployed overseas;</li><li>Active-duty service members deployed away from their families and home station;</li><li>National Guard and Reserve members brought onto active duty for more than 30 days;</li><li>And National Guard members brought onto state active duty.</li></ul><p>The PSLF program allows government and non-profit employees with federally-backed student loans to apply for loan forgiveness after proof of 120 monthly payments under a qualifying repayment plan. But the PSLF program is flawed - according to a Government Accountability Office <a href=\"https://www.gao.gov/products/gao-21-65\">report</a>, as of January 2020, 287 Dept. of Defense personnel received loan forgiveness, while 5,180, or 94% of DOD borrowers, were denied.</p><p>Even beyond service members, <a href=\"https://studentaid.gov/data-center/student/loan-forgiveness/pslf-data\">98% of all borrowers</a> from the general public have been rejected from the program.</p><p>Sen. Elizabeth Warren released a <a href=\"https://www.warren.senate.gov/newsroom/press-releases/warren-statement-independent-watchdog-reveals-public-service-loan-forgiveness-program-is-failing-servicemembers-and-dod-civil-servants\">statement</a> after the GAO&#39;s findings were released last week, calling PSLF &#34;nothing short of a disaster.&#34;</p><p>&#34;Our student loan system is utterly broken, and the best way to deliver relief to borrowers and service members crushed by student loan debt is to cancel their debt - and not after 10 years of bureaucratic torture and miscounted payments, but today,&#34; Warren said.</p><p>She also <a href=\"https://www.warren.senate.gov/newsroom/press-releases/senators-introduce-legislation-to-expand-and-improve-public-service-loan-forgiveness-amid-covid-19-pandemic\">introduced</a> legislation last year to improve the program. </p><p>Education Secretary Betsy DeVos was sued <a href=\"https://finance.yahoo.com/news/california-public-service-loan-forgiveness-program-160813754.html\">multiple times</a> over the program&#39;s high denial rate, and President Joe Biden even <a href=\"https://joebiden.com/education/\">campaigned</a> on reforming PSLF to ensure that borrowers can the student loan forgiveness they deserve, but reforms have yet to be made. </p><p>Rubio said &#34;service members make an incredible sacrifice to serve our country, and we should do everything in our power to recognize their service and provide them with the option for loan forgiveness.&#34;</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/student-loan-forgiveness-military-service-members-marco-rubio-maggie-hassan-2021-4'>Business Insider</a></div><div class=\"feedflare\">\n<a class=\"copyright\">Maelove</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure></a></p><ul class=\"summary-list\"><li>I try a lot of skincare products for my job, and <a
