stuck easily</p><p><strong>Cons: </strong>Loud, virtual wall barriers cost extra, not impressive in corners&#160;</p><p>The <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B08C4LC7TG/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipg_012220_best-robot-vacuum-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B08C4LC7TG&#38;linkId=6f63878385a33acbc055c3e35bbd8503\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">iRobot Roomba i3+ Robot Vacuum</a> is iRobot's most affordable option with automatic dirt disposal, which empties the vac's dustbin automatically. You just replace the disposable dirt bag every month or two.&#160;&#160;</p><p>In our carpet tests, the i3+ picked up all of the coffee grounds, kitty litter, and pet hairs we laid out, and left behind only about 5% of the flour &#8212; the best performance of all the robot vacs we tested. In corners, it came within an inch of the wall but left behind about half the flour. It performed better on hardwood floors, picking up all of the coffee grounds and pet hair, and only left behind 5% of the kitty litter and about 10% of the flour. The robot vac didn't get stuck during its cleaning sessions.</p><p>Whereas some robot vacuums sense carpeting and boost suction, the i3+ provides consistently strong suction, and when it detects excess dirt, it automatically performs multiple passes.&#160;</p><p>Setup is a breeze only taking about 10 minutes, including connecting to the user-friendly app.&#160;Unfortunately, the app doesn't allow you to set up no-go zones, so you have to buy <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B019OH97NA/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipg_012220_best-robot-vacuum-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B019OH97NA&#38;linkId=29e67fdc6898ef8c52ef95f79da80481\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">virtual wall barriers</a>. The barriers work as advertised, but at around $40 each, I prefer using common household objects to keep the Roomba out of areas I want to protect.</p><p>The other negative with the i3+ is how loud it is. My sound meter recorded 68 dB, and you can't adjust the suction power for a quieter clean.</p>\n\tThe best robot vacuum for pet hair\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5faeea9b1c741f0019ac9c2e?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Best Robot Vacuums 2021 Bissell Spinwave\" height=\"1249\" width=\"1666\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">James Brains/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3>The <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B08F6Z89LN/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipg_012220_best-robot-vacuum-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B08F6Z89LN&#38;linkId=2e2400b6bf103dcaba0eda33e204f5ab\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Bissell SpinWave Robot Vacuum</a> picked up all the pet hair on carpet in our tests and has a great assortment of mop attachments and accessories. The company is also committed to helping homeless pets and helps them find loving homes.&#160;</h3><aside class=\"breakout-box headline-regular\"><ul><li><strong>Robot vacuum size: </strong>12.25\" x 12.25\" x 3.25\"</li><li><strong>Main brush length: </strong>5.75\"</li><li><strong>Dust bin capacity: </strong>400 mL</li><li><strong>Battery life (per manufacturer): </strong>130 minutes</li><li><strong>Warranty: </strong>One year limited</li><li><strong>Features: </strong>Wi-Fi app connectivity (available for iOS and Android), scheduling</li><li><strong>Extras: </strong>Water tank with spinning mop pads, extra mop pads, trial-size cleaning formula,&#160; damp-proof mat, extra side brushes, extra air filter, cleaning tool</li></ul></aside><p><strong>Pros: </strong>Excellent job on hardwood and corners, picked up all of the pet hair in our tests, great mop attachment and accessories, app connectivity, small size, quiet operation</p><p><strong>Cons: </strong>Can't set up no-go zones, gets stuck easily</p><p>The <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B08F6Z89LN/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipg_012220_best-robot-vacuum-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B08F6Z89LN&#38;linkId=2e2400b6bf103dcaba0eda33e204f5ab\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Bissell SpinWave Robot Vacuum</a> is created specifically for pet hair and has a 5.75-inch tangle-resistant main brush, a useful mop attachment, and powerful suction. Specs aside, a portion of each sale also goes to the <a href=\"https://www.bissellpetfoundation.org/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Bissell Pet Foundation</a>, which is committed to finding loving homes for pets.</p><p>The Bissell SpinWave picked up all of the cat and dog hair we laid out on carpeting and hardwood. Additionally, on the hardwood, it only left a trace of kitty litter and flour. In corners, it came within two inches and picked up more than 60% of the flour on both the carpet and hardwood.</p><p>It's also among the quietest vacs we tested &#8211; 58 decibels on Quiet mode (slightly quieter than a normal conversation) and 65 on high suction. If you have particularly skittish pets, the low-decibel output is less likely to startle your fur friends.&#160;</p><p>The vacuum's extras are useful to any pet parent, including a mop tank attachment, spinning mop pads, and a trial-size bottle of cleaning formula. Plus, you receive a cleaning tool that helps remove hairs from the brushes and clean the filter.</p><p>In testing, the mop attachment worked seamlessly. You just fill the tank with water and some of the cleaning formula and attach it to the vacuum in place of the dustbin. The mop pads spin to scrub away stuck-on debris while avoiding carpeting.</p><p>The SpinWave has a quick setup taking all of five minutes, including installing the app and connecting the unit.&#160;</p><p>The biggest limitation is it consistently got stuck on the one-inch threshold between rooms.&#160;</p><div id=\"ProductCard_5faee9f6bf96b9404b3e3819\" style=\"position:relative; display:block; width: 100%\"><iframe src=\"https://produktor.businessinsider.com/productCardService?id=5faee9f6bf96b9404b3e3819&type=button&live=true\" width=\"100%\" height=\"150%\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen=\"\" style=\"position:absolute; top:0; left: 0\"></iframe></div>\n\tWhat else we tested\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5faf04c6402d49001924ef53?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Best Robot Vacuums 2021\" height=\"2239\" width=\"2986\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">James Brains/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>We've tested 25 robot vacuums and counting, here are the ones that didn't make our top picks.</p><h3>What else we recommend and why</h3><p><a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B07RGDFZ5Q/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipg_012220_best-robot-vacuum-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B07RGDFZ5Q&#38;linkId=763a2aa988c732c44882011b576928b8\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\"><strong>Eufy RoboVac 15C Max</strong></a><strong> ($175.99):</strong> Formerly our pick for the best affordable robot vacuum, the 15C Max offers an impressive suite of high-end features for its reasonable price, including smart connectivity and powerful suction on carpeting and hardwood. We dropped it from our guide because the Moosoo MT-720 performed similarly, including doing a better job in corners, and it's currently $11 cheaper. However, the 15C Max doesn't get stuck as easily. If that's important to you, you may want to choose this model instead when on a budget.</p><p><strong><a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B08F2S98DM/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipg_012220_best-robot-vacuum-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B08F2S98DM&#38;linkId=e0736ed6b699ff74cbd82092ddfac20d\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Ecovacs U2 Pro</a> ($299.99):</strong> Of the eight vacuums I've tested since the last update, this was the best. It did excellent cleaning hardwood and carpeting and rarely got stuck. The U2 Pro also comes with a mop attachment, which didn't do a good job of cleaning up dried Tang on linoleum. Despite good performance, it couldn't compete with our current top picks, and was too expensive for consideration as our best budget pick. Other negatives include loud operation, poor corner cleaning, and boundary strips for setting no-go zones are sold separately.</p><p><strong><a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B08JCDCH22/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipg_012220_best-robot-vacuum-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B08JCDCH22&#38;linkId=03522593de8c83a7ce7d027435b6ab82\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">ILife A10</a> ($279.99 with coupon/$349.99 without): </strong>If setting no-go zones is important to you, then the A10 might be a good option. After it maps your house, you can set up virtual barriers in the app. This model also does an outstanding job of cleaning hardwood and carpet. But, there are plenty of cons: The A10 barely picked up any flour in carpeted corners, it runs loudly, and it gets stuck easily.</p><p><strong><a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B08C2WLBRX/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipg_012220_best-robot-vacuum-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B08C2WLBRX&#38;linkId=faa0c9854eb0227f6fd790d4b938f0a1\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Proscenic M7 Pro</a> ($419)</strong>: I enjoy the automation afforded by self-empty charging docks, and the M7 Pro has one that works well. You can also set no-go zones in the app. Plus, the vac didn't get stuck easily and performed well on carpeting and hard flooring. Yet, it had trouble cleaning corners and was loud. Plus, with a height of four inches, it doesn't fit under low-clearance furniture.</p><p><strong><a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B08HPGVT4J/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipg_012220_best-robot-vacuum-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B08HPGVT4J&#38;linkId=b433d9fb3b5ed8a50a7dae9aa6a034e3\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Moosoo R3</a> ($249.99 with coupon/$299.99 without)</strong>: If you mainly have hardwood flooring, the Moosoo R3 may be a smart choice for you, especially if you can get it on sale. It performed excellent on hardwood in our tests, ran quietly, and you can set no-go zones in the app. The vac did well on carpeting too, but it had trouble cleaning corners. And, it got stuck easily.</p><p><strong><a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B08CXB4KKJ/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipg_012220_best-robot-vacuum-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B08CXB4KKJ&#38;linkId=a42db13463b3e940b4d5497139da6fee\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Proscenic 850T</a> ($209 with coupon/$239 without)</strong>: When it comes to cleaning hard flooring, the 850T is outstanding. It picked up almost all of the debris on hardwood in our testing, got deep into the corners, and got all of the grounds, hair, and litter on the carpet. However, it left 20% of the flour behind, got stuck easily, and runs loudly. Plus, in my long-term testing, the vac regularly disconnected from the app and required my attention to run on schedule.</p><p><strong><a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B07TXGQS3H/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipg_012220_best-robot-vacuum-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B07TXGQS3H&#38;linkId=9d9b61f60b91551d1ee45e8b69e992fe\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Roborock S4</a> ($429.99): </strong>There's a lot to like about the Roborock S4. However, the main reasons it didn't make our top picks are because it's loud, doesn't come with many extras, and at 3.75 inches high, it doesn't fit under low-clearance furniture. It's pretty similar to our top pick, the S6, but lacks many of the features, such as a mop attachment. However, the S4 was excellent on carpeting, hardwood, and in corners, and it rarely got stuck. This is a more affordable alternative to the S6 if you're not interested in a mop attachment.&#160;</p><p><a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B084Z5JD5Q/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipg_012220_best-robot-vacuum-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B084Z5JD5Q&#38;linkId=271016f7d693e42c27c9d7e3460af317\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\"><strong>Roborock S6 MaxV</strong></a><strong> ($699.99): </strong>For the most part, Roborock is doing a terrific job in the robot vac space. We recommend the S6 MaxV because of its excellent performance in our carpeting, hardwood, and corner tests. It also has video surveillance and a two-way microphone if you're looking for additional home security, no-go zones, and a useful app. But it has the same large dimensions as the S4 and it kept getting stuck on the one-inch lip leading into the kitchen of our testing course. It isn't as loud as the S4, but louder than others we've tested.&#160;</p><p><a href=\"https://go.skimresources.com?id=35871X943606&#38;xs=1&#38;url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.homedepot.com%2Fp%2FiRobot-Roomba-i7-Wi-Fi-Connected-Robot-Vacuum-with-Automatic-Dirt-Disposal-7550-i755020%2F306684926%3Firgwc%3D1%26cm_mmc%3Dafl-ir-10078-456723-businessinsider.com%26clickid%3DQHK3vPSsNxyOWjLwUx0Mo3bxUkiXsfw3j1Zq2o0\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\"><strong>iRobot Roomba i7+</strong></a><strong> ($599.99): </strong>The Roomba i7+ was the first robot vacuum to feature an automatic dirt disposal charging dock. Since then, iRobot has introduced two other models that improve upon the i7+. Though this Roomba has great high-end features, its performance doesn't justify its price. It only did a satisfactory job on carpeting and hardwood, and it got stuck fairly often. If you find the i7+ on sale, we recommend picking it up. Otherwise, consider the s9+ or i3+ instead. <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/roomba-i7-plus-robot-vacuum-review\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Read our full review</a>.</p><p><a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B07RK3BGCM/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipg_012220_best-robot-vacuum-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B07RK3BGCM&#38;linkId=a6d3108cfb6ff3406170c8aff71f67c6\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\"><strong>Eufy RoboVac G30 Edge</strong></a><strong> ($239.99): </strong>Eufy usually makes more affordable robot vacuums, so at this price, the G30 Edge is considered the company's top-end model. The variety of extras &#8212; no-go zone strips, a user-friendly app, and Alexa and Google Home compatibility &#8212; make it worth the price, but you'll have to compromise some power. It performed poorly on carpeting and in corners during our testing, and it was in the middle of the pack on hardwood. Despite the underwhelming performance, it remains a good value for the price.</p><p><a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B079QYYGF1/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipg_012220_best-robot-vacuum-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B079QYYGF1&#38;linkId=dfa7b562d293777497fc0924e8ba58fa\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\"><strong>Eufy BoostIQ RoboVac 11S</strong></a><strong> ($219.99): </strong>This model didn't perform as well as the RoboVac 15C Max, doesn't have the same Wi-Fi connectivity, and can't be paired with an app. It's a good basic vacuum that does well on carpeting &#8212; which is surprising since it didn't perform well on hardwood floors or in corners. You can often find it on sale for under $200, which we recommend grabbing if you're in the market for a more affordable robot vac. <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/eufy-11s-robot-vacuum-review\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Read our full review</a>.</p><h3>What we don't recommend and why</h3><p><strong><a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B079QYYGF1/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipg_012220_best-robot-vacuum-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B079QYYGF1&#38;linkId=f960d1f910d83def7158439c9d41d384\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Eufy BoostIQ RoboVac 11S</a> ($219.99)</strong>: At one time, the RoboVac 11S was our budget pick, but after putting it through our testing alongside other affordable options, we no longer recommend it. The 11S doesn't have Wi-Fi connectivity, which has become standard in the industry at every price point. The vac performed well on carpeting but left a lot of debris behind on hardwood and in corners. You'd be much better off with the Moosoo MT-720. <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/eufy-11s-robot-vacuum-review\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Read our full review</a>.</p><p><strong><a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B086V42DNT/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipg_012220_best-robot-vacuum-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B086V42DNT&#38;linkId=29fba28483f5e90694ce001ad01a4a67\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Proscenic M6 Pro</a> ($299 with coupon/$369 without)</strong>: After testing two other Proscenic models that I recommend, I was surprised by how poorly the M6 Pro cleans. It left significant debris behind on carpeting, hard flooring, and in corners. The vac also got stuck easily and ran loudly. Plus, the app is slow to respond to finger taps and commands.&#160;</p><p><strong><a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B08BJ315DM/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipg_012220_best-robot-vacuum-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B08BJ315DM&#38;linkId=7430857b40a04f5f757c2910e1920977\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Yeedi K650</a> ($179.99)</strong>: The attractive price doesn't make up for the fact that the Yeedi K650 does a poor job cleaning any surface. It also gets stuck often, is noisy, and doesn't have many of the features we like, such as the ability to set no-go zones.</p><p><a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B07QNM7YDM/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipg_012220_best-robot-vacuum-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B07QNM7YDM&#38;linkId=89520e5a9b68af9e7d5b982147fbde7e\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\"><strong>iRobot Roomba e5</strong></a><strong> ($249): </strong>This appears to be iRobot's attempt to make a budget Roomba, but it's the worst-performing Roomba I've come across in my years of testing. It didn't come with any extras &#8211; not even an additional filter. You can schedule it easily in the app and it's compatible with Alexa and Google Home, but you have to buy virtual wall barriers separately. Also, it gets stuck easily and doesn't clean well on hardwood. <strong>&#160;</strong></p><p><a href=\"https://go.skimresources.com?id=35871X943606&#38;xs=1&#38;url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.bedbathandbeyond.com%2Fstore%2Fproduct%2Fneato-botvac-d7-connected-robot-vacuum%2F1063052701%3FAID%3D11553118%26PID%3D6415797%26SID%3D1600268418963ax1kmqlfr-xid-fr1600268422611egh%26source%3DCommission%2BJunction%26utm_source%3DBusiness%2BInsider%26utm_medium%3Daffiliate%26utm_campaign%3Dwww.bedbathandbeyond.com%26utm_content%3D3861930%26mcid%3DAF_CJ___3861930%26cjevent%3Dd0e974b1f82d11ea82bd01590a24060b\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\"><strong>Neato Botvac D7 Connected</strong></a><strong> ($479.99): </strong>We're dropping the Neato Botvac D7 Connected from our guide this time around because it's relatively big, got stuck about half the time during our original testing, and it only comes with two extra filters and a magnetic barrier, which isn't necessary since you can set no-go zones in the app. We think there are more affordable alternatives that perform better and are more feature-rich in our guide. <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/neato-robotics-botvac-d7-connected-robot-vacuum-review\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Read our full review</a>.</p><p><a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B07R295MLS/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipg_012220_best-robot-vacuum-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B07R295MLS&#38;linkId=781a4dfed88f69dc3515d0b74de09d8d\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\"><strong>Eufy RoboVac 11S Max</strong></a><strong> ($169.99): </strong>The 11S Max is an update to the 11S, but we feel the original 11S is better. Ultimately though, if you're spending this much, the 15C Max performed much better in our testing. The 11S Max did poorly on carpeting, hardwood, and in corners. It also relies on a remote controller rather than app connectivity, which means you need to turn to and keep track of another device.</p><p><a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B07PTP8GJ5/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipg_012220_best-robot-vacuum-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B07PTP8GJ5&#38;linkId=2c9d26c14b4b576a65f0a723f9db2905\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\"><strong>Roborock E35</strong></a><strong> ($349.99): </strong>At one point, we recommended the E35 as a good robot vac at this price, but since then, we have tested several others in this price range that outperform and have better features. The E35 doesn't do well with hardwood or corners and is big and loud. <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/roborock-e35-robot-vacuum-review\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Read our full review</a>.</p><p><a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B07ZNJ6Q9X/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipg_012220_best-robot-vacuum-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B07ZNJ6Q9X&#38;linkId=d9428a7d88e0d8561dce5243a4ef7082\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\"><strong>Roborock S5 Max</strong></a><strong> ($549.99): </strong>The S5 Max is loud, big, and it did poorly in corners and on carpeting in our tests.&#160;</p>\n\tOur methodology\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5faf038a402d49001924ef4a?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Best Robot Vacuums 2021\" height=\"2679\" width=\"3574\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">James Brains/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>I've been reviewing vacuums for the past few years, writing numerous buying guides and reviews, so I leaned on my background when developing our testing methodology. I also consulted three experts and took their advice and expertise into consideration &#8212; Dr. Luis Javier Pe&#241;a-Hern&#225;ndez, a lung and sleep health specialist at the <a href=\"https://pcsifl.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Pulmonary, Critical Care &#38; Sleep Disorders Institute of South Florida</a>; Andrea Ferro, Ph.D., a professor in Civil and Environmental Engineering at Clarkson University and the current president of the American Association for Aerosol Research; and Jill Notini, the Vice President of Communication and Marketing for the <a href=\"https://www.aham.org/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Association of Home Appliance Manufacturers</a>.</p><p>In addition to using each robot vacuum daily for at least several weeks, I tested each one for its suction on various types of flooring including corners, ability to maneuver around obstacles, noise, and special features. Our testing methodology has gotten more comprehensive over the years, so for any models that I'd previously tested but didn't have the vacuums on hand anymore, I extrapolated the data as best as possible based on previous testing and manufacturer info. Those vacuums are the iRobot Roomba i7+, Neato Botvac D7 Connected, Eufy 11S Max and 15C Max, and Roborock S4, S6, and E35.&#160;</p><p>Here are the main attributes we look for and how we test them</p><p><strong>Size: </strong>I note the specs of the overall unit, main brush, and side brushes. This gives me an idea of how well a vacuum can clean floors and carpet &#8212; the larger the brushes, the more they can usually sweep up. The main brushes are often somewhere between 5 to 10 inches long and side brushes are usually 2 to 3 inches long. Of the vacs I've tested, only Roomba models have two main brushes; others just have one. I've noticed that longer brushes tend to facilitate faster cleaning. If this appeals to you, consider a unit with a longer brush, such as the Roomba s9+.</p><p><strong>Carpet cleaning: </strong>I poured a tablespoon each of flour, coffee grounds, and kitty litter on 18-inch-square sections of carpeting. To make sure I had enough pet hair, I also collected pet hairs from my rat terrier and two cats to place on carpeting. I ran the vacuum on its most powerful mode for two cleaning cycles and compared before-and-after photos to estimate the percentage of each material picked up or left behind.</p><p><strong>Hardwood floor cleaning: </strong>This is the same test as the carpet cleaning test, but on hardwood flooring.</p><p><strong>Corner cleaning</strong>: To test corner cleaning abilities, I poured a teaspoon of flour in an approximately four-inch-radius in a corner on hardwood and carpeting. I took pictures of the messes before and after running the robot vac for two cleaning cycles to compare how much flour was left over. I also measured how close to the corner the vac was able to reach.</p><p><strong>Obstacle avoidance</strong>: You don't want your robot vac to get stuck while it's cleaning or when it's returning to its charging dock, both of which force you to hunt it down while it's sending you notifications or making annoying error sounds. I tested the vacuum in an approximately 500-square-foot room with several obstacles, including stairs, a one-inch threshold to a kitchen, and a table with chairs.</p><p><strong>Loudness: </strong>I used <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00ECCZWWI/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipg_012220_best-robot-vacuum-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B00ECCZWWI&#38;linkId=ccc28310a5f40b3188ec924737266e85\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">a sound meter</a> to measure the decibel output of each of the robot vacuums from 12 inches away as they ran on the highest and lowest settings. For vacuums I no longer had in my possession for testing, I relied on manufactures' info and my previous notes.&#160;</p><p><strong>Brushes: </strong>I noted the lengths of the main and side brushes as they'll likely indicate performance in our cleaning tests.</p><p>Robot vacuums work using a combination of suction and brushes. There are two types of brushes on a robot vacuums: the side brush and the main brush. Units have either one or two side brushes that are about three inches in diameter and protrude from the forward portion of the vac. They move in a circular motion, get into corners, and feed debris to the main brush. There appears to be little difference in the performance of vacuums with two side brushes versus those with one.</p><p>The main brush is between five and ten inches long, located under the unit, and is made of a rubber-like material. The vacuum sucks debris into the main brush which spins to feed the materials into the dustbin. Of the vacs I've tested, only Roomba models have two main brushes. Other models just have one. I've noticed that longer brushes tend to facilitate faster cleaning. If this appeals to you, consider a unit with a longer brush, such as the Roomba s9+.</p><p><strong>Extras:</strong> I note if the vacuums included extras such as filters and side brush replacements, mop attachments, a cleaning tool, and more.&#160;&#160;&#160;</p><p><strong>Special features: </strong>All of the vacuums featured some method for scheduling and returning to their charging dock on their own, so those weren't useful differentiators. Auto-dirt disposal, voice control, and home surveillance aren't universal, so you may want to consider if those are important. (<a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-robot-vacuum#how-have-robot-vacuum-cleaners-improved-15\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">There's more information on those and other features here.</a>)</p>\n\tWhat we're testing next\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/60414808b46d720018b04f71?format=jpeg\" alt=\"LG CordZero\" height=\"621\" width=\"828\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Amazon\n<p class=\"copyright\">Amazon</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>We're constantly testing new vacuums to update our guide. Below are a few models we are currently testing or will be testing soon:</p><p><a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B08LKMMCGJ/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;creativeASIN=B08LKMMCGJ&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;tag=biipg_012220_best-robot-vacuum-20&#38;linkId=5445800c49b9e33aa796b65b17668711\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\"><strong>LG CordZero ThinQ</strong></a><strong> ($949.71)</strong>: Whereas most robot vacuums are good for daily light cleanings, LG bills this CordZero ThinQ as \"powerful enough to be your primary vacuum.\" The vac has an inverter motor that adjusts to the debris levels and a large main brush that picks up more on the first pass. It also has cameras for obstacle detection and avoidance and home surveillance. The biggest negatives appear to be the expensive price and the 5.6-inch height, which may keep it from fitting under furniture.</p><p><strong><a href=\"https://news.samsung.com/global/samsung-introduces-latest-innovations-for-a-better-normal-at-ces-2021\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Samsung JetBot 90 AI+ (price not yet available)</a>:</strong> Samsung just announced the release of an AI-based robot vac at the <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/ces-2021-best-products\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">2021 CES trade show</a> and we're looking forward to testing its smart-learning capabilities to avoid obstacles. It also has cameras and can be connected to the brand's SmartThings hub for another layer of home security.&#160;</p><p><a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B06WD5PRMX/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipg_012220_best-robot-vacuum-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B06WD5PRMX&#38;linkId=a449ce4921f3a07b9a61eb616bcacf8b\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\"><strong>Samsung Electronics R7040</strong></a><strong> ($392.94)</strong>: The R7040 was in a previous version of our guide based on positive reviews by other sites, but we weren't able to get a unit in time to test in this round. We're looking forward to seeing how its unique flat front-edge design works in corners.</p><p><a href=\"https://trifo.com/lucy/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\"><strong>Trifo Lucy</strong></a><strong> ($699.99)</strong>: In addition to powerful suction and an outstanding app, Lucy has HDR video, a two-way microphone, and the ability to detect noise and people in your home as part of a home security set up. I'm interested to test its vacuuming abilities alongside the home security features.</p>\n\tWhy we don't measure Pascal Pressure Unit\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5faf07a2402d49001924ef64?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Best Robot Vacuums 2021\" height=\"2680\" width=\"3573\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">James Brains/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>A robot vacuum's suction power is measured in Pascal (Pa). Generally speaking, the higher the Pa, the better, but that's a misleading metric of comparison.&#160;</p><p>When I talked to engineers at iRobot about a year ago, they told me that there are several ways to measure suction power, but there are no industry standards. They viewed the reported Pa measurements as essentially useless, hence why it's nearly impossible to find suction power for iRobot vacs. It's also difficult to find the Pa for Ecovacs, though Eufy and Roborock report the measurements for their models.</p><p>Due to the inconsistent reporting from manufacturer s, we don't include Pa as a part of our testing methodology and criteria.</p>\n\tHow to shop for a robot vacuum\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5faf05dd1c741f0019ac9d05?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Best Robot Vacuums 2021\" height=\"3996\" width=\"5328\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">James Brains/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>While using a robot vacuum is easy enough, shopping for one can be overwhelming. Here are the main aspects to look for when considering which one to buy.&#160;</p><p><strong>Size:</strong> If you have furniture that's hard to move or low-clearance pieces like sofas or bed frames, you'll want to pay attention to the height of a robot vacuum; the other dimensions are usually within the range of reason for a normal household. For example, I have several radiators in my house with a 3.5-inch clearance that slim vacuums can get under, while just-slim-enough models sometimes get stuck, and too-thick models bump up against and go elsewhere. If you want your robot vacuum to get under your low-clearance furniture, make sure you choose a model that is slim enough to do so.&#160;</p><p><strong>Features: </strong>It's important to think about what features you actually need. For instance, if you work from home and are rarely away, HD cameras aren't useful since you can keep tabs on your home with your own eyes. If your floors are covered with carpet, you don't need your robot vac to mop. I also almost never use voice control out of personal habit, but if you use Alexa or Google Assistant for everything, then compatibility with those services is a must.</p><p><strong>Extras: </strong>You can easily purchase extra filters or brushes for robot vacs, but we think having them included with the unit is better. All of our top picks include useful extras like brushes or dirt disposal bags.</p><p><strong>Price: </strong>Robot vacuums go on sale often, and the discounts are steepest during Amazon Prime Day, Black Friday, and Cyber Monday. We expect most of the models we recommend in this guide to go on sale so it pays to wait until those sale days.</p>\n\tHow to use a robot vacuum\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5faf07e71c741f0019ac9d0e?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Best Robot Vacuums 2021\" height=\"4000\" width=\"5333\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">James Brains/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>Robot vacuums make keeping your house clean easier, but there's still some regular maintenance needed to improve the performance and longevity as well as help your indoor air quality.&#160;</p><p><strong>Run your robot vac when no one is around: </strong>Andrea Ferro, Ph.D., a professor at Clarkson University and president of <a href=\"https://www.aaar.org/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">AAAR</a>, and Dr. Luis Javier Pe&#241;a-Hern&#225;ndez, a lung and sleep health specialist at <a href=\"https://pcsifl.business.site/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">PCSI</a>, both recommend running your robot vacuum in unoccupied areas. The robot vacs can kick dust, pollutants, and microbes back into the air as it vacuums floors, which can lead to subpar indoor air quality. \"Every vacuum, including a robot vacuum, has the potential to release some dust, particles, and allergens back into the air, but the benefits still outweigh the risks,\" said Pe&#241;a-Hern&#225;ndez.&#160;</p><p><strong>And run it regularly: </strong>Ferro and Pe&#241;a-Hern&#225;ndez agree that you should run your robot vac at least once per week and more if you have pets and heavy-traffic areas. Ferro even suggests that daily cleaning isn't a bad idea. I generally set my vacuums to run in the early morning before I wake up or when the level of my house where the vacuum is running will be unoccupied, especially since I live in a large house with three pets and no HVAC system.</p><p><strong>Clean the dustbin and filter:</strong> If you're regularly vacuuming your space, you'll need to make sure to empty the dustbin and clean the filter. According to Pe&#241;a-Hern&#225;ndez, you should clean the vacuum's filter at least once a week, or twice a week if you have a pet.&#160;&#160;</p><p>You'll also need to replace the filter and brushes every few months. Manufacturers usually give guidelines in the vac's user manual on how often you should replace these components, but a good sign that it's time to replace your filters or brushes is if they appear to be damaged or if your vac just isn't doing as good of a job of cleaning as it once did.&#160;</p><p>Fortunately, many models come with extra filters and brushes, but eventually, you'll have to purchase replacements. Manufacturers usually link to their parts store in your robot vac's app, but you can also usually find parts on Amazon so it's worth shopping around. Just make sure that you are buying the right parts for your model.</p><p><strong>Use it in addition to a traditional vacuum:&#160; </strong>Despite how far robot vacuums have come in the last decade, they won't replace your stick and upright vacuums anytime soon.</p>\n\tFAQs\n\t\n\t<h3>Do you still need another vacuum if you have a robot vac?</h3><p>While the dream is to set your robot vacuum on a schedule and have it do all the floor cleaning for you, it's just not the reality at the moment. Robot vacuums don't clean as much dirt and debris as <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-vacuum\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">upright vacuums</a>. \"I think you'd still need a stick or upright vacuum for spots that the robot vac can't reach,\" Ferro said.</p><p>Robot vacs function best as maintenance cleaners. Having them run a couple times a week will make your floors less gunky, especially if you have pets. But these vacuums also need babysitting. You need to clear their path of anything that might get tangled in their wheels, and some have trouble getting into or out of tight spaces. Their bins are fairly small, so you'll need to empty them more regularly than an upright or stick version.&#160;</p><p>Even squarish robot vacuums &#8212; as opposed to round ones &#8212; aren't perfect at getting into corners. Some are too tall to fit under certain types of furniture. They obviously avoid stairs, too. Upright vacuums typically come with attachments that are useful for cleaning things like drapes or furniture, which robot vacs can't handle.&#160;</p><p>\"Research indicates that robot vacuums are not meant to replace upright vacuums,\" Pe&#241;a-Hern&#225;ndez said. \"That likely has to do with their smaller motor size. They're good for touch-ups and in-between uses.\"</p><p>When it comes to robot vacuums, expect maintenance not miracles.</p><hr /><h3>How have robot vacuum cleaners improved?</h3><p>Since iRobot's first Roomba came on the market in the early 2000s, robot vacuum technology has improved a lot. You can now find square-ish models in addition to round ones, and the mapping technology is much better.&#160;</p><p>Cameras and optical sensors can help with obstacle recognition, and LiDAR-based navigation uses lasers to detect objects. These capabilities aren't perfect, but vacuums are now more adept at finding their way back to charging docks than they were even a few years ago. Another new feature is self-emptying bins, which suck the debris out of the robot and into a canister in the charging dock.&#160;</p><p>Many robot vacuums are now smart, letting you start a cleaning session from an app or by asking a smart speaker. Some, like <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B07VCQRY4W/?tag=bisafetynet2-20\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Roborock S6 Robot Vacuum</a>, let you block off entire rooms in an app, so you don't have to worry about them getting stuck on your kid's clothing piles. With cameras and connectivity come some privacy concerns.&#160;</p><p>Some interesting features aren't universal, such as auto-dirt disposal and home surveillance. To get more guidance on these features, I spoke with Jill Notini, Vice President of Communications and Marketing for<a href=\"https://www.aham.org/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\"> AHAM</a>.</p><p>A few of the new features she's excited about &#8212; and that are found in many if not all of the models in our guide &#8212; include:</p><ul><li aria-level=\"1\"><strong>Advanced navigation: </strong>\"Many of today's models have the ability to map a home and remember how to get around objects and stay out of tough spots. You can also program the robots to vacuum specific areas of the home.\" You can also set no-go zones that the vacuum should avoid on your phone via the app.</li><li aria-level=\"1\"><strong>Mopping ability: </strong>\"Robots are evolving into floor care multitaskers,\" said Notini. \"In addition to vacuuming, some models now have the ability to mop, both wet and dry.\"</li><li aria-level=\"1\"><strong>Voice control: </strong>\"Robotic vacuums can now respond to voice commands, either directly or through an outside system like Amazon Alexa.\"</li><li aria-level=\"1\"><strong>Remote operation: </strong>\"You can start, stop, or control your robotic vacuum with your mobile device.\"</li><li aria-level=\"1\"><strong>Cameras: </strong>\"Cameras have been incorporated into some models to help the robot map the room and allow you to get a robot's eye view of cleaning and keep an eye on your house while you're away.\"</li><li aria-level=\"1\"><strong>Fall prevention: \"</strong>Even with all of the new features and technological advances, robotic vacuums still have not gained the ability to climb stairs. Many models now utilize sensors to prevent themselves from taking a tumble down the stairs or off a higher level.\" All of the robots in our testing were able to sense cliffs and avoid falling down stairs.</li><li aria-level=\"1\"><strong>Automatic dirt disposal: </strong>One of the most useful features that's becoming more ubiquitous is the charging dock that automatically empties the vacuum's dustbin. Even the largest bins need to be emptied with regular use so it's a maintenance task you'll need to perform once a week &#8212; at best. But with the self-emptying dock, the chore is no longer necessary. You just throw away and replace the disposable dirt bag every month or two.</li></ul><hr /><h3>Can a robot vacuum prevent the spread of the novel coronavirus?</h3><p>The novel coronavirus is most easily spread through face-to-face interactions and in close quarters, and if someone in your household has been sick &#8212; even if it's not with COVID-19 &#8212; <a href=\"https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/community/disinfecting-building-facility.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">it's recommended to clean and disinfect the area</a>.&#160;&#160;</p><p>\"Currently the CDC recommends that we take precautionary measures for vacuuming during the COVID-19 outbreak although there are no reported cases of COVID-19 associated with vacuuming,\" Pe&#241;a-Hern&#225;ndez said. \"It recommends using a vacuum with a HEPA filter, opening outside doors and windows to increase air circulation, and not vacuuming areas with people in it.\"&#160;</p><hr /><h3>How do you clean a robot vac?</h3><p>Though robot vacuums automate cleaning your floors, they are not completely hands-off. There are several care and maintenance steps you should take to ensure your vac operates properly for many years to come. Manufacturers provide clear instructions for how to clean and maintain your robot vacuum in the user manual or app.&#160;</p><p>Here are some general maintenance tasks:</p><ul><li><strong>Empty the dustbin:</strong> Depending on how dirty your home is, you will want to empty your robot vacuum's dustbin after every use. If you run your vac on a daily basis and don't have pets, you can get away with doing this chore once a week.</li><li><strong>Clean the filter and dustbin:</strong> This is a weekly task. Cleaning the filter is important because the vacuum doesn't clean as well when the filter is dirty. Most models' filter and dustbin can be cleaned with water. I usually clean and thoroughly dry the dustbin while letting the filter air dry. While the filter is air drying, I insert the extra filter that most units come with. Whatever you do, make sure the filter and dustbin dry completely before you use them again.</li><li><strong>Clean front wheel, brushes, sensors, and charging contacts:</strong> You should do this every two to four weeks. Most robot vacuums come with a cleaning tool with a brush on one end and a cutting blade on the other. Use these to cut out hairs that are wrapped around the brushes and wheel and to brush away debris. Use a soft dry cloth to dust the sensors and charging contacts per the manufacturer's instructions.</li></ul><p>Additionally, after about two months of use, it's time to replace the filter. The front caster wheel and brushes &#8212; both the main brush and side brushes &#8212; should be replaced every year or so.</p><hr /><h3>Can you fix a robot vac?</h3><p>This depends entirely on the problem. In my years of testing robot vacuums, I've probably ran into every problem a robot vacuum can experience: falling down stairs (surprisingly uncommon), running through pet accidents, attempts at taking up crocheting, etc. I've learned that these machines are resilient.&#160;</p><p>That said, any attempt to fix a problem with your robot vacuum should start with consulting customer service. After I determined there was no chance I could clean the pet waste off my robot vacuum, I reached out to the manufacturer. And, even though the warranty specifically states these accidents aren't covered, they still provided me with a replacement unit for free.&#160;</p><p>The most common problem I face is the vacuum finding my wife's yarn and wrapping it around its wheels and brushes. When this happens, you can usually work the thread free if you're patient. I usually just cut it free.&#160;</p>\n\tCheck out our guides to more great vacuum cleaners\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5ed0070cf34d051f873bd7d4?format=jpeg\" alt=\"best cordless vacuum 2021 dyson v11 outsize vacuum review\" height=\"600\" width=\"800\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Connie Chen/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-vacuum\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" data-analytics-module=\"body_link\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"80\">The best vacuum</a></h3><hr /><h3><a href=\"http://www.businessinsider.com/best-cheap-vacuum-cleaner\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" data-analytics-module=\"body_link\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"80\">The best affordable vacuum cleaners</a></h3><hr /><h3><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-cordless-vacuum-cleaner\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">The best cordless vacuums</a></h3>\n</div><div (James Brains)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5fa58b7df7d1cb0019e3a41e?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn71@2020_2/2021/05/01/06-42-25-718_328f957d5a173255.webp","https://i.insider.com/6042582b2dc90100183559f9?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn31@2020_1/2021/05/01/06-42-21-712_646beaab961914bc.webp","https://i.insider.com/5faee660402d49001924ee67?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn75@2020_2/2021/05/01/06-42-26-367_1d8f8c5448daf305.webp","https://i.insider.com/5fa58b82f7d1cb0019e3a423?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn68@2020_6/2021/05/01/06-42-22-449_f9e81afefc6abc95.webp","https://i.insider.com/5faeea56402d49001924ee90?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn90@2020_3/2021/05/01/06-42-23-942_107db0f122390f27.webp","https://i.insider.com/5faeea9b1c741f0019ac9c2e?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn40@2020_1/2021/05/01/06-42-22-518_0cf0fbf263f77da5.webp","https://i.insider.com/5faf04c6402d49001924ef53?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx14/cdn32@2020_3/2021/05/01/06-42-21-337_54996b77abbe5ada.webp","https://i.insider.com/5faf038a402d49001924ef4a?format=jpeg":null,"https://i.insider.com/60414808b46d720018b04f71?format=jpeg":null,"https://i.insider.com/5faf07a2402d49001924ef64?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn23@2020_1/2021/05/01/06-42-22-112_b8ce43491a10fa39.webp","https://i.insider.com/5faf05dd1c741f0019ac9d05?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn95@2020_3/2021/05/01/06-42-22-367_18ec282cdba1fed0.webp","https://i.insider.com/5faf07e71c741f0019ac9d0e?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn55@2020_3/2021/05/01/06-42-22-853_308f1d0e70a2b222.webp","https://i.insider.com/5ed0070cf34d051f873bd7d4?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn35@2020_4/2021/05/01/06-42-26-416_d31000a815348882.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn14@2020_3/2021/05/01/06-42-25-622_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=Ta4pXGU_2bU:9M087dTTkXQ:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn85@2020_6/2021/05/01/06-42-23-325_0206dfbaaf7a8bda.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=Ta4pXGU_2bU:9M087dTTkXQ:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn32@2020_5/2021/05/01/06-42-26-010_028d8d7ef0278ae1.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn15@2020_2/2021/05/01/06-42-23-338_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=Ta4pXGU_2bU:9M087dTTkXQ:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx14/cdn56@2020_4/2021/05/01/06-42-22-234_e1d9bb1cbe55ac46.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/Ta4pXGU_2bU":null},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1619851324390},{"createdTime":"2021-05-01 14:42:04","updatedTime":"2021-05-01 14:42:04","title":"A guide to VoIP, the technology that lets you make voice calls over the internet","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/what-is-voip","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/608c4b7735c46f0018c0bac8?format=jpeg\" alt=\"landline phone internet router and laptop\" height=\"1249\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>VoIP, or Voice over Internet Protocol, is a type of internet-connected phone system.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Jens Domschky/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li aria-level=\"1\">VoIP (Voice over Internet Protocol) is a system for transmitting voice calls over the internet. </li>\n<li aria-level=\"1\">IP phones use an internet connection rather than phone lines for transmission, but otherwise work the same as traditional phones, including using area codes and phone numbers.  </li>\n<li aria-level=\"1\">VoIP can be substantially less expensive and more secure than traditional landline phones.</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/tech-reference\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\"><strong>Visit Insider&#39;s Tech Reference library for more stories</strong></a><strong>.</strong></li>\n</ul><p><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/category/voip\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">VoIP</a> is shorthand for a telecommunication technology called Voice over Internet Protocol, and it&#39;s a modern alternative to traditional phones. For a century or so, landline telephone systems have carried voice data over a network called the public switched telephone network (PTSN). VoIP, on the other hand, allows voice calls to be transmitted over the internet. Your VoIP phone is simply a node on the internet with an IP address, much like your desktop computer. </p><p>Although VoIP phones work over the internet, they behave almost exactly the same as traditional landline phones - they use area codes and phone numbers, not usernames or passcodes. </p><p>It&#39;s also worth noting that even though your smartphone is an internet device and uses the cellular network to connect to the internet, phone calls you make with your voice plan are not VoIP - instead, cellular calls are transmitted using the voice cellular network. This is why most plans track voice and internet data usage separately. </p><h2>How VoIP works</h2><p>To use Voice over IP, you generally need a dedicated VoIP desktop phone (usually called an IP phone) which, instead of plugging into a phone jack, connects to the internet - usually by plugging into an internet router with an <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/what-is-an-ethernet-cable\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Ethernet cable</a> or another <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/what-is-mesh-wifi\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">form of high-speed internet</a> connection.</p><p>To enable the phone, you need to subscribe to a service plan with a VoIP service provider. Generally, businesses have VoIP accounts which are substantially less expensive than traditional landline phone plans. </p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/608c4a2a35c46f0018c0babf?format=jpeg\" alt=\"woman using landline phone in office\" height=\"1668\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>VoIP phones can be used in office spaces in place of landlines.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Morsa Images/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>When you dial a phone number using a VoIP phone, the phone sends packets of data to the internet, which is transmitted much like any other kind of internet data. The VoIP service provider sends the data from your phone to the phone that was dialed, where the data arrived and is turned back into audio information. </p><aside class=\"breakout-box headline-regular\"><h2><strong>The advantages and disadvantages of VoIP</strong></h2><p>In general, VoIP is a substantial improvement over traditional landline services, but there are few obvious downsides to VoIP.<br><br></p><h3><strong>The advantages:</strong></h3><ul><li aria-level=\"1\"><strong>It&#39;s more reliable.</strong> While the PTSN has little redundancy and calls can be lost or incomplete if there are network issues, VoIP uses the internet, which is robust and can routinely work around outages and hardware problems. </li><li aria-level=\"1\"><strong>VoIP can be significantly cheaper than landlines.</strong> Businesses like VoIP because it requires substantially less hardware to connect a large number of phones to the PTSN. Residential users can often get VoIP bundled with internet and cable TV for less money than a landline from a traditional phone provider would cost. </li><li aria-level=\"1\"><strong>It&#39;s mobile.</strong> Because IP phones are simply internet devices, you can typically move an IP phone to any available Ethernet connection - it&#39;s not restricted to a specific desk or location. Even better, a VoIP user can generally use a compatible VoIP app on their phone to make calls when away from the VoIP phone.  <br><br></li></ul><h3><strong>The disadvantages:<br></strong></h3><ul><li aria-level=\"1\"><strong>You generally need a broadband internet connection.</strong> You don&#39;t need a lot of bandwidth for voice communication, but if your internet connection is below about 10Mbps, you can have problems with audio quality. </li><li aria-level=\"1\"><strong>Internet connectivity issues can disrupt phone service</strong>. As a general rule, VoIP is highly reliable. But if you do have an internet connectivity problem, it can take out both data and voice at the same time. If you had a landline, it would probably not have been affected by the internet outage. </li><li aria-level=\"1\"><strong>You might have issues with 911 services.</strong> The FCC requires that VoIP provider who fully connect to the PTSN provide emergency 911 services. But there are exceptions - not all VoIP systems need to be compatible with Enhanced 911 services - and there might be situations when a call to 911 does not automatically provide emergency services with your location. </li></ul></aside><bi-shortcode id=\"related-article-module-end-of-article\" class=\"mceNonEditable\"><a data-type=\"5ecd62683ad86133445d5ae5\" data-title=\"What is Wi-Fi calling? Everything you need to know about making calls using Wi-Fi instead of a cellular connection\" data-url=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/what-is-wifi-calling\" data-vertical=\"sai\" data-image=\"https://i.insider.com/60538693f75f09001814ea78\">What is Wi-Fi calling? Everything you need to know about making calls using Wi-Fi instead of a cellular connection</a><a data-type=\"600a00ed555a0408c6265a9d\" data-title=\"How to enable and use Wi-Fi calling on your Android or iPhone to make calls without cellular service\" data-url=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-to-use-wifi-calling\" data-vertical=\"sai\" job","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/free-online-courses-university-of-california-berkeley","description":"<p class=\"financial-disclaimer\"><i>If you buy through our links, we may earn money from affiliate partners. <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.insider-inc.com/commerce-on-insider-inc/\">Learn more.</a></i></p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/608c4ce334af8d001859a54d?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Free UC Berkeley classes online 4x3\" height=\"1250\" width=\"1667\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">UC Berkeley; Alyssa Powell/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li aria-level=\"1\"><strong>The University of California, Berkeley is one of the <a href=\"https://www.usnews.com/education/best-global-universities/rankings\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">top 5 schools in the world.</a> </strong></li>\n<li aria-level=\"1\"><strong>It offers <a href=\"https://www.awin1.com/cread.php?awinmid=6798&awinaffid=257137&ued=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.edx.org%2Fschool%2Fuc-berkeleyxerkeleyx\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">free online courses</a> in everything from Bitcoin to the science of happiness.</strong></li>\n<li aria-level=\"1\"><strong>Below are 12 of the most popular free online UC Berkeley courses you can take through <a href=\"https://www.awin1.com/cread.php?awinmid=6798&awinaffid=257137&ued=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.edx.org%2Fschool%2Fuc-berkeleyxerkeleyx\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored\">edX.</a></strong></li>\n</ul><p>Boasting alumni like Joan Didion and John Cho, the University of California, Berkeley is currently ranked <a href=\"https://www.usnews.com/education/best-global-universities/rankings\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">the 4th best school in the world</a>. Of course, its prestige also makes it exclusive - last year, the <a href=\"https://admissions.berkeley.edu/student-profile\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">average (middle 50%) incoming Berkeley freshman</a> had a 3.86 unweighted GPA and between a 29-35 on the ACT or 1330-1530 on the SAT.</p><p>But you don&#39;t have to cram for the SAT, relocate to California, or pony up almost <a href=\"https://admissions.berkeley.edu/cost\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">$70,000 for out-of-state tuition</a> to enroll in a<a href=\"https://www.awin1.com/cread.php?awinmid=6798&awinaffid=257137&ued=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.edx.org%2Fschool%2Fuc-berkeleyxerkeleyx\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\"> great UC Berkeley course</a>. Just like many other <a href=\"https://www.usnews.com/education/best-global-universities/rankings\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">top colleges</a> - including <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/harvard-free-online-courses\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Harvard</a>, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/princeton-university-free-online-courses\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Princeton</a>, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/yale-free-online-courses\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Yale</a>, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/university-of-pennsylvania-free-online-courses\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">UPenn</a>, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/free-columbia-university-online-courses-edx\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Columbia</a>, and <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/cornell-free-online-courses\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Cornell</a> - UC Berkeley offers more than 40 <a href=\"https://www.awin1.com/cread.php?awinmid=6798&awinaffid=257137&ued=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.edx.org%2Fschool%2Fuc-berkeleyxerkeleyx\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored\">massive open online courses (MOOCs) completely for free </a>through e-learning platforms such as <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/edx-overview-faq\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">edX</a> and <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/what-is-coursera\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Coursera</a>. <strong>You can take courses in positive psychology, Bitcoin, or <a href=\"https://www.awin1.com/cread.php?awinmid=6798&awinaffid=257137&ued=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.edx.org%2Fschool%2Fuc-berkeleyxerkeleyx\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">pretty much any other topic</a>. </strong></p><h2><strong>12 popular UC Berkeley courses you can take online for free:</strong></h2>\n<div id=\"slideshow\">\n\tThe Science of Happiness\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/608c285035c46f0018c0b8a3?format=jpeg\" alt=\"The Science of Happiness by ozgurcankaya/Getty Images\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">ozgurcankaya/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<bi-shortcode id=\"commerce-link\" class=\"mceNonEditable\" data-cardtype=\"button\" data-pid=\"608c27294ba84300117181e1\" data-purchase-option=\"\">The Science of Happiness (button)</bi-shortcode><p><strong>Length: </strong>11 weeks</p><p>This positive psychology course uses scientific principles and practices for experiencing a happy, meaningful life. It particularly focuses on how happiness is linked to strong social connections and contributing to the greater good.</p>\n\tAcademic and Business Writing\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/608c714534af8d001859a631?format=jpeg\" alt=\"writing\" height=\"4000\" width=\"6440\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Getty Images/TravelCouples</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<bi-shortcode id=\"commerce-link\" class=\"mceNonEditable\" data-cardtype=\"button\" data-pid=\"608c29054ba84300117181e4\" data-purchase-option=\"\">Academic and Business Writing (button)</bi-shortcode><p><strong>Length: </strong>6 weeks</p><p>This is an introductory course to business and academic writing for English-language learners. Students focus on grammar, vocabulary, structure, editing, and publication.</p>\n\tHow to Write an Essay\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fc6afb5037cbd001861335f?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Online class generic 4x3\" height=\"1250\" width=\"1667\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">iStock; Gilbert Espinoza/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<bi-shortcode id=\"commerce-link\" class=\"mceNonEditable\" data-cardtype=\"button\" data-pid=\"5fe36745c7bd8548ab7baa87\" data-purchase-option=\"\">How to Write an Essay (button)</bi-shortcode><p><strong>Length: </strong>5 weeks</p><p>Also intended for English language learners, this introductory course focuses on how to write an essay, focusing on basic grammar and effective sentences, paragraphs, introductions, and conclusions.</p>\n\tBitcoin and Cryptocurrencies\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/608c2bec34af8d001859a392?format=jpeg\" alt=\"edX Bitcoin by Francesco Carta fotografo/Getty Images\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Francesco Carta fotografo/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<bi-shortcode id=\"commerce-link\" class=\"mceNonEditable\" data-cardtype=\"button\" data-pid=\"608c2b5fa3247900115899ac\" data-purchase-option=\"\">Bitcoin and Cryptocurrencies (button)</bi-shortcode><p><strong>Length: </strong>6 weeks</p><p>Begin learning the fundamentals of Bitcoin in this course from UC Berkeley's Computer Science department. You'll learn about the basic properties of Bitcoin, the mechanics behind it, its practical applications, and even how to destroy Bitcoins You'll also take a quick look at Ethereum and learn about Bitcoin's roots in the Cypherpunk movement and Libertarianism.&#160;</p>\n\tData Science: Computational Thinking with Python\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/608c2da035c46f0018c0b913?format=jpeg\" alt=\"edX Data Science by Yuichiro Chino/Getty Images\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Yuichiro Chino/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<bi-shortcode id=\"commerce-link\" class=\"mceNonEditable\" data-cardtype=\"button\" data-pid=\"608c2cac4ba84300117181ed\" data-purchase-option=\"\">Data Science: Computational Thinking with Python (button)</bi-shortcode><p><strong>Length: </strong>5 weeks</p><p>Learn basic programming skills for manipulating data using Python (no prior Python or data analysis experience required). You'll also cover tools widely used by industry and academic data scientists.&#160;</p><p>This course is also part of the professional certificate program in <a href=\"https://www.awin1.com/cread.php?awinmid=6798&#38;awinaffid=257137&#38;ued=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.edx.org%2Fprofessional-certificate%2Fberkeleyx-foundations-of-data-science\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Foundations of Data Science</a>.</p>\n\tThe Foundations of Happiness at Work\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/608c2e4c35c46f0018c0b935?format=jpeg\" alt=\"edX Foundation of Happiness at Work by Luis Alvarez/Getty Images\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Luis Alvarez/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<bi-shortcode id=\"commerce-link\" class=\"mceNonEditable\" data-cardtype=\"button\" data-pid=\"5fbed48bc5e67e29fc4db003\" data-purchase-option=\"\">The Foundations of Happiness at Work (button)</bi-shortcode><p><strong>Length: </strong>4 weeks</p><p>What does happiness at work look like? Why does it matter? And how do you cultivate it in a practical way? Explore answers to these questions &#8212; and common challenges to workplace happiness &#8212; using empirical research with professors from UC Berkeley's Greater Good Science Center.&#160;&#160;</p><p>This course is part of the professional certificate program in <a href=\"https://www.awin1.com/cread.php?awinmid=6798&#38;awinaffid=257137&#38;ued=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.edx.org%2Fprofessional-certificate%2Fberkeleyx-science-of-happiness-at-work\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">The Science of Happiness at Work</a>.</p>\n\tAdvanced Topics and Techniques in Agile Software Development\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/608c2fc735c46f0018c0b972?format=jpeg\" alt=\"edX Agile Software Development by Chalirmpoj Pimpisarn / EyeEm/Getty Images\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Chalirmpoj Pimpisarn / EyeEm/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<bi-shortcode id=\"commerce-link\" class=\"mceNonEditable\" data-cardtype=\"button\" data-pid=\"608c2f5b8d4c0a001180481c\" data-purchase-option=\"\">Advanced Topics and Techniques in Agile Software Development (button)</bi-shortcode><p><strong>Length: </strong>4 weeks</p><p>This course introduces students to ideas and techniques for designing, developing, and modifying large software systems using Agile techniques, as well as other common tools such as GitHub, Pivotal Tracker, Travis CI, Heroku, and more.&#160;</p><p>This course is also the second of the professional certificate program in <a href=\"https://www.awin1.com/cread.php?awinmid=6798&#38;awinaffid=257137&#38;ued=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.edx.org%2Fprofessional-certificate%2Fberkeleyx-mastering-agile-development-of-software-as-a-service\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Mastering Agile Development of Software as a Service</a>.</p>\n\tBlockchain Technology\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/608c30ab35c46f0018c0b998?format=jpeg\" alt=\"edX Blockchain by Jonathan Kitchen/Getty Images\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Jonathan Kitchen/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<bi-shortcode id=\"commerce-link\" class=\"mceNonEditable\" data-cardtype=\"button\" data-pid=\"608c3032a3247900115899b2\" data-purchase-option=\"\">Blockchain Technology (button)</bi-shortcode><p><strong>Length: </strong>6 weeks</p><p>This course covers a range of important blockchain topics &#8212; from distributed systems and alternative consensus mechanisms to proof-of-stake &#8212; as well as fundamental applications of Bitcoin and blockchain technology, challenges and solutions around scaling up, and government regulation.&#160;</p><p>This course is also one of the courses included in the professional certificate program in <a href=\"https://www.awin1.com/cread.php?awinmid=6798&#38;awinaffid=257137&#38;ued=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.edx.org%2Fprofessional-certificate%2Fuc-berkeleyx-blockchain-fundamentals\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Blockchain Fundamentals</a>.&#160;</p>\n\tEnglish for Journalists, Part 1\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/608c73ca34af8d001859a641?format=jpeg\" alt=\"journalism\" height=\"2647\" width=\"3970\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Manu Vega/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<bi-shortcode id=\"commerce-link\" class=\"mceNonEditable\" data-cardtype=\"button\" data-pid=\"608c32e2a3247900115899b5\" data-purchase-option=\"\">English for Journalists, Part 1 (button)</bi-shortcode><p><strong>Length: </strong>5 weeks</p><p>English language learners who are working journalists (or interested in studying journalism) learn about key journalism topics in this course, including job responsibilities, ethics, inclusivity, and the differences between local and global journalism.</p>\n\tEmpathy and Emotional Intelligence at Work\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/608c344634af8d001859a454?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Photo by damircudic/Getty Images\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">damircudic/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<bi-shortcode id=\"commerce-link\" class=\"mceNonEditable\" data-cardtype=\"button\" data-pid=\"608c33e18d4c0a001180481f\" data-purchase-option=\"\">Empathy and Emotional Intelligence at Work (button)</bi-shortcode><p><strong>Length: </strong>4 weeks</p><p>Personal happiness greatly depends upon our relationships with others, and organizations that can foster satisfying and trusting relationships are more likely to be successful. In this introductory course, students learn about the science of social and emotional skills as well as practical strategies for building positive relationships at work.</p><p>This course is part of the professional certificate program in <a href=\"https://www.awin1.com/cread.php?awinmid=6798&#38;awinaffid=257137&#38;ued=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.edx.org%2Fprofessional-certificate%2Fberkeleyx-science-of-happiness-at-work\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">The Science of Happiness at Work</a>.&#160;</p>\n\tMindfulness and Resilience to Stress at Work\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/608c352534af8d001859a461?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Photo by thianchai sitthikongsak/Getty Images\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">thianchai sitthikongsak/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<bi-shortcode id=\"commerce-link\" class=\"mceNonEditable\" data-cardtype=\"button\" data-pid=\"608c34b18d4c0a0011804825\" data-purchase-option=\"\">Mindfulness and Resilience to Stress at Work (button)</bi-shortcode><p><strong>Length: </strong>4 weeks</p><p>Learn research-backed, mindfulness strategies for building resilience at your job. Students explore the biological and psychological impacts of stress, learn how to differentiate between good and bad stress at work, and are given practical coping strategies.&#160;</p><p>This course is also part of the professional certificate program in <a href=\"https://www.awin1.com/cread.php?awinmid=6798&#38;awinaffid=257137&#38;ued=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.edx.org%2Fprofessional-certificate%2Fberkeleyx-science-of-happiness-at-work\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">The Science of Happiness at Work</a>.&#160;</p>\n\tData Science: Machine Learning and Predictions\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/608c364034af8d001859a484?format=jpeg\" alt=\"photo by Yuichiro Chino/Getty Images\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Yuichiro Chino/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<bi-shortcode id=\"commerce-link\" class=\"mceNonEditable\" data-cardtype=\"button\" data-pid=\"608c35a6a3247900115899c0\" data-purchase-option=\"\">Data Science: Machine Learning and Making Predictions (button)</bi-shortcode><p><strong>Length: </strong>6 weeks</p><p>Learn how to use machine learning &#8212; in particular, regression and classification &#8212; to automatically identify patterns in data and make accurate predictions.</p><p>This course is also part of the professional certificate program in <a href=\"https://www.awin1.com/cread.php?awinmid=6798&#38;awinaffid=257137&#38;ued=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.edx.org%2Fprofessional-certificate%2Fberkeleyx-foundations-of-data-science\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Foundations of Data Science</a>.</p>\n</div><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a
