MasterClass","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/jon-kabat-zinn-meditation-masterclass-review","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6089803341182b0019e804a4?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Jon Kabat Zinn Teaches Mindfulness and Meditation 4x3\" height=\"1250\" width=\"1667\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Master class; Alyssa Powell/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p class=\"financial-disclaimer\"><i>If you buy through our links, we may earn money from affiliate partners. <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.insider-inc.com/commerce-on-insider-inc/\">Learn more.</a></i></p><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>Jon Kabat-Zinn, Ph.D., a famed meditation instructor, teaches a <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/reviews/out?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.masterclass.com%2Fclasses%2Fjon-kabat-zinn-teaches-mindfulness-and-meditation\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">MasterClass on mindfulness</a>.</li>\n<li>The online course covers meditation and mindfulness tips to alleviate stress, pain, and insomnia.</li>\n<li>It also helped me learn specific breathing exercises and yoga techniques to relieve anxiety.</li>\n</ul><p>Mindfulness, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/coursera-princeton-buddhism-modern-psychology-review\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">a key component of Eastern scripture</a> for centuries,<a href=\"https://welldoing.org/article/basics-of-mindfulness-come-from\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\"> came to the West in the late 20th century</a> and has been here ever since. In the briefest terms, mindfulness is the state of awareness that arises from being attentive in the present moment, the benefits of which can include less pain, better sleep, and greater happiness.</p><p><strong>But how does mindfulness actually work, and why is it so effective?</strong> That&#39;s what <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/reviews/out?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.masterclass.com%2Fclasses%2Fjon-kabat-zinn-teaches-mindfulness-and-meditation\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Jon Kabat-Zinn&#39;s Mindfulness and Meditation MasterClass</a> fundamentally explores. </p><bi-shortcode id=\"commerce-link\" class=\"mceNonEditable\" data-cardtype=\"small\" data-pid=\"608c20b1a3247900115899a6\" data-purchase-option=\"\">Jon Kabat-Zinn Teaches Mindfulness and Meditation (small)</bi-shortcode><p><a href=\"https://www.mindfulnesscds.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Jon Kabat-Zinn, Ph.D.</a> is a pioneer of the Western mindfulness movement and founded the <a href=\"https://www.ummhealth.org/umass-memorial-medical-center/services-treatments/center-for-mindfulness/mindfulness-programs/mbsr-8-week-online-live\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Mindfulness-Based Stress Reduction (MBSR)</a> program at the UMass Memorial Medical Center. He&#39;s also the author of multiple books, including &#34;<a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00C4BA3UK/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&tag=biipf_043021_jon-kabat-zinn-meditation-masterclass-review-20&camp=1789&creative=9325&linkCode=as2&creativeASIN=B00C4BA3UK&linkId=e690180a7e17f38b87195b45532895757e17f38b87195b4553289575\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Full Catastrophe Living: Using the Wisdom of Your Body and Mind to Face Stress, Pain, and Illness</a>,&#34; which shows how mindfulness practices improve the quality of your close relationships, social networks, and overall life. </p><bi-shortcode id=\"commerce-link\" class=\"mceNonEditable\" data-cardtype=\"small\" data-pid=\"608c2c728d4c0a0011804819\" data-purchase-option=\"\">: Using the Wisdom of Your Body and Mind to Face Stress, Pain, and Illness (Kindle Edition) (small)</bi-shortcode><p>As someone who took yoga and meditation courses in the past, this course really grabbed my attention because it focuses on the science behind mindfulness and guides you through multiple step-by-step practices you can add to your daily routine. To learn more about mindfulness from Kabat-Zinn himself, I decided to sign up.</p><iframe width=\"560\" height=\"315\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/u7FrtC51Xwo\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen=\"\"></iframe><p> </p><h2>3 great things I learned from Jon Kabat-Zinn&#39;s MasterClass:</h2><h3>Effective meditation is often more physical than you realize.</h3><p>One of the fascinating aspects of this course is how Kabat-Zinn himself visually demonstrates a lot of the mindfulness practices he references. I personally enjoyed it when he guided hatha yoga, a type of yoga that is paired with breathing techniques. Some of his tips for practicing mindfulness in yoga include <strong>forming an intention to settle into stillness, adjusting your back to be comfortable, and embracing awareness of your body, </strong>which I now try to keep in mind whenever I meditate or do yoga. It was also soothing to hear his calming voice during the guided practice.</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/608c5ae135c46f0018c0bb37?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Jon Kabat-Zinn MasterClass\" height=\"1538\" width=\"2870\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">MasterClass</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><h3>Mindfulness can directly help you alleviate a stress response.</h3><p>Kabat-Zinn is very solution-oriented and amplifies how mindfulness is beneficial in alleviating symptoms of health issues many people face today. One thing that really resonated with me is how practicing mindfulness can help your body recover from its stress response. Whenever I feel anxious, exhausted, or irritated, I make an attempt to be aware of the context of the stress and take a few moments to just breathe. <strong>Through this practice, my body starts to cool down and a lot of my physical symptoms - like sweaty palms - start to subside as well.</strong> Ultimately, Kabat-Zinn frames mindfulness as a problem-focused strategy that can help cultivate a calm mind when your body is under duress. </p><h3>Greater awareness helps you focus on things that will actually make you happy.</h3><p>Kabat-Zinn emphasizes how mindfulness can be crucial in uncovering important truths about yourself. He identifies how this state of being aware helps you incorporate more trust, self-improvement, and kindness in your daily life. Personally, it&#39;s helped me reduce my desires for things I initially believe will make me happy. <strong>I&#39;m guilty of worrying about perfection and spreading myself too thin, but after taking this course, I started to reflect more and recognized that these habits weren&#39;t cultivating real happiness.</strong> When I think mindfully, I try to focus on myself - not the outside world - and identify how I can find happiness from within to be fulfilled in the long term.</p><h2>What to expect from the class</h2><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/608c5d3c35c46f0018c0bb3f?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Jon Kabat-Zinn MasterClass\" height=\"1520\" width=\"2862\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">MasterClass</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>Kabat-Zinn teaches the ins and outs of mindfulness in a very organized fashion, <strong>making abstract concepts easy to understand through real-life examples and analogies.</strong> Every lecture is divided into subtopics, which makes the material easy to follow and review. The key ideas from the course are also available in the guide, along with many charts and diagrams. </p><p>This course includes 20 videos, which collectively add up to over six hours of lectures. Therefore, you can take it all in one sitting or over a few weeks, watching videos whenever you have free time. In addition to the lectures, the course comes with a 26-page downloadable PDF guide with key takeaways and highlighted facts. MasterClass also offers an optional community forum where you can start discussions with other students on course content.</p><p>As with <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/science-of-better-sleep-masterclass-review\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">MasterClass courses in general</a>, I really like how this class can be taken at your own pace and time. And while courses with interactive quizzes and exams can help you stay on track, I like that MasterClass lets me focus solely on learning the content instead of thinking about my grades.  </p><h2>The bottom line</h2><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/608c5a5335c46f0018c0bb36?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Jon Kabat-Zinn MasterClass\" height=\"1536\" width=\"2866\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">MasterClass</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>Ultimately, this class doesn&#39;t just broadly teach you about mindfulness - it shows you tangible daily practices to better cope with stress, develop a calm mind, and feel more fulfilled. By the end, you&#39;ll know exactly how mindfulness transforms your body and mind, so you can empower and influence others with tips to live more fulfilling, healthier lives just by boosting their awareness.</p><p>For instance, <strong>after taking the class, I find myself more frequently recommending mindfulness apps to friends who feel drained or burned out. </strong>As a result, a lot of my friends have gotten more into deep breathing practices and meditation. We&#39;ve also started gifting each other gift cards and mindfulness app subscriptions in an effort to inspire each other to engage in this practice. </p><p>It all ties in with what Kabat-Zinn emphasizes in the course: that mindfulness is a necessity to humanity, a medicine that can help reduce human suffering.<strong> He also believes that mindfulness can bring communities together, maximizing everyone&#39;s wellbeing.</strong> Even though adding mindfulness to our lives is a small change, it can make meaningful differences in helping us discover who we are, improve our relationships, and harness our inner potential to make an impact. </p><bi-shortcode id=\"commerce-link\" class=\"mceNonEditable\" data-cardtype=\"small\" data-pid=\"608c20b1a3247900115899a6\" data-purchase-option=\"\">Jon Kabat-Zinn Teaches Mindfulness and Meditation (small)</bi-shortcode><h2>About MasterClass:</h2><p>An annual subscription to <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/reviews/out?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.masterclass.com%2F\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">MasterClass</a> is $180 (or $15 a month), giving you unlimited access to over 100 classes, with new ones added monthly. The courses and experts range from photography with <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/reviews/out?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.masterclass.com%2Fclasses%2Fannie-leibovitz-teaches-photography\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Annie Leibovitz</a> to creative writing with <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/reviews/out?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.masterclass.com%2Fclasses%2Fmargaret-atwood-teaches-creative-writing\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Margaret Atwood</a>.  </p><aside class=\"breakout-box headline-regular\"><ul><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/masterclass-review\" target=\"_blank\" id=\"table-of-contents-sticky\" class=\"mceNonEditable\" data-type=\"h2\">Table of Contents: Masthead Sticky</bi-shortcode><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>Tables give kids their own spot where they can comfortably create, eat, do homework, and just be.</li>\n<li>We tested 11 kids tables to find the best ones for activities indoors and outside.</li>\n<li>The <a href=\"https://go.skimresources.com?id=35871X943606&xs=1&url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.ikea.com%2Fus%2Fen%2Fp%2Fdundra-activity-table-with-storage-white-gray-30472499%2F72499%2F\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Ikea Dundra</a> is the best table for kids because it is sturdy, competitively priced, and has storage.</li>\n</ul><p>Kids deserve their own space where they can sit or stand comfortably to create art, do homework, eat, and play. Plus, when they have their own table for these activities, it reduces the mess on the dining room table or kitchen counters. </p><p>The market is saturated with kids tables, with many different sizes, styles, and types. We tested 11 different tables for kids, from picnic tables to basic-use tables, considering their durability, stability, ergonomic positioning, and ease of cleaning. We put these tables through the ringer, using them daily for at least a month each and purposely getting them messy just to see how well they clean up. </p><p>To inform our product selections and testing, we also spoke to two occupational therapists who specialize in pediatrics: <a href=\"https://www.potsot.com/chaye-lamm-warburg\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Chaye Lamm Warburg</a> and <a href=\"https://ahs.uic.edu/occupational-therapy/directory/stoffel-ashley/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Ashley Stoffel</a>. Jump to the end of this guide to read more about our full <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-kids-table#our-testing-methodology-6\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">testing methodology</a> and <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-kids-table#faqs-about-tables-for-kids-9\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">FAQs about kids tables</a>.</p><h2>Here are the best kids tables in 2021</h2><ul class=\"summary-list\"><li><strong>Best kids table overall:</strong> <a href=\"https://go.skimresources.com?id=35871X943606&xs=1&url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.ikea.com%2Fus%2Fen%2Fp%2Fdundra-activity-table-with-storage-white-gray-30472499%2F72499%2F\" target=\"_blank\" sponsored\"><strong>Pottery Barn Kids Carolina Grow-With-You Activity Table</strong></a></li><li><strong>Best basic kids table:</strong> <a <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/reviews/out?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.target.com%2Fp%2Flittle-tikes-easy-store-jr-play-table-with-umbrella%2F-%2FA-53661913\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\"><strong>Little Tikes Easy Store Jr. Picnic Table</strong></a></li><li><strong>Best budget kids table</strong><strong>:</strong> <a rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\"><strong>Ikea Mammut</strong></a></li></ul><aside class=\"breakout-box headline-regular\"><strong>Updated on 4/30/21:</strong> We rewrote this guide after extensive research and testing.</aside>\n<div id=\"slideshow\">\n\tThe best kids table overall\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/608c4d0934af8d001859a54e?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Ikea dundra kids table\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Alicia Betz/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3>The <a href=\"https://go.skimresources.com?id=35871X943606&#38;xs=1&#38;url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.ikea.com%2Fus%2Fen%2Fp%2Fdundra-activity-table-with-storage-white-gray-30472499%2F\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Ikea Dundra</a> activity table is big, sturdy, cleans well, and has a large storage drawer, all for under $100.&#160;</h3><p><strong>Pros: </strong>Affordable, easy to clean, raised edges, added storage, very sturdy&#160; <strong>&#160;</strong></p><p><strong>Cons: </strong>Doesn't come with chairs, liquid spills drip into drawer<strong>&#160;</strong></p><p><strong>&#160;</strong>The <a href=\"https://go.skimresources.com?id=35871X943606&#38;xs=1&#38;url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.ikea.com%2Fus%2Fen%2Fp%2Fdundra-activity-table-with-storage-white-gray-30472499%2F/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Ikea Dundra</a> activity table checks all of our testing boxes, and it does so as one of the more affordable tables we tested. The table has raised edges to stop crayons, markers, and other supplies from rolling off, and it has a large storage drawer with two compartments. The table surface is gray while every other surface is white.&#160;</p><p>Although it doesn't come with chairs, it's the right height for younger kids to stand at the table and for older kids to kneel or sit. The table is 19.5 inches from the ground, which is about belly button height on my 3-year-old.</p><p>In our cleaning test, everything came off easily with a basic household cleaner with the exception of the colored pencil, which came off with a <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/mr-clean-magic-eraser-review\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Magic Eraser</a>. The storage drawers in the front have pros and cons when it comes to cleaning. The pro: If you're in a rush, pull out the drawer and push everything in with one arm swipe. The con: If you don't clean up a liquid spill on the table quickly, it will drip into the drawer.&#160;</p><p>From the second I picked up the box, I could tell the table would be very sturdy. It does not budge unless you have one or two adults trying to move it. It has also proven to be durable, with no dents, chips, or other signs of wear.&#160;</p>\n\tThe best activity table for kids\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/608c4d6d35c46f0018c0bad8?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Pottery Barn Kids Carolina Grow With You Activity Table\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Alica Betz/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3>The <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/reviews/out?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.potterybarnkids.com%2Fproducts%2Fcarolina-grow-with-you-activity-table-espresso%2F\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Pottery Barn Kids Carolina Grow-With-You Activity Table</a> has the look and feel of being high quality plus it's durable and easy to clean &#8212; two musts for kids tables.</h3><p><strong>Pros: </strong>Two leg-length options, very sturdy, raised edges, three color options<strong> &#160;</strong></p><p><strong>Cons: </strong>Pricey, crumbs get stuck in corners<strong>&#160;</strong></p><p>With a high-end design and three color options, the <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/reviews/out?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.potterybarnkids.com%2Fproducts%2Fcarolina-grow-with-you-activity-table-espresso%2F\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Pottery Barn Kids Carolina Grow-With-You Activity Table</a> will not be an eyesore in your home. Ideal for crafts and activities, it has raised edges to keep everything on the surface.&#160;</p><p>It has proved to be very durable and stable in our tests. The table doesn't wobble or tip, and we haven't seen any chips, cracks, dents, or other signs of wear. In addition to our clean test, this table also saw a lot of daily use throughout our testing as the main craft table for my toddler.&#160;</p><p>In our cleaning test, everything came off very easily with a basic household cleaner. However, cleaning crumbs and other small scraps was a bit more difficult. Because it has raised edges, small detritus tends to get stuck in the corners.&#160;&#160;</p><p>Like other activity tables, it does not come with chairs. However, there are two leg-length options, fulfilling the \"grow-with-you\" moniker. We tested the 15-inch legs; 24 inches is the other option. When kids are old enough for the 24-inch legs, the table becomes tall enough to add on chairs. This table is so beautifully crafted and low to the ground that my husband attempted to overtake our testing and convert it into a coffee table.&#160;</p>\n\tThe best basic kids table\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/608c4e7535c46f0018c0bae3?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Kidkraft farmhouse activity table for kids\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Alicia Betz/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3>The <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B07G3ZL8BM/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_121018_best-kids-tables-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B07G3ZL8BM&#38;linkId=a91a7a0fbee4881177dd01cdd7bc04ef\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Kidkraft Farmhouse Table and Four Chairs</a> was the easiest to clean out of everything we tested.&#160;</h3><p><strong>Pros: </strong>Very easy to clean, comes with four chairs, durable and sturdy<strong>&#160;</strong></p><p><strong>&#160;Cons: </strong>Messes can get stuck in screw holes <strong>&#160;</strong></p><p>A basic kids table and chair set should be a staple in every child's home. The <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B07G3ZL8BM/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_121018_best-kids-tables-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B07G3ZL8BM&#38;linkId=a91a7a0fbee4881177dd01cdd7bc04ef\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Kidkraft Farmhouse Table and Four Chairs</a> stood out as a high-quality kids' furniture set that looks just like a miniature version of a dining set. It comes in four colors: espresso, white, natural, and pecan.&#160;</p><p>Easy cleaning is a parent's dream and this table passed our cleaning test with flying colors. Everything wiped clean using a regular household cleaner. The only downside when it comes to cleaning is that the chairs have quite a few uncovered screw holes. Cleaning can become a bit tricky when messes get into those indentations.&#160;&#160;</p><p>Like our other top picks, this set is very durable and looks new after months of use. It doesn't have any dents or chips. The table and chairs are also sturdy and have never wobbled or tipped over.&#160;</p><p>As a basic set, this table doesn't come with any bells and whistles. It's simply a flat surface for kids to eat, play, and create without distractions.&#160;</p>\n\tThe best picnic table for kids\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/608c4dcc35c46f0018c0badc?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Little tikes easy store picnic table\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Alicia Betz/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3>The <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/reviews/out?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.target.com%2Fp%2Flittle-tikes-easy-store-jr-play-table-with-umbrella%2F-%2FA-53661913\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Little Tikes Easy Store Jr. Picnic Table</a> is built to withstand outdoor conditions, and it even has a built-in multipurpose tray with cup holders.&#160;</h3><p><strong>Pros: </strong>Very sturdy, multipurpose tray and cup holders, folds up for storage, can withstand harsh weather conditions<strong>&#160;</strong></p><p><strong>Cons: </strong>Umbrella is flimsy, max seating capacity would be a tight squeeze <strong>&#160;</strong></p><p>The <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/reviews/out?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.target.com%2Fp%2Flittle-tikes-easy-store-jr-play-table-with-umbrella%2F-%2FA-53661913\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Little Tikes Easy Store Jr. Picnic Table</a> was a clear winner between the two picnic tables we tested. It's sturdy, cleans easily, and can seat up to six kids, though four is more comfortable. It's available with or without an umbrella. We found the umbrella a bit flimsy, but it does the trick if you want some shade.&#160;</p><p>During our testing period, we left the table in a backyard surrounded by other large toys. When high winds sent a small slide playset and a playhouse flying, this table stayed put. It also never wobbled or tipped, even when we sat one adult on one side, within the 200-pound weight limit.</p><p>In our cleaning test, most messes came out easily. This table has some texture, which trapped the crayon and colored pencil marks. With a bit of scrubbing using regular household cleaner for the crayons and a Magic Eraser for the colored pencils, everything cleaned off.&#160;</p><p>After over one month of testing, the table does not have any dents, cracks, or other obvious signs of wear. As an outdoor table, it does get a bit dirty, but dirt, pollen, and other outside messes clean quickly with a hose.&#160;</p><p>The table can seat up to six kids with a maximum weight of 200 pounds per bench. Based on experience, I'd say it seats four comfortably; six kids would really need to squeeze to fit.&#160;</p><p>One of our favorite features is the indentation in the middle of the table. It's described as a multipurpose condiment/crayon tray, and it does not disappoint. It also includes two cup holders.&#160;</p><p>When you're ready to store the table, it folds nicely into one flat piece. It's so easy that you could feasibly fold it to store after each use if you don't want to leave it sitting out.&#160;</p>\n\tThe best budget kids table\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/608c4e2535c46f0018c0bae1?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Ikea Mammut picnic table\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Alicia Betz/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3>The <a href=\"https://go.skimresources.com?id=35871X943606&#38;xs=1&#38;url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.ikea.com%2Fus%2Fen%2Fp%2Fmammut-childrens-table-indoor-outdoor-white-50365177%2F\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Ikea Mammut </a>is about as inexpensive as you can get, but it still received top marks in all of our tests, and it's appropriate for indoor and outdoor use.&#160;&#160;</h3><p><strong>Pros: </strong>Sturdy, easy to clean, affordable, appropriate for indoor or outdoor use, lightweight</p><p><strong>Cons: </strong>Doesn't come with chairs<strong>, </strong>slides slightly on hard surfaces&#160;</p><p>You'd be hard-pressed to find a safe and sturdy kids table for less than the <a href=\"https://go.skimresources.com?id=35871X943606&#38;xs=1&#38;url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.ikea.com%2Fus%2Fen%2Fp%2Fmammut-childrens-table-indoor-outdoor-white-50365177%2F\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Ikea Mammut</a>. The table doesn't come with <a href=\"https://go.skimresources.com?id=35871X943606&#38;xs=1&#38;url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.ikea.com%2Fus%2Fen%2Fp%2Fmammut-childrens-chair-indoor-outdoor-blue-60365346%2F\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">chairs</a>, but you can add two on for $15 each, and it will still be the most inexpensive option in our guide. In testing, we often used it with this <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B07H7355V2/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_121018_best-kids-tables-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B07H7355V2&#38;linkId=ca4a5069adc249bd6a62b01cf044991f\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">active balance chair</a>, which we received as an editorial review sample from its manufacturer.</p><p>The Mammut is available in white or red. The nonporous material of the table even makes it ideal to use outside. It's very lightweight and easy to move around outdoors and indoors.&#160;</p><p>In our cleaning test, crayon marks came out with a Magic Eraser, and everything else cleaned off easily with basic household cleaner. This is another one that my toddler got a lot of use out of during our testing, and it still looks like it did when we took it out of the box. No dents, cracks, stains, or other signs of wear. You can purchase it in white or red.</p><p>As expected, the lightweight table slid a bit on hard surfaces, but never so much that it flew out from under our tester, and I never felt the need to remove it from our home due to safety concerns.&#160;</p><p>All in all, this table gets the job done for a fraction of the price of others we tested.&#160;</p>\n\tOur testing methodology\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/608c4eda34af8d001859a55a?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Testing kids tables\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Alicia Betz/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>We used four main parameters to test each table: durability, stability, ease of cleaning, and ergonomic positioning. We tested each table with regular use for at least one month and some for more than six months. With the exception of the <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/reviews/out?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.potterybarnkids.com%2Fproducts%2Fcarolina-grow-with-you-activity-table-espresso%2F\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Pottery Barn Kids Carolina Grow-With-You Activity Table</a> and <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B071JF4H61/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_121018_best-kids-tables-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B071JF4H61&#38;linkId=e2fb7d10396b1f954be68bea50ae4b32\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">B. Spaces by Battat</a> set, we received editorial review samples of each table for testing purposes.&#160;</p><ul><li><strong>Durability</strong>: After at least one month of regular and appropriate use, we checked for chips in paint or finishes, dents, splinters, cracks, or other obvious signs of wear. <strong>&#160; </strong></li><li><strong style=\"color: #222222;\">Stability</strong>: Stoffel emphasized the importance of finding a sturdy table and chair set. The table shouldn't wobble when kids put their elbows on it, for example. To test stability, we observed daily and regular use and noted any instances of tipping or wobbling in both the chairs and the tables.</li><li><strong style=\"color: #222222;\">Ease of cleaning</strong>: It's a fact of life: Kids make messes. On each table, we purposely made messes with: crayons, markers, colored pencils, paint, glue, and food.<br /><br />We first cleaned each mess with a regular household cleaner like <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B0822M8HZJ/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_121018_best-kids-tables-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B0822M8HZJ&#38;linkId=cf1331889e44fd82bb06623eca55faa5\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Mrs. Meyers Multi-Surface Cleaner</a> or <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B087YZDMLK/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_121018_best-kids-tables-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B087YZDMLK&#38;linkId=1a494362e5df0c683ae7255bd7fb42fe\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Lysol Multi-Purpose Cleaner</a>. For messes that persisted, we followed up with a <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B08492Q875/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_121018_best-kids-tables-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B08492Q875&#38;linkId=e5744f7a1ac54650acb2bb88eb4019d6\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Magic Eraser</a>. Almost all messes were gone at that point. We noted any messes that persisted beyond the Magic Eraser.&#160;</li><li><strong>Ergonomic positioning</strong>: Both experts we spoke to emphasized the importance of ergonomic positioning. This is difficult to assess because children grow at rapid rates. We followed <a href=\"https://www.communityplaythings.com/-/media/Files/CPUS/Product-Information/TableChairHeightGuides.ashx?rev=3d181884c75b41d490fc2071d0584f35\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">this sizing guide</a> recommended by Stoffel. Although ideal chair and tabletop heights vary by a child's age, ideal differences between chair seat height and table top height are consistent. All of the tables we recommend come within 1 inch of these guidelines.&#160;</li></ul>\n\tWhat else we considered\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/608c4f6635c46f0018c0baed?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Kidkraft picnic table for kids\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Alicia Betz/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>We tested 11 kids tables in total. Here are the ones that didn't make our top picks:</p><p><strong><a href=\"https://www.kidkraft.com/us_en/outdoor-table-with-benches-umbrella.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Kidkraft Outdoor Table with Benches and Umbrella</a></strong>: This is a beautiful table, but it's not the most practical option for kids. Crayons, colored pencils, and markers didn't clean off in our tests, and the wood started to chip and splinter after less than a year of use.&#160;</p><p><strong><a href=\"https://www.pntra.com/t/TUJGR0dLSEJGSEhLR01CRk5FSUhM?url=https%3A%2F%2Fmeetlalo.com%2Fproducts%2Fthe-play-kit\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Lalo The Play Kit</a></strong>: This set is very solid, has rubber bottoms to prevent sliding, and the chairs come in four colors. Unfortunately, the table wobbled in our tests. For a $250 set &#8212; the most expensive we tested &#8212; a structural issue like wobbling is a deal breaker.</p><p><strong><a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B071JF4H61/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_121018_best-kids-tables-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B071JF4H61&#38;linkId=e2fb7d10396b1f954be68bea50ae4b32\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">B. Spaces by Battat &#8211; Kids' Furniture Set</a></strong>: This is a nice set that has a few minor flaws. Because the chairs curve up on the edges, we found that they tip and can fall over if kids sit on the very edge. Additionally, we couldn't get both chairs to fully fit under the table, and this one needed some extra scrubbing in our cleaning test.</p><p><strong><a href=\"https://deltachildren.com/products/chelsea-table-and-chair-set-with-storage\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Delta Children Chelsea Chair Set With Table</a>: </strong>I really, really wanted to love this set. It has storage under the table and it includes a reversible chalkboard/whiteboard. Unfortunately, it had a strong off-gassing smell that lasted over a month, and within a couple months of use, the chair legs became loose and almost fell off.&#160;</p><p><strong><a href=\"https://www.melissaanddoug.com/wooden-table-and-chairs---natural/2427.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Melissa and Doug Wooden Table and Chairs</a></strong>: We really liked this set and didn't find any major flaws. There simply wasn't anything that made it stand out, and it's more expensive than some of the similar tables we tested.&#160;</p><p><strong><a href=\"https://shop.humblecrew.com/products/tot-tutors-2-in-1-lego-compatible-activity-table\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Humble Crew Tot Tutors Forever 2-in-1 LEGO Compatible Activity Table</a></strong>: We were unable to spend much time testing this table. It quickly became apparent that it was unsafe. The table and chairs repeatedly slid and flipped out from under my toddler during testing. This happened with appropriate use on both hard floors and carpeting.&#160;</p>\n\tWhat we look forward to testing\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/608c4fbd34af8d001859a567?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Ikea Flisat kids table\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Ikea</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>We're always looking for the best products to test and recommend to our readers. We'll continue to test kids tables for a future update to this guide.&#160;</p><p><strong><a href=\"https://go.skimresources.com?id=35871X943606&#38;xs=1&#38;url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.ikea.com%2Fus%2Fen%2Fp%2Fflisat-childrens-table-50298418%2F\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Ikea Flisat Children's Table</a></strong>: This table has a flat top, but it can also become a sensory table with two storage bins that fit inside. It was out of stock at the time of our testing, so we're looking forward to trying it out for a future update.&#160;</p>\n\tFAQs about tables for kids\n\t\n\t<h3>What are the benefits of tables for kids?&#160;</h3><p>Both of our experts emphasized the importance of ergonomic positioning so kids can be comfortable and have support for their bodies. \"We all benefit from having our feet supported either on the floor or a sturdy footrest so a child-size chair might support a child in being able to more comfortably place their feet on the floor,\" Stoffel told Insider Reviews.&#160;</p><p>Stoffel also explained that this position helps support the upper body and allows kids to have more coordination and control in their hands. Warburg emphasized this as well. \"Dangling feet cause children to round their backs and lead to back pain and sloppy handwriting,\" she said.</p><p>Warburg noted that having a good table and chair fit is critical when kids are expected to sit for long periods of time. Having proper positioning is helpful for eating, completing school work, completing artwork, and playing and kids might even sit for longer periods of time for meals or homework if they're seated comfortably.&#160;</p><p>\"Another benefit of a chil- size table and chair is that it gives the child a specific and special place for daily activities,\" Stoffel said. \"Knowing the table and chair are their own, the child might be more motivated or invested in the activity.\"</p><hr /><h3>How can I tell if a table is the right size for my child?&#160;</h3><p>According to Warburg, a good table allows a child to sit with their feet flat on the floor. Tabletop height&#160; should be 2 inches above the height of the elbow when the child is sitting. Hips, knees, and ankles should also be at 90-degree angles when the child is seated.</p><p>Stoffel added that kids should be able to gently rest their elbows on the table without reaching up or leaning down.&#160;She also gave us an example of what a child might look like if the chair and table are not a supportive size. \"You might observe the child squirming, shifting around in the seat, getting up from the table frequently or demonstrating decreased success with fine motor tasks,\" she said.</p>\n\tOur sources\n\t\n\t<aside class=\"breakout-box headline-regular\"><ul><li><p><a href=\"https://ahs.uic.edu/occupational-therapy/directory/stoffel-ashley/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Ashley Stoffel</a>, OTD, OTR/L, FAOTA, is a clinical associate professor of occupational therapy at University of Illinois College of Applied Health Science. She is the director of the UIC OT Faculty Practice: Children, Youth &#38; Families, which provides occupational therapy services to children and families in the Chicago area. Stoffel also serves as the occupational therapy discipline and training coordinator for the Illinois Leadership Education in Neurodevelopmental and Related Disabilities (LEND) Program.</p></li><li><p><a href=\"https://www.potsot.com/chaye-lamm-warburg\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Chaye Lamm Warburg</a>, DPS, OTR/L, is a lab instructor in the master's degree program in occupational therapy at New York University. She has been a practicing occupational therapist since 1976, focusing on pediatrics for most of her career. She founded Pediatric Occupational Therapy Services, LLC (POTS), a private occupational therapy practice that is committed to providing children and families with cutting-edge treatment to empower each child to maximize their potential.&#160;</p></li></ul></aside>\n</div><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/best-kids-table'>Business 38_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=pdU9tK0Geyk:3Ihy9FSh5BQ:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn90@2020_4/2021/05/01/06-42-24-802_534a4fffd5b513fb.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/pdU9tK0Geyk":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn27@2020_1/2021/05/01/06-42-25-350_ca27107684c20a6a.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1619851324327},{"createdTime":"2021-05-01 14:42:04","updatedTime":"2021-05-01 14:42:04","title":"The 5 best BBQ smokers in 2021","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/the-best-bbq-smoker","description":"<bi-shortcode id=\"table-of-contents-sticky\" class=\"mceNonEditable\" data-type=\"h2\">Table of Contents: Masthead Sticky</bi-shortcode><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>A smoker is a great way to preserve food and spend some quality time outdoors.</li>\n<li aria-level=\"1\">Our favorite smoker for most people is the <a href=\"https://go.skimresources.com?id=35871X943606&xs=1&url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.traegergrills.com%2Fpellet-grills%2Fpro%2F575ro%2F575\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Traeger Pro 575 Pellet Grill</a>.</li>\n<li id=\"recirc\">It offers steady temperature regulation and has a small learning curve, but the right one for you might vary.</li>\n</ul><p>Smokers can be a lot of fun, and as involved or hands-off as you like. These days, you can even tend (at least in part) to your smoker via WiFi from the comfort of your couch while your food fumigates and your pellet grill feeds itself and changes temperature and smokiness at your command.</p><p>On the other end of the spectrum, there are barrel smokers, otherwise known as stick burners, which are traditionally cut out of 55-gallon steel drums. These require meticulous oversight and tending, over which many professional careers have been spent.</p><p>In between, there are charcoal, electric (sans pellets), and propane smokers. The thing to keep in mind when purchasing one is how much time you want to spend hunched over or standing beside it, and how smokey you really want your food. They&#39;re all great options according to Steven Raichlen, TV host of <a href=\"https://barbecuebible.com/barbecue-university/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Barbecue University</a>, <a href=\"https://www.stevenraichlen.com/programs/project-smoke/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Project Smoke</a>, and author of dozens of books on barbecuing (including his forthcoming release, &#34;<a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/How-Grill-Vegetables-Bible-Barbecuing/dp/1523509848?tag=biipgf_032219_best-bbq-smokers-20\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">How to Grill Vegetables</a>&#34;).</p><p>Before testing out smokers, we sifted through countless reviews, spoke with several other chefs, and walked the floors of The Home Depot and Lowe&#39;s to get a feel for what was out there.</p><p>Below, we offer recommendations across each of the categories listed above, and while we haven&#39;t yet tested enough stick burners (smokers that use log splits or &#34;sticks&#34;) to determine our top pick in that category, we managed a few recommendations for those looking to dive headfirst into wood-smoking.</p><h2>Here are the best BBQ smokers in 2021</h2><ul class=\"summary-list\"><li><strong>Best smoker overall: </strong><a href=\"https://go.skimresources.com?id=35871X943606&xs=1&url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.traegergrills.com%2Fpellet-grills%2Fpro%2F575ro%2F575\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored\"><strong>Traeger Pro 575 Pellet Grill</strong></a></li><li><strong>Best charcoal smoker: </strong><a href=\"https://go.skimresources.com?id=35871X943606&xs=1&url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.weber.com%2FUS%2Fen%2Fgrills%2Fcharcoal-grills%2Fsmokey-mountain%2Fsmokey-mountain-cooker-smoker-18%2F721001.html001.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\"><strong>Weber 18&#34; Smokey Mountain</strong></a></li><li><strong>Best propane smoker:</strong> <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/dp/B01GFLYWVK?tag=biipgf_032219_best-bbq-smokers-20\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored\"><strong>Cuisinart 36&#34; Vertical Propane Smoker</strong></a></li><li><strong>Best electric smoker: </strong><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/reviews/out?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.lowes.com%2Fpd%2FMasterbuilt-Digital-Electric-Smoker%2F5001374837\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow nofollow noopener sponsored sponsored nofollow sponsored\"><strong>Masterbuilt 30&#34; Electric Smoker</strong></a></li><li><strong>Best versatile smoker: </strong><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/reviews/out?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.campchef.com%2Fwood-pellet-grills-and-accessories%2Fwoodwind-grills%2Fwoodwind-wifi-24.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored\"><strong>Camp Chef Woodwind Wifi 24</strong></a></li></ul><aside class=\"quick-tip headline-regular\"><p><strong>Updated on 04/30/2021: </strong>We rewrote this guide after testing three new smokers and interviewing Barbecue University TV host and author Steven Raichlen and Shola Olunloyo of Studio Kitchen, who is also Stone Hill Farms&#39; Chef-in-Residence. Steven John contributed to an earlier version of this guide.</p></aside>\n<div id=\"slideshow\">\n\tThe best smoker overall\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/608c64f934af8d001859a5dd?format=jpeg\" alt=\"best smoker overall\" height=\"3024\" width=\"4032\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Amazon</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3>If you're going to buy just one grill for barbecuing, <a href=\"https://go.skimresources.com?id=35871X943606&#38;xs=1&#38;url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.traegergrills.com%2Fpellet-grills%2Fpro%2F575\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Traeger's Pro 575</a> is a tank built to maintain perfect temperature and last well over a decade.</h3><aside class=\"breakout-box headline-regular\"><ul><li><strong>Warranty: </strong>Three-year limited</li><li><strong>Cooking surface area: </strong>575 square inches</li><li><strong>Max temperature: </strong>500 degrees Fahrenheit</li></ul></aside><p><strong>Pros: </strong>Excellent temperature control, WiFi-equipped, hefty steel built to last</p><p><strong>Cons: </strong>WiFi connectivity could be better, LCD interface not as intuitive as others, not modular like some other brands</p><p>Whether you're just getting into barbecuing or you've spent more days than you can count hunched over a stick burner, a pellet grill like <a href=\"https://go.skimresources.com?id=35871X943606&#38;xs=1&#38;url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.traegergrills.com%2Fpellet-grills%2Fpro%2F575\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Traeger's Pro 575</a> is hassle-free and offers steady temperature and smoke. It's also the heaviest-duty grill we've found for less than a thousand dollars.</p><p>One of the most important things about a smoker, or any barbecue grill that you're going to operate for hours at a time, is heat retention. If you can't keep steady heat, you're really going to struggle to time and cook your food to perfection. We've tried multiple pellet grills (see more below), and while they've all done their job swimmingly, the Traeger is built with the thickest steel and maintains a temperature within about five degrees of your target. Try and do that with a manual charcoal or wood-burning grill and you'll have your work cut out for you (you'll also learn quickly why Pitmasters earn their distinction).</p><p>Frankly, apart from the quality of the steel, all pellet grills follow the same design, more or less. Traeger might be the original, but there are plenty of other brands that come close, and if you want to save some money, Raichlen suggests looking to <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/reviews/out?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.target.com%2Fb%2Fgreen-mountain-grills%2F-%2FN-a2mur\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow nofollow noopener sponsored sponsored\">Green Mountain Grills' models</a>.&#160;</p><p>We had some trouble connecting to WiFi using this grill. Our router was on the other side of two brick walls, and it couldn't hold a connection. Though since relocating it, a lone wall hasn't been a problem.&#160;</p><p>Traeger, like many other brands, falls short in the way of accessories. <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/reviews/out?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.campchef.com%2Fwood-pellet-grills-and-accessories%2Fwoodwind-grills%2Fwoodwind-wifi-24.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Camp Chef's Woodwind WiFi series</a>, which we also recommend, is modular; you can add on grill boxes, a 28,000 BTU side-burner (great for searing, boils, and clam bakes), a pizza oven, and much more.&#160;</p><p>If all you want your pellet grill to do is smoke and grill (they all max out at around 500 degrees Fahrenheit, so you won't necessarily pull off any high-heat searing), Traeger's is the one that's built the best and made to last the longest, which is why we think it's worth spending a little extra.</p>\n\tThe best charcoal smoker\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/608c66df34af8d001859a5ef?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Weber Smokey MOuntain Smoker\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Weber</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3><a href=\"https://go.skimresources.com?id=35871X943606&#38;xs=1&#38;url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.weber.com%2FUS%2Fen%2Fgrills%2Fcharcoal-grills%2Fsmokey-mountain%2Fsmokey-mountain-cooker-smoker-18%2F721001.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Weber's 18\" Smokey Mountain</a> has the same timeless and sturdy design as its Original Kettle, only better-equipped for smoking.</h3><aside class=\"breakout-box headline-regular\"><ul><li><strong>Available sizes:</strong> 14\", 18\", 22\"</li><li><strong>Cooking surface area:</strong> 481 square inches</li><li><strong>Max temperature: </strong>N/A, since this is a coal fire</li><li><strong>Warranty: </strong>10-year limited on the grill itself, 5-year limited on the grates, 2-year on all other parts<strong>.</strong></li></ul></aside><p><strong>Pros: </strong>Simple but effective, full manual control, small but plenty of cooking area</p><p><strong>Cons: </strong>Labor-intensive, difficult to maintain temperature control</p><p>When it comes to charcoal smokers, there are almost too many designs to consider. That said, unless you're throwing massive backyard barbecues, smoking multiple briskets, or dealing with entire hogs, you probably don't need a ginormous offset barrel smoker (however alluring it may look).&#160;</p><p>We find that <a href=\"https://go.skimresources.com?id=35871X943606&#38;xs=1&#38;url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.weber.com%2FUS%2Fen%2Fgrills%2Fcharcoal-grills%2Fsmokey-mountain%2Fsmokey-mountain-cooker-smoker-18%2F721001.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Weber's Smokey Mountain series' 18-inch smoker</a> offers the most for the casual at-home smoker. It has a relatively small footprint of about 20 inches, is made with the same solid steel and porcelain enamel as the brand's Original Kettle grills, and it will outlast most charcoal smokers on the market for the same price.</p><p>If you do want a large offset smoker, Raichlen says look to Horizon, Yoder, or Lang &#8212; I'd also add Texas Originals to the list &#8212; but know that they'll all weigh hundreds of pounds, and cost you four figures. We plan on testing these larger grills soon.</p><p>Depending on the amount of cooking surface area you require, you can size up to <a href=\"https://go.skimresources.com?id=35871X943606&#38;xs=1&#38;url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.weber.com%2FUS%2Fen%2Fgrills%2Fcharcoal-grills%2Fsmokey-mountain%2Fsmokey-mountain-cooker-smoker-22%2F731001.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">22 inches (726 square inches)</a> or down to <a href=\"https://go.skimresources.com?id=35871X943606&#38;xs=1&#38;url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.weber.com%2FUS%2Fen%2Fgrills%2Fcharcoal-grills%2Fsmokey-mountain%2Fsmokey-mountain-cooker-smoker-14%2F711001.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">14 inches (286 square inches)</a>, but we think the 481 square inches offered by the 18-inch model (between two vertically integrated grates) is plenty for most.</p><p>Setting this grill up is easy and straightforward, and once assembled, a pile of charcoal (we recommend <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-charcoal\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">hardwood charcoal</a>), some wood-smoking chips (or split wood), and a basin (included) filled with water are all you need. You'll have to keep on top of the fire and airflow throughout to find the perfect balance &#8212; and make no mistake, that is an art unto itself, but also part of the fun.</p><p>I've spent the better part of a decade tinkering with and smoking all sorts of things with this very grill, and looking back on that experience I can say this: my most monumental successes in smoking have occurred on this very smoker, but so too have my greatest failures. If these prospects don't appeal to you, save yourself the anguish and consider a pellet, propane, or electric smoker instead.</p><p>Approach this grill for what it is knowing that while it's in some ways a starter smoker, and one that you can easily store away or station in tighter spots, it will allow you to produce a wide variety of superb smoked goods.</p>\n\tThe best propane smoker\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/608c67a6f22c6b00185db12b?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Cuisinart Smoker\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Amazon</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3><a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/dp/B01GFLYWVK?tag=biipgf_032219_best-bbq-smokers-20\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Cuisinart's 36\" Vertical Propane Smoker</a> is easy to use, maintains steady heat, and fits anywhere a mini fridge would.</h3><aside class=\"breakout-box headline-regular\"><ul><li><strong>Available sizes: </strong>36\"</li><li><strong>Cooking surface area: </strong>784 square inches</li><li><strong>Max temperature: </strong>400 degrees Fahrenheit</li><li><strong>Warranty: </strong>Three-year limited</li></ul></aside><p><strong>Pros: </strong>Convenient, consistent, efficient, portable</p><p><strong>Cons: </strong>No timer, requires regularly adding wood chips, no casters</p><p>Propane smokers are among the easiest and most efficient to operate and assemble. They might not impart the same amount of smokiness (adding dry or soaked wood chips hourly helps), and certainly don't create the same ambiance as a fire, but they're convenient and maintain impeccably steady heat.</p><p>We like <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/dp/B01GFLYWVK?tag=biipgf_032219_best-bbq-smokers-20\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Cuisinart's 36-inch Vertical Propane smoker</a> because of its basic but robust steel design. There are very few moving parts, and there's only one control knob. And while this smoker lacks a timer or programming, it's propane, which you'll always need to shut off manually anyhow.</p><p>If you're willing to forego the element of fire, a propane (or an electric) smoker is a great way to go. It requires almost no input from you beyond adding wood chips and igniting a burner. There's also plenty of surface area spread out between four roughly 200-square-inch porcelain-coated stainless steel racks, which is comparable to the cooking surface area of a medium-sized barrel grill. And because it runs on propane, you can load it into the back of a truck for car- or off-grid camping, should you be so inclined.</p><p>The size of <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/dp/B01GFLYWVK?tag=biipgf_032219_best-bbq-smokers-20\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Cuisinart's 36-inch Propane Smoker</a> is also convenient for small spaces or those who prefer to store it in the garage. And thanks to the side handles, it's much easier to put away than some other models. Still, we do wish it had casters because it's a bit heavy for many people.</p><p>Even with an electric grill, this is as easy as smoking gets, and about as compact as well. So, if you don't want to tend to a fire and would rather not pay for wood pellets, this is your best and most efficient option.</p>\n\tThe best electric smoker\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/608c69e034af8d001859a5fd?format=jpeg\" alt=\"The best electric smoker\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Owen Burke/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/reviews/out?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.lowes.com%2Fpd%2FMasterbuilt-Digital-Electric-Smoker%2F5001374837\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\"><strong>Masterbuilt's 30\" Electric Smoker</strong></a><strong> operates with nothing but electricity and wood chips, and is as easy and predictable as smoking gets. </strong></h3><aside class=\"breakout-box headline-regular\"><ul><li><strong>Available sizes: </strong>30\"</li><li><strong>Cooking surface area: </strong>711 square inches</li><li><strong>Max temperature: </strong>275 degrees Fahrenheit</li><li><strong>Warranty: </strong>1-year limited</li></ul></aside><p><strong>Pros: </strong>Intuitive, glass door to check progress, efficient</p><p><strong>Cons: </strong>No casters or handles, short warranty</p><p>Electric smokers are among the easiest smokers to operate. They're insulated, maintain almost perfect temperature control, and can cook for hours and hours without much attention (save for adding wood chips).</p><p><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/reviews/out?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.lowes.com%2Fpd%2FMasterbuilt-Digital-Electric-Smoker%2F5001374837\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Masterbuilt's 30\" Electric Smoker</a> comes practically preassembled (attach the legs, the digital monitor, a latch, and it's ready) and will be up and running with the press of a few buttons.</p><p>There's no fussy fuel to deal with, and all you have to do is remember to deposit a handful (half-cup) of either dry or pre-soaked wood chips, which you'll want to replenish about every hour or so, depending on the temperature you set.</p><p>Vertical electric smokers are the same shape, size, and every bit as straightforward as propane smokers, but without the hassle of dealing with propane (namely, running out of it). The size lets you cook just about everything you would on a mid-sized barrel grill or smoker, and a glass window in the door is a nice touch that allows you to keep an eye on things without having to open it up and lose heat.</p><p>We wish this grill had handles because we have had to move it quite a bit, and there's no great place to get a grip on it. Plan to keep this grill more or less where you park it, and know that you'll need a solid electrical source.</p><p>Adding wood chips might also be sort of a nuisance if you're not familiar with smoking, but it's incredibly easy compared with maintaining a fire, and it also helps you keep things from overcooking. Otherwise, there's not much to worry about with this smoker. We smoked fish, meat, and a pile of vegetables in it and everything came out perfectly, evenly browned and cooked through. This is as fail-safe and as effortless as smoking gets.</p>\n\tThe best versatile smoker\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/608c6a9234af8d001859a5fe?format=jpeg\" alt=\"best versatile smoker\" height=\"768\" width=\"1024\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Owen Burke/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/reviews/out?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.campchef.com%2Fwood-pellet-grills-and-accessories%2Fwoodwind-grills%2Fwoodwind-wifi-24.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Camp Chef's Woodwind WiFi</a> lets you monitor your grill from inside, and it's compatible with many attachments.</h3><aside class=\"breakout-box headline-regular\"><ul><li><strong>Available sizes: </strong>20\", 24\", 36\"</li><li><strong>Cooking surface area: </strong>800 square inches</li><li><strong>Max temperature: </strong>500 degrees Fahrenheit in the pellet grill, and upwards of 600 with the Sidekick</li><li><strong>Warranty:</strong> Three-year limited</li></ul></aside><p><strong>Pros: </strong>Modular with several options for attachments, easy to move, industrial-style casters</p><p><strong>Cons: </strong>Doesn't maintain temperature as well as our top pick (but only a matter of 15 degrees)</p><p>While we like the Traeger Pro series for people specifically looking to smoke and grill (with smoke), we haven't found any pellet grills as versatile as those in the Camp Chef Woodwind series, which we've been testing for nearly two years now.</p><p>Apart from offering remarkably user-friendly interfaces, the smokers in the <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/reviews/out?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.campchef.com%2Fwood-pellet-grills-and-accessories%2Fwoodwind-grills%2Fwoodwind-wifi-24.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Camp Chef Woodwind series</a> (we think the 24-inch model with 800 square inches of cooking surface area is best for most people) are compatible with multiple accessories, and it's hard to imagine something you couldn't cook.&#160;</p><p>As far as attachments, we recommend Camp Chef's 28,000-BTU <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/reviews/out?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.campchef.com%2Fwood-pellet-grills-and-accessories%2Fattachments%2Fsidekick.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Sidekick</a>, an extremely powerful propane burner capable of searing anything and boiling massive stock pots of seafood (we put the latter to the test twice). The Sidekick also comes with a flat-top griddle and a grease catchment system, and you can add on the \"<a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/reviews/out?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.campchef.com%2Fcatalogsearch%2Fresult%2Findex%2Fq%2FOutdoor%2520Oven\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Outdoor Oven</a>\" which is really a stainless steel pizza oven. There's also the <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/reviews/out?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.campchef.com%2Fwood-pellet-grills-and-accessories%2Fattachments%2Fsmokepro-bbq-sear-box.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Sear Box</a>, which works like a miniature propane grill with cast-iron grates and a stainless steel cover.&#160;</p><p>While this grill isn't made of the same hefty steel used in Traeger's Pro series, we haven't encountered any issues with it, and it's already been through two winters, accidentally left uncovered through snow, rain, and even hail, and is no worse for wear. We also really love the casters, which seem to be the same kind you'd find on industrial stainless steel carts.</p><p>If you want a do-it-all outdoor smoker (or grill for that matter) that lets you smoke, grill, braise, bake, boil, and more, this is our favorite modular option.&#160;</p><h3>Read our <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/camp-chef-woodwind-wifi-pellet-grill-smoker-review\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">full review of the Camp Chef Woodwind Wifi 24</a>.</h3>\n\tOur methodology\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/608c6adff22c6b00185db13f?format=jpeg\" alt=\"methodology BBQ smokers\" height=\"3024\" width=\"4032\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Owen Burke/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>We recently retested three of our top picks and, paying careful attention to the heat retention, temperature fluctuations, general ease of use, and the overall quality of the materials and design.</p><p>We also walked through Lowe's and The Home Depot opening and examining every smoker there. We looked at fittings, the quality of the seal between the lid and the grill, and the thickness of the steel.</p><p>We then spoke with several experts including chef Shola Olunloyo of <a href=\"https://www.studiokitchen.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Studio Kitchen</a> and veteran author and Barbecue University TV host <a href=\"https://www.stevenraichlen.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Steven Raichlen</a> to find out what makes a good smoker.&#160;</p><h3>Here's what we looked for in our top picks:</h3><p><strong>Smoking method: </strong>While smoking over hardwood is probably the most fun experience, we all agreed, not everyone wants to spend the better part of a day hunched over a fire. And while pellet grills might not offer the same flavor charcoal and wood-burning grills do, they come mighty close and are almost entirely hands-off.</p><p><strong>Ease of use: </strong>Inextricably linked to the smoking method is the ease of use. The learning curve on wood-burning grills is stratospheric. Pellet grills offer a great balance between smokiness and user-friendliness, but some don't hold a steady temperature all that well, which presents another set of problems.</p><p><strong>Material quality: </strong>Most smokers have to live outside, and while a cover is a worthy investment, a grill is still going to have to withstand the elements. Flimsier metals and cheap wheels were immediately disqualified. Thicker steel and industrial-grade casters were positive points, especially on competitively priced smokers.</p><p><strong>Performance: </strong>Because heat retention and maintenance of a consistent temperature is so paramount to smoking, we chose grills that excelled in those areas with little oversight. In the case of charcoal or wood-burning, you are entirely on your own.</p><p><strong>Warranty: </strong>We considered warranty to a degree, and looked for at least two years, but in the case of some picks we made concessions. In the end, the grill is only so good as the quality of the materials and build, and it's hard to call in a warranty on something like a grill or smoker because \"normal wear and tear\" involves starting fires and spilling grease. Plus, it's going to live outdoors. We find that investing in a grill that's built to last is ultimately the better consideration.</p>\n\tWhat else we tested\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/608847440da8f40018033bf5?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Best charcoal grill 2021 what we’re testing next\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Owen Burke/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p><a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B010759GGQ/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_032219_best-bbq-smokers-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B010759GGQ&#38;linkId=2d878a560fe21c008c41b51cb34df510\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\"><strong>Dyna-Glo Wide Body Vertical Offset Charcoal Smoker</strong></a>: The Dyna-Glo is a fine grill in design, but we're not convinced that it will last more than a few seasons based on looking at the materials used. Expensive as it is, there are plenty of options that will probably well outlast it for a little more money.</p><p><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/reviews/out?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.homedepot.com%2Fp%2FNexgrill-29-in-Barrel-Charcoal-Grill-Smoker-in-Black-810-0029%2F306148311\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\"><strong>Nexgrill 29-inch Barrel Charcoal Grill/Smoker</strong></a><strong>:</strong> If you're on a tight budget or you just want a charcoal grill (and smoker) in a pinch, this is the best you're going to do. Our hesitation is that this is one of those grills that you could outfit with gaskets to function very well, but the quality of the parts means it's not destined to survive past a couple of years with moderate use.</p>\n\tWhat we're testing next\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/608c6bcef22c6b00185db142?format=jpeg\" alt=\"What we&#39;re testing next bbq smokers\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Amazon</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p><a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00OMWWRPI/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_032219_best-bbq-smokers-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B00OMWWRPI&#38;linkId=212371dca32be055b12bc590250d62b3\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\"><strong>Broil King Offset Smoker</strong></a><strong>: </strong>Based on inspection in-store and in a neighbor's front patio, this grill seems like it will last a while and costs less than most higher-end brands. We're planning to have a better look and try it out soon. All that said, keep in mind that charcoal smokers require a lot of attention, and you have to dedicate yourself to maintaining the right temperature.</p><p><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/reviews/out?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.target.com%2Fb%2Fgreen-mountain-grills%2F-%2FN-a2mur\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\"><strong>Green Mountain Grills</strong></a>: We've been hearing a lot about Green Mountain Grills' pellet grill as a great budget option, and Steven Raichlen tells us he's a fan, too. We'll be trying one as soon as we can.</p><p><a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B0851FJM4D/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biipgf_032219_best-bbq-smokers-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B0851FJM4D&#38;linkId=b389265b0701934f1925f60c0330c001\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\"><strong>Masterbuilt Gravity Series 1080</strong></a><strong>:</strong> A self-feeding charcoal grill is enticing; it offers all the flavor of a charcoal fire without having to maintain the right balance of coals (and temperature) on your own. We've heard good things, and we'll be trying one out soon.</p>\n\tFAQs\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/608c6c31f22c6b00185db143?format=jpeg\" alt=\"FAQ BBQ smoker\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Owen Burke/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3>What is the easiest type of smoker to use?</h3><p>The easiest smoker to use is far and away an electric smoker, followed by a propane or pellet smoker. This is because each of these smokers maintains temperature automatically, so as long as you have your fuel (wood chips, propane, or pellets, respectively), you don't have to do much of anything at all.</p><p>When it comes to charcoal and wood- or stick-burning smokers, you have your work cut out for you, and have to maintain the right amount of fuel to keep the temperature as close to your target as possible.</p><hr /><h3>What can I put on a smoker?</h3><p>You can put just about anything you'd eat on a smoker. Meat is what most of us associate with smokers, but vegetables, fruits, and all types of seafood can be extraordinary on the grill. Figuring out the endless options and recipes is part of the fun of taking up smoking as a hobby.</p><hr /><h3>How do I make a brine?</h3><p>When you want to smoke food, oftentimes a recipe will call for a marinade or brine. You can do this any number of ways, and arguments will abound until the end of time over how to make the perfect brine, but here's a basic recipe for preparing and smoking with a brine, start to finish:</p><p>Note: You'll want to start this process between about four and 24 hours ahead of starting your smoker.</p><ul><li aria-level=\"1\">Add a 1:1 ratio of salt and sugar into a gallon of water in a stock pot.</li><li aria-level=\"1\">Heat up to a boil, or until the salt and pepper dissolve.&#160;</li><li aria-level=\"1\">Add any herbs or other seasonings.</li><li aria-level=\"1\">Let it cool for at least an hour or two, then place it in the fridge.</li><li aria-level=\"1\">Once cool, add food and let marinate for anywhere from a couple of hours (vegetables, lighter meats and seafoods) to 12 or even 24 hours (beef, pork).</li><li aria-level=\"1\">Remove food from the brine, pat dry, and light the grill.</li><li aria-level=\"1\">Add any dry rub or glaze you want to put on.</li><li aria-level=\"1\">Wipe or spray grill with a little cooking oil. You can use olive oil or any oil of your choice, and because you're cooking at low heat, you don't have to worry about smoke or burning points.</li><li aria-level=\"1\">Apply food, checking regularly to make sure fuel and temperature remain consistent.</li><li aria-level=\"1\">Remove when ready (a thermometer helps).</li></ul>\n\tCheck out our other grilling guides\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5cffbdcf6fc92029333b2f6f?format=jpeg\" alt=\"The Home Depot grills best smoker 2021\" height=\"600\" width=\"800\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">The Home Depot</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<ul class=\"summary-list\"><li><a href=\"http://www.businessinsider.com/best-gas-grill\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">The best gas grills</a></li><li><a href=\"http://www.businessinsider.com/best-charcoal-grill\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">The best charcoal grills</a></li><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-charcoal\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">The best charcoal for grilling</a></li></ul>\n</div><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on ttp://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=4putwGIRdF4:9j6Mws8VcQU:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn20@2020_6/2021/05/01/06-42-22-924_1fa21696e0687966.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn15@2020_2/2021/05/01/06-42-23-338_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=4putwGIRdF4:9j6Mws8VcQU:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn23@2020_3/2021/05/01/06-42-21-332_582e0fb6b667b797.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/4putwGIRdF4":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn31@2020_5/2021/05/01/06-42-24-630_79780d29d6b88196.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1619851324347},{"createdTime":"2021-05-01 14:42:04","updatedTime":"2021-05-01 14:42:04","title":"'A self-parody of a SPAC': The mysterious $100 million New Jersey deli is actually an investment vehicle backed by a firm in Hong Kong","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/new-jersey-deli-spac-hometown-international-100-million-hong-kong-2021-4","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/608c46cb35c46f0018c0baaf?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Your Hometown Deli\" height=\"774\" width=\"1548\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Google Maps</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul><li><strong>The $100 million deli that was highlighted in famed investor David Einhorn&#39;s letter to clients earlier this month is actually seeking to strike a deal.</strong></li><li><strong>A Hong Kong-based firm that is invested in Hometown International views the company as a &#34;mini-SPAC,&#34; seeking a merger worth up to $600 million.</strong></li><li><strong>The multibillion-dollar endowments of Duke and Vanderbilt also own a slice of the deli, according to <a href=\"https://www.ft.com/content/4a6d0864-eb26-4e54-8ab5-ffad2e8166ee\">a Financial Times report. </a></strong></li><li aria-level=\"1\"><a href=\"https://newsletter.businessinsider.com/join/4np/10-things-opening-bell?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingest?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingest?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingest?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingest?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingest?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingest?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingestarkets&#38;utm_medium=ingest\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\"><strong>Sign up here for our daily newsletter, 10 Things Before the Opening Bell</strong></a><strong>.</strong></li></ul><hr><p>The <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/news/stocks/new-jersey-deli-hometown-international-sales-market-cap-david-einhorn-2021-4-1030312707\">$100 million deli called out as an example of froth</a> in the stock market by Greenlight Capital&#39;s David Einhorn earlier this month is more than just a deli.</p><p>According to <a href=\"https://www.ft.com/content/4a6d0864-eb26-4e54-8ab5-ffad2e8166ee\">a Financial Times report,</a> the deli&#39;s parent company Hometown International is actually a &#34;mini-SPAC&#34; that is ultimately seeking to make a deal that could be worth up to $600 million while it <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/eating-at-the-100-million-new-jersey-deli-2021-4\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">slings Philly cheesesteaks</a> from its single New Jersey-based location.</p><p>&#34;[This] is a self-parody of a SPAC, and that is what I would expect at the end of a bubble,&#34; Columbia University law professor John Coffee told the Financial Times. </p><p>The deli, which has been thinly traded on the over the counter exchange since 2015, is partially owned by Hong Kong-based Maso Capital. Through Maso, the multibillion dollar endowments of Vanderbilt and Duke University have invested a total of about $2 million into Hometown International, according to the report. </p><p>Hometown told investors that it plans to use its remaining cash to fund a business acquisition.</p><p>&#34;We will not restrict our potential candidate target companies to any specific business, industry or geographical location,&#34; it said. </p><p>That&#39;s SPAC-talk for &#34;we are shopping for any potential deal with our cash.&#34; At the end of the day, Hometown International is a shell company that hopes to execute a reverse merger with a larger, more successful private company, but also happens to operate an actual deli in the meantime. </p><p><em><strong>Read more:</strong> <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/crypto-arbitrage-trading-strategy-alameda-research-sam-bankman-fried-billionaire-2021-4\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">A 29-year-old self-made billionaire breaks down how he achieved daily returns of 10% on million-dollar crypto trades, and shares how to find the best opportunities</a></em></p><p>Maso Capital&#39;s co-chief investment officer Manoj Jain told the Financial Times that Hometown International is targeting a deal that would be worth between $300 million and $600 million, and that its OTC structure will save it millions of dollars, given how costly setting up an actual SPAC investment vehicle can be.</p><p>&#34;[Hometown] is a more flexible structure...with a longer time to find a target, and a better economic uplift,&#34; Jain said. Most SPAC vehicles only give the managers two years to locate and execute a deal, or else they are required to return investors money. A corporate shell that is seeking a reverse merger has no such time requirement. </p><p>&#34;It works like a mini-SPAC. When you execute the merger, the name changes, the ticker changes, the board changes, the management changes, everything changes, as the merged entity enters the US capital market,&#34; Jain explained. </p><p>But executing a merger deal might be harder for Hometown International, due to the increased media attention and the <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/news/stocks/hometown-international-100-million-new-jersey-deli-delisted-david-einhorn-2021-4-1030333722\">OTC&#39;s decision to delist the stock last week.</a> Still, <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/news/stocks/hometown-international-stock-price-volume-surge-100-million-deli-einhorn-2021-4-1030319385\">that hasn&#39;t hurt shares of the deli,</a> which traded near record highs at $12.55 as of Friday afternoon. </p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/new-jersey-deli-spac-hometown-international-100-million-hong-kong-2021-4'>Business Insider</a></div><div class=\"feedflare\">\n<a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=fFOLYRpFKcg:pTWejxs2lQ0:yIl2AUoC8zA\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a
